email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-GTK2
email.body:
Why does PHP-GTK2 needs version 5.1 to compile (and run) why is it more usefull than version 5?
On the moment the cvs version of PHP-GTK2 doesn't compile (I use PHP 5.1 RC 1)
make: *** No rule to make target `main/php_gtk_ext.c', needed by `main/php_gtk_ext.lo'. Stop.
How can I fix this? thanks
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-GTK2
email.body:
Hi Nathan,
Start from scratch, and try again it sounds like the makefile isn't being created the way it should be. Take a look through archives and you'll know as much as I do about Linux builds :) but this one's just been altered, so it could be buggy.
PHP 5.1 was about 20% faster than 5.0 last time I checked... and it's probably got better since then.
----- Original Message ----- From: "PHP" <nathansamson@gmail.com> To: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Sunday, September 04, 2005 12:23 PM Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-GTK2
> Why does PHP-GTK2 needs version 5.1 to compile (and run) why is it more > usefull than version 5? > > On the moment the cvs version of PHP-GTK2 doesn't compile (I use PHP 5.1 > RC 1) > > make: *** No rule to make target `main/php_gtk_ext.c', needed by > `main/php_gtk_ext.lo'. Stop. > > How can I fix this? > thanks > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-GTK2
email.body:
if I do "./buildconf && ./configure && make clean && make" I get an error about libglade xt/libglade/gen_libglade.c -fPIC -DPIC -o ext/libglade/.libs/gen_libglade.o ext/libglade/gen_libglade.c:1: error: syntax error before 'to' ext/libglade/gen_libglade.c:1:56: error: invalid suffix "b" on integer constant make: *** [ext/libglade/gen_libglade.lo] Fout 1
If I open ext/libglade/gen_libglade.c I see "Unable to open file /home/nathan/devel/php-gtk/ext/gtk%2b/gtk.defs" If I do "./buildconf && ./configure --disable-libglade && make clean && make" I get the same error as before (I configured it before also with --disable-glade because I had this error)
But why is PHP 5.1 a dependency why it is only faster? Has it new functions which are used in PHP-GTK2? Op zo, 04-09-2005 te 16:46 +0200, schreef "Steph": > Hi Nathan, > > Start from scratch, and try again it sounds like the makefile isn't being > created the way it should be. Take a look through archives and you'll know > as much as I do about Linux builds :) but this one's just been altered, so > it could be buggy. > > PHP 5.1 was about 20% faster than 5.0 last time I checked... and it's > probably got better since then. > > ----- Original Message ----- > From: "PHP" <nathansamson@gmail.com> > To: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> > Sent: Sunday, September 04, 2005 12:23 PM > Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-GTK2 > > > > Why does PHP-GTK2 needs version 5.1 to compile (and run) why is it more > > usefull than version 5? > > > > On the moment the cvs version of PHP-GTK2 doesn't compile (I use PHP 5.1 > > RC 1) > > > > make: *** No rule to make target `main/php_gtk_ext.c', needed by > > `main/php_gtk_ext.lo'. Stop. > > > > How can I fix this? > > thanks > > > > -- > > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-GTK2
email.body:
> If I open ext/libglade/gen_libglade.c I see > "Unable to open file /home/nathan/devel/php-gtk/ext/gtk%2b/gtk.defs" > If I do "./buildconf && ./configure --disable-libglade && make clean && > make" > I get the same error as before (I configured it before also with > --disable-glade because I had this error)
Nobody's ported libglade to work with PHP-GTK 2 yet, you need to build it with no extensions at all at present.
> But why is PHP 5.1 a dependency why it is only faster? Has it new > functions which are used in PHP-GTK2?
Can you imagine how much difference that 'only faster' makes to offline applications?! It's seriously noticeable on my laptop. PHP-GTK 1 was always a bit 'clunky' under win32 - it's not, now.
Internally, yes there are other bonuses... the Engine's object support is somewhat more robust than it was even in PHP 5.0, and Andrei had to wait for the Zend Engine's changes to become reasonably stable before he even embarked on this. Externally there's PDO (fast & unified database access) and the new date support to consider in 5.1, as well as the inevitable handful of new functions. Take a look at the news file in PHP_5_1 branch if you want details :)
Andrei generally works against PHP's CVS HEAD anyway, but there are definite advantages in working with this version (PHP's CVS HEAD is tangling with Unicode at present so I'd expect him to stay with 5.1 until PHP 6 is close to release).
..
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: [PHP-GTK] Licencing
email.body:
Madeleine D. wrote: > Just MHO - but this message brings up a good point. Shouldn't we have some > kind of obvious link about licensing? And some idea of what it means for > those who don't know much about GNU?
I think this is a valid point. I can't find license information anywhere. Not even a LICENSE file in CVS.
Andrei, (or anyone else who knows) what is the official license for PHP-GTK? Because it is a PHP extension, does the PHP v3.0 license apply be default?
Thanks, Scott
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Compiling PHP-GTK2
email.body:
Hello,
Here is what I got when trying to compile last night (2005-01-31) with the latest CVS files:
make: *** [ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.lo] Error 1 ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.c: In function `phpg_GtkTextAttributes_read_bg_color': ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.c:27510: error: structure has no member named `bg_color' ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.c: In function `phpg_GtkTextAttributes_read_fg_color': ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.c:27521: error: structure has no member named `fg_color' make: *** [ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.lo] Error 1
I would assume that the CVS files are not always supposed to compile since it is still a work in progress. Is there any CVS tag that I can use for the last know compileable files?
Thanks, Scott
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] #32175 [Opn]: foreach() semantics broken between 4.3.9 and 4.3.10
email.body:
ID: 32175 Updated by: jsjohnst@php.net -Summary: could not load php_gtk.so Reported By: ccollazos2001 at yahoo dot com Status: Open Bug Type: PHP-GTK related -Operating System: Fedore Core 2 +Operating System: Linux PHP Version: 4.3.10 New Comment:
Are you making sure that the extension is loaded via the php.ini or via dl() ??
Does PHP-GTK show up in the list of extensions in a phpinfo() list?
Previous Comments: ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[2005-03-03 16:03:10] ccollazos2001 at yahoo dot com
Description: ------------ I compiled php-gtk as directed. The compilation when OK so I did not get any error. Also when I run make install everything went OK. When I try a simple sample (hello world) it just give the error that it can not load php_gtk.so even this library is there and the extensions are in correct place (use/libl/php4).
I installed php-gtk on windows and it runs correctly.
------------------------------------------------------------------------

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] create_tag is not implemented
email.body:
Hello
I'm doing some test with PHP-GTK2 and I'm using GtkTextView, GtkTextBuffer and GtktextTag ... I want to use create_tag method with the GtkTextBuffer object but this method is not implemented, I read the gtk.defs file and here the funcion is declarated but when I run code PHP says:
PHP Ftal error: Call undefined method GtkTextBuffer::create_tag()
Why?¿ Any suggestion?¿
I read the PHP-GTK2 conferences docs of Andrei and there is an example of GtkTextView with tags ... this is posible or is and screenshot of the other language?¿
regards
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] How to get version of php-gtk?
email.body:
Hi
Is there a way to get the version of the php-gtk2 extension at runtime? If yes, please tell me - Gtk::check_version(..) doesn't really help as it checks the Gtk version, not the PHP-Gtk version. If not, we'd definitely need one for e.g. the pear dep checks.
-- Regards/MfG, Christian Weiske
["signature.asc" (application/pgp-signature)]

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] How to get version of php-gtk?
email.body:
No, you wouldn't.
I don't know of a way to check, say, the GD version via a function in PHP.
I do know that if the GTK version is > 1 and the PHP version is > 5.1 it must be PHP-GTK 2.
----- Original Message ----- From: "Christian Weiske" <cweiske@cweiske.de> To: "PHP-GTK Dev list" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Sunday, October 23, 2005 5:34 AM Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] How to get version of php-gtk?
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] How to get version of php-gtk?

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: Correct PEAR package.xml php-gtk dependency tag?
email.body:
Christian Weiske wrote: > Hi > > > Does somebody know what the correct dependency tag for php-gtk and > php-gtk2 are? > It's just the problem that I want to make sure that php-gtk or php-gtk2 > are installed when a certain PEAR package is installed. All current > Gtk_* packages have no php-gtk dependency, which isn't that good.
Is this even possible? The PEAR installer won't necessarily be using php-gtk itself (command-line installer installing gtk packages, for instance).
Please advise, Greg
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.senderName: "timo dot schmid at gmail dot com"
email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] #33472 [Com]: header redirection at the middle of PHP+HTML file
email.body:
ID: 33472 Comment by: timo dot schmid at gmail dot com Reported By: tarun27in at gmail dot com Status: Open Bug Type: PHP-GTK related Operating System: Windows Xp PHP Version: 4.3.10 New Comment:
This is not a Bug, this is becaus the Headers of your Page MUST been sent BEFORE you output any Text/Html. Use the following instead: <script type="text/javascript"> document.location = 'http://www.php.net'; </script>
Previous Comments: ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[2005-06-25 13:08:42] tarun27in at gmail dot com
Description: ------------ Though I m not a php guru but still i have been obsessed with a big with header location which often troubles me a lot , I often use html tags in php file as i use dreamweaver as html editor and whenever i want to redirect to some remote url in the middle of the page it always prompt me of a warning that headers already sent , i have researched a lot but didn't find any satisfactory solutions. Though i was able to redirect via javascript href tag but i think thats quite a bug as I also designed sites on ASP and response.redirect works anywhere in a file.
Just want to take in to your considerations.
thanks and regards TARUN SHARMA
------------------------------------------------------------------------
-- Edit this bug report at http://bugs.php.net/?id=33472&edit=1
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

Though i was able to > redirect via javascript href tag but i think thats quite a bug as I > also designed sites on ASP and response.redirect works anywhere in a > file. > > Just want to take in to your considerations. > > thanks and regards > TARUN SHARMA
Already tryed with output_buffering = On in your php.ini ?
-- Alessandro Sappia Le informazioni contenute nella presente comunicazione possono essere riservate e sono, comunque, destinate esclusivamente alle persone o alla Societa' sopraindicati. La diffusione del documento trasmesso da parte di qualsiasi soggetto diverso dal destinatario e' proibita, sia ai sensi dell'art. 616 c.p. , che ai sensi del D.Lgs. n. 196/2003. Se avete ricevuto questo messaggio per errore, vi preghiamo di distruggerlo e di informarmi immediatamente inviando un messaggio all'indirizzo e-mail a.sappia@ngi.it.

email.subject: Fw: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-GTK2 mysql Extensions? - fixed
email.body:
http://ftp.emini.dk/pub/php/win32/gtk2/ now carries an updated version of the .dll and .exe files for PHP 5.1 and PHP-GTK 2, and a gentle explanation of what the term 'API bump' means.
Apologies for any inconvenience.
- Steph
----- Original Message ----- From: "Steph" <steph@zend.com> To: "Joshua Seward" <jseward@columbus.rr.com>; "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Saturday, October 01, 2005 4:10 PM Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-GTK2 mysql Extensions?
> Hi Josh, > > Sorry, blame the weekend - I was AFK for the whole of this thread. > > The snapshot version of PHP is created directly from CVS. It is not the > same version as those available on php.net. The only 5_1 version you could > possibly have picked up from php.net is a release candidate dating back two > months. There've been a lot of changes since then, including a Zend API > version bump which will prevent recent extensions from working with that > version of PHP. As Frank suggested, you can run php -v to check the PHP > version you have there. Next time you report a problem, running php-v and > copy/pasting the output in your first email would make it much easier for us > all to understand what's going on. > > The extensions in the snaps zip work with the snapshot version of php.exe, > and you load them in exactly the same way as you normally would, which is: > > extension = php-gtk2.dll > extension = php_mysql.dll > > unlike PHP-GTK extensions, which are written as a comma-separated list. > > php_mysql.dll isn't available in PECL, and never has been. That's why it's > in the snaps zip, along with the version of PHP it was built against and a > copy of the library needed to run it. Occasionally a build can fail, and > that also applies to extension builds in the CVS branches. Nobody's > perfect, and all four branches are under some form of active development, > ranging from 'bug fixes only' to 'bleeding-edge experimental'. So > _occasionally_ you might get the situation where you need to go back to > snaps and start over because an extension doesn't work (making sure that the > extension author knows about the bug and has fixed it first, of course). > But it's relatively rare for that to happen with the core extensions, > because build problems are usually reported quite quickly. > > You need to pick up the most recent copy of PHP 5_1 branch from the snaps > box if you're planning to load other extensions alongside PHP, as it says in > my INSTALL.txt, and if php-gtk2.dll won't load I'll need to know about it so > I can rebuild PHP-GTK 2 against that version and put a working version on > the site. In fact I just now tested it, and it _doesn't_ load, because > there was an API bump on 22nd September that I wasn't aware of. That was > the problem I needed to know about, and it means I need to build a new > version of php-gtk2.dll against the CVS version of PHP 5.1-dev so that you > can use it with the latest snaps. I'll mail the list as soon as I've made > that version live, but it'll probably be some time tomorrow. > > When we have an official PHP 5.1 release, it will become much easier to deal > with all this - you'll be able to use www.php.net for the PHP and extensions > download, and I'll build against that edition. But RC 1 is _not_ an > official release, and the fact that this particular one hasn't been followed > by further release candidates in the space of two months says it wasn't > anywhere near stable enough for release material. In fact Zeev tried to roll > RC 2 in mid-September and found it still wasn't ready, so didn't go ahead > with that plan. That being the situation, we absolutely need to rely on the > snaps builds for now, for any form of win32 distribution. > > BTW, Edin just made it easier to pick up the correct individual PECL > extension for the branch you're using - take a look at > http://pecl4win.php.net/branch.php. He also (now) links to the relevant list > on that site, from the snaps site, so nobody needs to download a big zipfile > to get a single PECL extension any more. > > Hope that makes everything a bit clearer, > > - Steph > > > ----- Original Message ----- > From: "Joshua Seward" <jseward@columbus.rr.com> > To: "PHP DEV" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> > Sent: Saturday, October 01, 2005 7:49 AM > Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-GTK2 mysql Extensions? > > > Problem Solved! > > > > After getting sleep, I smacked myself for doing everything backwards. > > > > The only extensions that would load with the php-gtk2.dll are the ones from > the main php.net site. > > I tried this on the 8000 time. Please stop sending people to the snapshot > website. They are not the correct build. > > I guarantee this!!!!!! > > > > There is a fault in the php_mysqli.dll though. Windows command crashes every > time php-gtk2 tries to load it. > > The php_mysql.dll and other work fine. > > > > Sorry for all the bad e-mails before and thank you all for your time and > patience. > > > > Thanks Again, > > Josh > >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] drawing functions
email.body:
It's not a static method.
$n = new GtkWindow(); $d = new GtkDrawingArea(); $n->add($d); $n->show_all(); $a = new GdkGC($d->window); $d->window->draw_rectangle($a, true, 4, 4, 580, 340);
I think..
-Andrei

Can anyone tell me how to make php-gtk find the libmysql file?
Thanks again,
Josh

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] digging into enums and flags
email.body:
What's not sane about the message shown by PHP? People should use error_reporting(E_ALL) at all times and clean up their scripts.
-Andrei
On Sep 14, 2005, at 5:02 AM, Steph wrote:
> Andrei, > > I think the weird behaviour I reported earlier was probably just > down to me > getting confused - I can't find the particular script that provoked > one > request for a string from the PHP side and another for an int from > the GTK > side, but I do know how it happened now. > > Here's a short test script from my ever-increasing hello.php: > > <?php > > /* tricksy params - and can the final param work at all if > local_files is > set to TRUE by default? */ > $fcdialog = new GtkFileChooserDialog('GtkFileChooserDialog', null, > Gtk::FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN, array('first', Gtk::RESPONSE_CANCEL, > 'second', Gtk::RESPONSE_ACCEPT, 'third', Gtk::RESPONSE_OK, '_fourth', > Gtk::RESPONSE_APPLY), 'tmp://'); > $fcdialog->connect_object('destroy', array('gtk', 'main_quit')); > $fcdialog->show_all(); > > ?> > > Now in PHP-GTK 2 you need to type stuff like: > > Gtk::FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN > > rather than version 1's: > > GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN > > thanks to the g_typing. But if you don't know this in advance and > do it the > old fashioned way, you get something like "Notice: Use of undefined > constant > GTK_RESPONSE_ACCEPT - assumed 'GTK_RESPONSE_ACCEPT' in C:\php5 > \hello.php on > line 4". In some cases that actually works - submitting the string > 'GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN' appears to, presumably because it > evaluates > to 0 - but submitting 'GTK_RESPONSE_ACCEPT' will cause a > PhpGtkConstructException to be thrown. > > Warning: GtkFileChooserDialog::__construct(): each pair in button > list has > to string/number in C:\php5\hello.php on line 4 > > Fatal error: Uncaught exception 'PhpGtkConstructException' with > message > 'could not construct GtkDialog object' in C:\php5\hello.php:4 > Stack trace: > #0 C:\php5\hello.php(4): > GtkFileChooserDialog->__construct('GtkFileChooserD...', NULL, 0, > Array, > 'tmp://') > #1 {main} > thrown in C:\php5\hello.php on line 4 > > You can see how I got confused. OK so this is a documentation > issue at > heart, but is there any way to give a saner E_NOTICE than the one > thrown by > PHP? > > - Steph > NB This means we can eliminate misbehaviour in enums from the 'u' > issue, in > the sense I meant it at least. > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Missing Header: gen_libglade.h
email.body:
In file included from /Users/jsjohnst/CVS/php-gtk/./ext/libglade/php_libglade.c:23: /Users/jsjohnst/CVS/php-gtk/./ext/libglade/php_libglade.h:31:26: error: gen_libglade.h: No such file or directory make: *** [ext/libglade/php_libglade.lo] Error 1
From the looks of the file name, I would assume this is a generated file. Adding --disable-libglade to the ./configure line of course gets me past that error, but I was hoping from the conversations of late on libglade2 here on the list that it might compile atleast (just not work fully). Was that assumption wrong?
-Jeremy

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-GTK2 List Store ? - *nix tester needed please
Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-GTK2 List Store ? - *nix tester needed please
email.body:
Hi Josh,
I have a fix for treepath, but it may or may not be kosher. All the treepath methods work excepting the extra constructors, i.e.
GtkTreePath::new_from_string(); GtkTreePath::new_from_indices(); GtkTreePath::new_first();
and
$treepath->get_indices();
Still it's useful, because there are methods like $treepath->next() , $treepath->down() and $treepath->to_string() available, and these all work for me.
$treemodel->get_iter() also works when GtkTreePath is working.
We need to figure out what's going to happen about iter_next() - in GTK+ it returns a boolean value, but then so does get_iter(). I suspect Andrei would prefer to see it move to the next iter on the grounds that it's more intuitive to have it behave that way, but I'm second-guessing him over this.
- Steph
----- Original Message ----- From: "Joshua Seward" <jseward@columbus.rr.com> To: "'Steph'" <steph@zend.com> Sent: Saturday, October 08, 2005 1:30 AM Subject: RE: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-GTK2 List Store ? - *nix tester needed please
Thanks Steph,
I will have to play with iter next some more to understand it. My goal was not to just reset all the data in every row. I knew the foreach could do this. I was trying to learn how to manipulate the rows individually. Just learning how everything works. Thanks you for the time and help though.
Josh
-----Original Message----- From: Steph [mailto:steph@zend.com] Sent: Friday, October 07, 2005 2:45 PM To: Joshua Seward; PHP DEV Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-GTK2 List Store ? - *nix tester needed please
Hi Josh,
OK, I've fiddled with that script a little to make it more obvious what's going on & to demo liststore updating - pls find attached two versions (one working, one broken). Could someone on a *nix-based system please run the 'broken' script and say whether get_iter() causes a crash for them too?
BTW iter_next works fine, it's just you were passing it a boolean value so it never reached 2.
I'll see if I can do something about the docs tomorrow.
- Steph
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Missing Header: gen_libglade.h
email.body:
It compiles and loads under win32. I don't know enough about *nix-like systems to go into the build system there in any depth, but I _think_ Andrei made it 'just build' by default?
----- Original Message ----- From: "Jeremy Johnstone" <phpdev@gmail.com> To: "PHP-GTK Dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Sunday, October 09, 2005 5:21 AM Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Missing Header: gen_libglade.h
In file included from /Users/jsjohnst/CVS/php-gtk/./ext/libglade/php_libglade.c:23: /Users/jsjohnst/CVS/php-gtk/./ext/libglade/php_libglade.h:31:26: error: gen_libglade.h: No such file or directory make: *** [ext/libglade/php_libglade.lo] Error 1
From the looks of the file name, I would assume this is a generated file. Adding --disable-libglade to the ./configure line of course gets me past that error, but I was hoping from the conversations of late on libglade2 here on the list that it might compile atleast (just not work fully). Was that assumption wrong?
-Jeremy
-- --------------------------- Jeremy Johnstone http://www.jeremyjohnstone.com jsjohnst@php.net
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.body:
Welp, with the changes Andrei made yesterday, it compiles now. After a long strenuous process I now have Glade going too on OSX. Now the problem is that although the extension compiles and loads with libGlade as well as strings finds GladeXML as a string in the binary, get_declared_classes() doesn't list anything related to Glade and I can't instantiate anything related to it. Anyone else got it running at all other than the above?
-Jeremy

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Missing Header: gen_libglade.h
email.body:
php -r "print_r(get_declared_classes());"
// end of great big array
[282] => AtkRelationSet [283] => AtkStateSet [284] => AtkUtil [285] => Pango [286] => PangoContext [287] => PangoFont [288] => PangoFontFace [289] => PangoFontFamily [290] => PangoFontMap [291] => PangoFontset [292] => PangoFontsetSimple [293] => PangoLayout [294] => PangoAttrList [295] => PangoColor [296] => PangoFontDescription [297] => PangoFontMetrics [298] => PangoGlyphString [299] => PangoLanguage [300] => PangoLayoutIter [301] => PangoTabArray [302] => Glade [303] => GladeXML )
You need ATK 1.9.0 for latest libglade to work, earlier versions don't contain a particular RelationSet method.
C:\php5>php -r "print_r(get_class_methods('Glade'));" Array ( [0] => get_widget_name [1] => get_widget_tree )
C:\php5>php -r "print_r(get_class_methods('GladeXML'));" Array ( [0] => __construct [1] => construct [2] => get_widget [3] => relative_file [4] => signal_autoconnect [5] => __tostring [6] => connect [7] => connect_after [8] => connect_object [9] => connect_object_after [10] => get_property [11] => set_property [12] => get_data [13] => set_data [14] => block [15] => unblock [16] => disconnect [17] => is_connected [18] => signal_list_ids [19] => signal_list_names [20] => signal_query )
- this is correct, GladeXML inherits from GObject.
I haven't written any overrides for it yet, and although Josh sent me a basic Glade test file I haven't had time yet to set up Glade and try it. It'll probably be next weekend before I get the chance to do that now.
That aside, it sounds like there's something wrong with the *nix build, and I'm not in a position to do anything about that apart from wild guessing. You are :)
- Steph
----- Original Message ----- From: "Jeremy Johnstone" <phpdev@gmail.com> To: "Steph" <steph@zend.com> Cc: "PHP-GTK Dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Monday, October 10, 2005 7:02 AM Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Missing Header: gen_libglade.h

Now the problem is that although the extension compiles and loads with libGlade as well as strings finds GladeXML as a string in the binary, get_declared_classes() doesn't list anything related to Glade and I can't instantiate anything related to it. Anyone else got it running at all other than the above?
-Jeremy

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Unable to load dynamic library
email.body:
There was an API bump in September to my knowledge - use snaps 5_1 for the doze version and let me know if you still have problems.
http://snaps.php.net
----- Original Message ----- From: "Jeremy Johnstone" <phpdev@gmail.com> To: "PHP-GTK Dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Sunday, October 09, 2005 5:36 AM Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Unable to load dynamic library
Getting the following error when attempting to load php_gtk2 via php.ini:
PHP Warning: PHP Startup: Unable to load dynamic library '/usr/local/lib/php/extensions/no-debug-non-zts-20050617/php_gtk.so' - (null) in Unknown on line 0
Similar error when loading via dl()
Versions are as follows: GLIB 2.6.6 GTK+ 2.6.8 PHP 5.1.0RC2-dev Autoconf 2.59 OSX 10.4.2 PHP-GTK2 (latest CVS)
Gonna try upgrading to newer PHP build, but if anyone has any other tips I would be greatly appreciative.
-- --------------------------- Jeremy Johnstone http://www.jeremyjohnstone.com jsjohnst@php.net

email.subject: Fw: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Unable to load dynamic library
email.body:
oops misread that some. You shouldn't be using dl() anyway, it's deprecated. And you can of course use snaps for recent src too if you don't have the tools/bandwidth to check out PHP_5_1 from CVS.

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] methods
email.body:
foreach() is implemented now as well.
-Andrei
On Sep 27, 2005, at 7:21 AM, Pablo Dall'Oglio wrote:
> How can I retrieve all elements from a GtkTreeView ? > I tried to use GtkTreeModel::foreach, but it isn't implemented yet. > > I need GtkTreeView::get_path_at_pos also (to implement right click on > tree views)... according to this > (http://scentric.net/tutorial/sec-selections-context-menus.html) > > php-gtk2 is getting amazing. > > best regards > Pablo > > -- > :: Pablo Dall'Oglio > :: www.solis.coop.br - Lajeado, RS - Brasil > :: www.dalloglio.net - Personal Home Page > :: The software is free, but the work isn't. > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] methods
email.body:
Thanks Andrei ! I've just checked out the CVS but it failed on compiling:
# ./cvsclean # ./buildconf --with-phpize=/usr/local/php5/bin/phpize --with-php-config=/usr/local/php5/bin/php-config
# './configure' \ '--prefix=/usr/local/php5' \ '--exec-prefix=/usr/local/php5' \ '--with-php-config=/usr/local/php5/bin/php-config' \ '--disable-scrollpane' \ '--disable-spaned' \ '--disable-sqpane' \ '--disable-combobutton' \ '--disable-libglade' \ '--disable-piemenu' \
# make
gcc -I./ext/gtk+/ -I/usr/local/src/php-gtk/./ext/gtk+/ -DPHP_ATOM_INC -I/usr/local/src/php-gtk/include -I/usr/local/src/php-gtk/main -I/usr/local/src/php-gtk -I/usr/local/php5/include/php -I/usr/local/php5/include/php/main -I/usr/local/php5/include/php/TSRM -I/usr/local/php5/include/php/Zend -I/usr/include/glib-2.0 -I/usr/lib/glib-2.0/include -I/usr/include/gtk-2.0 -I/usr/lib/gtk-2.0/include -I/usr/X11R6/include -I/usr/include/atk-1.0 -I/usr/include/pango-1.0 -I/usr/include/freetype2 -DHAVE_CONFIG_H -g -O2 -c /usr/local/src/php-gtk/./ext/gtk+/php_gtk+.c -fPIC -DPIC -o ./ext/gtk+/php_gtk+.lo In file included from /usr/local/src/php-gtk/main/php_gtk.h:193, from /usr/local/src/php-gtk/ext/gtk+/php_gtk+.c:23: /usr/local/src/php-gtk/ext/gtk+/php_gtk+.h:52:21: gen_gtk.h: No such file or directory make: ** [ext/gtk+/php_gtk+.lo] Erro 1
Pablo
On Sáb, 2005-10-01 at 14:29 -0700, Andrei Zmievski wrote: > foreach() is implemented now as well. > > -Andrei > > > On Sep 27, 2005, at 7:21 AM, Pablo Dall'Oglio wrote: > > > How can I retrieve all elements from a GtkTreeView ? > > I tried to use GtkTreeModel::foreach, but it isn't implemented yet. > > > > I need GtkTreeView::get_path_at_pos also (to implement right click on > > tree views)... according to this > > (http://scentric.net/tutorial/sec-selections-context-menus.html) > > > > php-gtk2 is getting amazing. > > > > best regards > > Pablo > > > > -- > > :: Pablo Dall'Oglio > > :: www.solis.coop.br - Lajeado, RS - Brasil > > :: www.dalloglio.net - Personal Home Page > > :: The software is free, but the work isn't. > > > > -- > > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > > > -- :: Pablo Dall'Oglio :: www.solis.coop.br - Lajeado, RS - Brasil :: www.dalloglio.net - Personal Home Page :: The software is free, but the work isn't.

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] methods
email.body:
Don't know why, but somehow you missed generating the gen_* files....

# ./cvsclean # ./buildconf --with-phpize=/usr/local/php5/bin/phpize --with-php-config=/usr/local/php5/bin/php-config

# make
gcc -I./ext/gtk+/ -I/usr/local/src/php-gtk/./ext/gtk+/ -DPHP_ATOM_INC -I/usr/local/src/php-gtk/include -I/usr/local/src/php-gtk/main -I/usr/local/src/php-gtk -I/usr/local/php5/include/php -I/usr/local/php5/include/php/main -I/usr/local/php5/include/php/TSRM -I/usr/local/php5/include/php/Zend -I/usr/include/glib-2.0 -I/usr/lib/glib-2.0/include -I/usr/include/gtk-2.0 -I/usr/lib/gtk-2.0/include -I/usr/X11R6/include -I/usr/include/atk-1.0 -I/usr/include/pango-1.0 -I/usr/include/freetype2 -DHAVE_CONFIG_H -g -O2 -c /usr/local/src/php-gtk/./ext/gtk+/php_gtk+.c -fPIC -DPIC -o ./ext/gtk+/php_gtk+.lo In file included from /usr/local/src/php-gtk/main/php_gtk.h:193, from /usr/local/src/php-gtk/ext/gtk+/php_gtk+.c:23: /usr/local/src/php-gtk/ext/gtk+/php_gtk+.h:52:21: gen_gtk.h: No such file or directory make: ** [ext/gtk+/php_gtk+.lo] Erro 1

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] methods
email.body:
Darn pesky button!
Pablo - gen_gtk.c in particular is a massive file, it's possible that it simply hadn't completed generation before you ran make.
Can you try the 'run ./configure, get coffee' approach?

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] methods
email.body:
It's because php_gtk+.c is compiled first, and it includes php_gtk+.h which Steph added #include "gen_gtk.h" too. Of course, gen_gtk.c hasn't been generated yet by that time, and you run into a problem..
-Andrei
On Oct 3, 2005, at 10:27 AM, Steph wrote:
> Darn pesky button! > > Pablo - gen_gtk.c in particular is a massive file, it's possible that > it > simply hadn't completed generation before you ran make. > > Can you try the 'run ./configure, get coffee' approach? >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] digging into enums and flags
email.body:
What's not sane about the message is, it tells you GTK_RESPONSE_ACCEPT or whatever is undefined (which it is) but not that GTK::RESPONSE_ACCEPT would be correct, which would be useful information given that the format has changed since PHP-GTK 1. I think if I hadn't had Christian's demo scripts available, I'd still be scratching my head over that one!
I think other people migrating from PHP-GTK 1 will have the same problem.
Documentation's obviously going to be the number one way to address this, but what I'm asking is whether there is any simple, generic way to recognise and intercept something that used to be valid in PHP-GTK 1, e.g. GTK_RESPONSE_ACCEPT, and throw out a better explanation somehow _before_ it reaches PHP's standard response?
----- Original Message ----- From: "Andrei Zmievski" <andrei@gravitonic.com> To: "Steph" <steph@zend.com> Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Saturday, October 01, 2005 7:01 PM Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] digging into enums and flags
> What's not sane about the message shown by PHP? People should use > error_reporting(E_ALL) at all times and clean up their scripts. > > -Andrei > > > On Sep 14, 2005, at 5:02 AM, Steph wrote: > > > Andrei, > > > > I think the weird behaviour I reported earlier was probably just > > down to me > > getting confused - I can't find the particular script that provoked > > one > > request for a string from the PHP side and another for an int from > > the GTK > > side, but I do know how it happened now. > > > > Here's a short test script from my ever-increasing hello.php: > > > > <?php > > > > /* tricksy params - and can the final param work at all if > > local_files is > > set to TRUE by default? */ > > $fcdialog = new GtkFileChooserDialog('GtkFileChooserDialog', null, > > Gtk::FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN, array('first', Gtk::RESPONSE_CANCEL, > > 'second', Gtk::RESPONSE_ACCEPT, 'third', Gtk::RESPONSE_OK, '_fourth', > > Gtk::RESPONSE_APPLY), 'tmp://'); > > $fcdialog->connect_object('destroy', array('gtk', 'main_quit')); > > $fcdialog->show_all(); > > > > ?> > > > > Now in PHP-GTK 2 you need to type stuff like: > > > > Gtk::FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN > > > > rather than version 1's: > > > > GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN > > > > thanks to the g_typing. But if you don't know this in advance and > > do it the > > old fashioned way, you get something like "Notice: Use of undefined > > constant > > GTK_RESPONSE_ACCEPT - assumed 'GTK_RESPONSE_ACCEPT' in C:\php5 > > \hello.php on > > line 4". In some cases that actually works - submitting the string > > 'GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN' appears to, presumably because it > > evaluates > > to 0 - but submitting 'GTK_RESPONSE_ACCEPT' will cause a > > PhpGtkConstructException to be thrown. > > > > Warning: GtkFileChooserDialog::__construct(): each pair in button > > list has > > to string/number in C:\php5\hello.php on line 4 > > > > Fatal error: Uncaught exception 'PhpGtkConstructException' with > > message > > 'could not construct GtkDialog object' in C:\php5\hello.php:4 > > Stack trace: > > #0 C:\php5\hello.php(4): > > GtkFileChooserDialog->__construct('GtkFileChooserD...', NULL, 0, > > Array, > > 'tmp://') > > #1 {main} > > thrown in C:\php5\hello.php on line 4 > > > > You can see how I got confused. OK so this is a documentation > > issue at > > heart, but is there any way to give a saner E_NOTICE than the one > > thrown by > > PHP? > > > > - Steph > > NB This means we can eliminate misbehaviour in enums from the 'u' > > issue, in > > the sense I meant it at least. > > > > -- > > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > > > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] digging into enums and flags
email.body:
No, there is no way to hook into the constants mechanism. I'm afraid that's the way it will have to be.
-Andrei

> What's not sane about the message is, it tells you > GTK_RESPONSE_ACCEPT or > whatever is undefined (which it is) but not that > GTK::RESPONSE_ACCEPT would > be correct, which would be useful information given that the format > has > changed since PHP-GTK 1. People should use >> error_reporting(E_ALL) at all times and clean up their scripts. >> >> -Andrei >> >> >> On Sep 14, 2005, at 5:02 AM, Steph wrote: >> >> >>> Andrei, >>> >>> I think the weird behaviour I reported earlier was probably just >>> down to me >>> getting confused - I can't find the particular script that provoked >>> one >>> request for a string from the PHP side and another for an int from >>> the GTK >>> side, but I do know how it happened now. >>> >>> Here's a short test script from my ever-increasing hello.php: >>> >>> <?php >>> >>> /* tricksy params - and can the final param work at all if >>> local_files is >>> set to TRUE by default? */ >>> $fcdialog = new GtkFileChooserDialog('GtkFileChooserDialog', null, >>> Gtk::FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN, array('first', Gtk::RESPONSE_CANCEL, >>> 'second', Gtk::RESPONSE_ACCEPT, 'third', Gtk::RESPONSE_OK, >>> '_fourth', >>> Gtk::RESPONSE_APPLY), 'tmp://'); >>> $fcdialog->connect_object('destroy', array('gtk', 'main_quit')); >>> $fcdialog->show_all(); >>> >>> ?> >>> >>> Now in PHP-GTK 2 you need to type stuff like: >>> >>> Gtk::FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN >>> >>> rather than version 1's: >>> >>> GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN >>> >>> thanks to the g_typing. But if you don't know this in advance and >>> do it the >>> old fashioned way, you get something like "Notice: Use of undefined >>> constant >>> GTK_RESPONSE_ACCEPT - assumed 'GTK_RESPONSE_ACCEPT' in C:\php5 >>> \hello.php on >>> line 4". In some cases that actually works - submitting the string >>> 'GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN' appears to, presumably because it >>> evaluates >>> to 0 - but submitting 'GTK_RESPONSE_ACCEPT' will cause a >>> PhpGtkConstructException to be thrown. >>> >>> Warning: GtkFileChooserDialog::__construct(): each pair in button >>> list has >>> to string/number in C:\php5\hello.php on line 4 >>> >>> Fatal error: Uncaught exception 'PhpGtkConstructException' with >>> message >>> 'could not construct GtkDialog object' in C:\php5\hello.php:4 >>> Stack trace: >>> #0 C:\php5\hello.php(4): >>> GtkFileChooserDialog->__construct('GtkFileChooserD...', NULL, 0, >>> Array, >>> 'tmp://') >>> #1 {main} >>> thrown in C:\php5\hello.php on line 4 >>> >>> You can see how I got confused. OK so this is a documentation >>> issue at >>> heart, but is there any way to give a saner E_NOTICE than the one >>> thrown by >>> PHP? >>> >>> - Steph >>> NB This means we can eliminate misbehaviour in enums from the 'u' >>> issue, in >>> the sense I meant it at least. >>> >>> -- >>> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) >>> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >>> >>> >> >> -- >> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) >> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >> >

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-GTK2 mysql Extensions?
email.body:
Problem Solved!
After getting sleep, I smacked myself for doing everything backwards.
The only extensions that would load with the php-gtk2.dll are the ones from the main php.net site.
I tried this on the 8000 time. Please stop sending people to the snapshot website. They are not the correct build.
I guarantee this!!!!!!
There is a fault in the php_mysqli.dll though. Windows command crashes every time php-gtk2 tries to load it.
The php_mysql.dll and other work fine.
Sorry for all the bad e-mails before and thank you all for your time and patience.
Thanks Again,
Josh

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-GTK2 mysql Extensions?
email.body:
Hi Josh,
Sorry, blame the weekend - I was AFK for the whole of this thread.
The snapshot version of PHP is created directly from CVS. It is not the same version as those available on php.net. The only 5_1 version you could possibly have picked up from php.net is a release candidate dating back two months. There've been a lot of changes since then, including a Zend API version bump which will prevent recent extensions from working with that version of PHP. As Frank suggested, you can run php -v to check the PHP version you have there. Next time you report a problem, running php-v and copy/pasting the output in your first email would make it much easier for us all to understand what's going on.
The extensions in the snaps zip work with the snapshot version of php.exe, and you load them in exactly the same way as you normally would, which is:
extension = php-gtk2.dll extension = php_mysql.dll
unlike PHP-GTK extensions, which are written as a comma-separated list.
php_mysql.dll isn't available in PECL, and never has been. That's why it's in the snaps zip, along with the version of PHP it was built against and a copy of the library needed to run it. Occasionally a build can fail, and that also applies to extension builds in the CVS branches. Nobody's perfect, and all four branches are under some form of active development, ranging from 'bug fixes only' to 'bleeding-edge experimental'. So _occasionally_ you might get the situation where you need to go back to snaps and start over because an extension doesn't work (making sure that the extension author knows about the bug and has fixed it first, of course). But it's relatively rare for that to happen with the core extensions, because build problems are usually reported quite quickly.
You need to pick up the most recent copy of PHP 5_1 branch from the snaps box if you're planning to load other extensions alongside PHP, as it says in my INSTALL.txt, and if php-gtk2.dll won't load I'll need to know about it so I can rebuild PHP-GTK 2 against that version and put a working version on the site. In fact I just now tested it, and it _doesn't_ load, because there was an API bump on 22nd September that I wasn't aware of. That was the problem I needed to know about, and it means I need to build a new version of php-gtk2.dll against the CVS version of PHP 5.1-dev so that you can use it with the latest snaps. I'll mail the list as soon as I've made that version live, but it'll probably be some time tomorrow.
When we have an official PHP 5.1 release, it will become much easier to deal with all this - you'll be able to use www.php.net for the PHP and extensions download, and I'll build against that edition. But RC 1 is _not_ an official release, and the fact that this particular one hasn't been followed by further release candidates in the space of two months says it wasn't anywhere near stable enough for release material. In fact Zeev tried to roll RC 2 in mid-September and found it still wasn't ready, so didn't go ahead with that plan. That being the situation, we absolutely need to rely on the snaps builds for now, for any form of win32 distribution.
BTW, Edin just made it easier to pick up the correct individual PECL extension for the branch you're using - take a look at http://pecl4win.php.net/branch.php. He also (now) links to the relevant list on that site, from the snaps site, so nobody needs to download a big zipfile to get a single PECL extension any more.
Hope that makes everything a bit clearer,
- Steph
----- Original Message ----- From: "Joshua Seward" <jseward@columbus.rr.com> To: "PHP DEV" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Saturday, October 01, 2005 7:49 AM Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-GTK2 mysql Extensions?
Problem Solved!
After getting sleep, I smacked myself for doing everything backwards.
The only extensions that would load with the php-gtk2.dll are the ones from the main php.net site.
I tried this on the 8000 time. Please stop sending people to the snapshot website. They are not the correct build.
I guarantee this!!!!!!
There is a fault in the php_mysqli.dll though. Windows command crashes every time php-gtk2 tries to load it.
The php_mysql.dll and other work fine.
Sorry for all the bad e-mails before and thank you all for your time and patience.
Thanks Again,
Josh
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

> How widely available is ATK 1.9.0? Do most distributions have it? > > -Andrei > > > On Sep 22, 2005, at 12:34 PM, Steph wrote: > > > ps I just tried building against a full version of ATK 1.9.0 with my > > overrides patch and everything loads now, including the GladeXML > > class and > > something that thinks it's called Libglade :) > > > > Andrei, would you mind making 1.9.0 ATK rather than 1.8.0 > > required? It > > builds & works OK with that single change to the defs file. > > > > > > ----- Original Message ----- > > From: "Steph" <steph@zend.com> > > To: "Andrei" <andrei@gravitonic.com> > > Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> > > Sent: Thursday, September 22, 2005 8:11 PM > > Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Why the libglade extension doesn't work > > > > > > > >> The ATK library I'm building PHP-GTK 2 against has a function > >> missing, as > >> > > do > > > >> our own sources (presumably originating from ATK 1.8.0 or earlier). > >> > >> The libglade .dll was built against ATK 1.9.0, and references > >> (uses?) the > >> missing ATK function. > >> > >> Have written to Tor (who distributes the GTK+ dev headers and libs > >> we use > >> for win32)... the override's simple enough to add, but should I be > >> taking > >> this route? or trying to find another, possibly less recent, > >> libglade > >> distribution? > >> > >> - Steph > >> > >> -- > >> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > >> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > >> > >> > > > > -- > > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > > >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] [PATCH] Core changes needed for ext/libglade support
email.body:
Andrei,
The currently available libglade library on win32 is built against atk 1.9.0.
If you try to run it against 1.8.0 (or a dodgy version of 1.9.0!) add_relation_by_type is the only thing that breaks the build. i.e. _somewhere_ in libglade, that function is being called. If you really really need me to find out exactly where it's being called...
<sigh />
no, you don't.
There are several other functions in atk 1.9.0 that don't exist in atk 1.8.0, but they don't create libglade build errors.
- Steph
----- Original Message ----- From: "Andrei Zmievski" <andrei@gravitonic.com> To: "Steph" <steph@zend.com> Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Saturday, October 01, 2005 11:57 PM Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] [PATCH] Core changes needed for ext/libglade support
> What does add_relation_by_type have to do with libglade support? > > -Andrei > > > On Sep 23, 2005, at 3:50 AM, Steph wrote: > > > <libglade.txt> >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] [PATCH] GtkNotebook-related stuff
email.body:
I only have one test to hand - the gtknotebook one, and that seems to work regardless of whatever I throw at it :)
If anyone has any time/energy, it would be really useful to get some test scripts for the signals listed below. Simon? Scott?
- Steph
----- Original Message ----- From: "Andrei Zmievski" <andrei@gravitonic.com> To: "Steph" <steph@zend.com> Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Saturday, October 01, 2005 11:51 PM Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] [PATCH] GtkNotebook-related stuff
> Can you test these methods with the latest CVS? > > -Andrei > > On Sep 17, 2005, at 10:22 AM, Steph wrote: > > > The signals potentially affected by this patch, apart from the > > switch-page > > signal in GtkNotebook which is fixed by it, are: > > > > insert-text signal (GtkEditable) > > files-added signal (GtkFileSystem) > > toggle-size-request signal (GtkMenuItem) > > path-clicked signal (GtkPathBar) > > input signal (GtkSpinButton) > > > > all of which contain a gpointer type parameter. > > > > The other place is gtk_tree_model_get_value(), which is unlikely to be > > broken by the patch (because there isn't a way to set a gpointer as > > a value > > for a GtkTreeModel). > > > > If anyone has any scripts handy for testing the other signals > > there, please > > let me know. I've no idea how to test GtkFileSystem :) > > > > - >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] digging into enums and flags
email.body:
OK, it was just worth an 'ask'.
Thanks.
----- Original Message ----- From: "Andrei Zmievski" <andrei@gravitonic.com> To: "Steph" <steph@zend.com> Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Sunday, October 02, 2005 6:05 PM Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] digging into enums and flags
> No, there is no way to hook into the constants mechanism. I'm afraid > that's the way it will have to be. > > -Andrei > > > On Oct 2, 2005, at 6:51 AM, Steph wrote: > > > What's not sane about the message is, it tells you > > GTK_RESPONSE_ACCEPT or > > whatever is undefined (which it is) but not that > > GTK::RESPONSE_ACCEPT would > > be correct, which would be useful information given that the format > > has > > changed since PHP-GTK 1. I think if I hadn't had Christian's demo > > scripts > > available, I'd still be scratching my head over that one! > > > > I think other people migrating from PHP-GTK 1 will have the same > > problem. > > > > Documentation's obviously going to be the number one way to address > > this, > > but what I'm asking is whether there is any simple, generic way to > > recognise > > and intercept something that used to be valid in PHP-GTK 1, e.g. > > GTK_RESPONSE_ACCEPT, and throw out a better explanation somehow > > _before_ it > > reaches PHP's standard response? > > > > ----- Original Message ----- > > From: "Andrei Zmievski" <andrei@gravitonic.com> > > To: "Steph" <steph@zend.com> > > Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> > > Sent: Saturday, October 01, 2005 7:01 PM > > Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] digging into enums and flags > > > > > > > >> What's not sane about the message shown by PHP? People should use > >> error_reporting(E_ALL) at all times and clean up their scripts. > >> > >> -Andrei > >> > >> > >> On Sep 14, 2005, at 5:02 AM, Steph wrote: > >> > >> > >>> Andrei, > >>> > >>> I think the weird behaviour I reported earlier was probably just > >>> down to me > >>> getting confused - I can't find the particular script that provoked > >>> one > >>> request for a string from the PHP side and another for an int from > >>> the GTK > >>> side, but I do know how it happened now. > >>> > >>> Here's a short test script from my ever-increasing hello.php: > >>> > >>> <?php > >>> > >>> /* tricksy params - and can the final param work at all if > >>> local_files is > >>> set to TRUE by default? */ > >>> $fcdialog = new GtkFileChooserDialog('GtkFileChooserDialog', null, > >>> Gtk::FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN, array('first', Gtk::RESPONSE_CANCEL, > >>> 'second', Gtk::RESPONSE_ACCEPT, 'third', Gtk::RESPONSE_OK, > >>> '_fourth', > >>> Gtk::RESPONSE_APPLY), 'tmp://'); > >>> $fcdialog->connect_object('destroy', array('gtk', 'main_quit')); > >>> $fcdialog->show_all(); > >>> > >>> ?> > >>> > >>> Now in PHP-GTK 2 you need to type stuff like: > >>> > >>> Gtk::FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN > >>> > >>> rather than version 1's: > >>> > >>> GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN > >>> > >>> thanks to the g_typing. But if you don't know this in advance and > >>> do it the > >>> old fashioned way, you get something like "Notice: Use of undefined > >>> constant > >>> GTK_RESPONSE_ACCEPT - assumed 'GTK_RESPONSE_ACCEPT' in C:\php5 > >>> \hello.php on > >>> line 4". In some cases that actually works - submitting the string > >>> 'GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN' appears to, presumably because it > >>> evaluates > >>> to 0 - but submitting 'GTK_RESPONSE_ACCEPT' will cause a > >>> PhpGtkConstructException to be thrown. > >>> > >>> Warning: GtkFileChooserDialog::__construct(): each pair in button > >>> list has > >>> to string/number in C:\php5\hello.php on line 4 > >>> > >>> Fatal error: Uncaught exception 'PhpGtkConstructException' with > >>> message > >>> 'could not construct GtkDialog object' in C:\php5\hello.php:4 > >>> Stack trace: > >>> #0 C:\php5\hello.php(4): > >>> GtkFileChooserDialog->__construct('GtkFileChooserD...', NULL, 0, > >>> Array, > >>> 'tmp://') > >>> #1 {main} > >>> thrown in C:\php5\hello.php on line 4 > >>> > >>> You can see how I got confused. OK so this is a documentation > >>> issue at > >>> heart, but is there any way to give a saner E_NOTICE than the one > >>> thrown by > >>> PHP? > >>> > >>> - Steph > >>> NB This means we can eliminate misbehaviour in enums from the 'u' > >>> issue, in > >>> the sense I meant it at least. > >>> > >>> -- > >>> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > >>> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > >>> > >>> > >> > >> -- > >> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > >> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > >> > > > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

The function prefix part's dead simple.
I guessed it'd need work because of the size of the overrides file last time around. I haven't tested any of it yet though.
Does anyone out there have a Glade 2 file they'd like to share at this point? God alone knows there seem to have been enough people asking why they couldn't use Glade 2, until now...

Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: Unable to load dynamic library
email.body:
It's an incompatible library version.... like it says... you need libiconv 6 or later.
----- Original Message ----- From: "Jeremy Johnstone" <phpdev@gmail.com> To: "PHP-GTK Dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Sunday, October 09, 2005 7:35 AM Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: Unable to load dynamic library
I have got it where I am getting a new error:
dyld: NSLinkModule() error dyld: Library not loaded: /opt/local/lib/libiconv.2.dylib Referenced from: ./modules/php_gtk2.so Reason: Incompatible library version: php_gtk2.so requires version 6.0.0 or later, but libiconv.2.dylib provides version 5.0.0 Trace/BPT trap
Any tips would be greatly appreciated!
-Jeremy
On 10/8/05, Jeremy Johnstone <phpdev@gmail.com> wrote: > Getting the following error when attempting to load php_gtk2 via php.ini: > > PHP Warning: PHP Startup: Unable to load dynamic library > '/usr/local/lib/php/extensions/no-debug-non-zts-20050617/php_gtk.so' - > (null) in Unknown on line 0 > > Similar error when loading via dl() > > Versions are as follows: > GLIB 2.6.6 > GTK+ 2.6.8 > PHP 5.1.0RC2-dev > Autoconf 2.59 > OSX 10.4.2 > PHP-GTK2 (latest CVS) > > Gonna try upgrading to newer PHP build, but if anyone has any other > tips I would be greatly appreciative. > > > -- > --------------------------- > Jeremy Johnstone > http://www.jeremyjohnstone.com > jsjohnst@php.net >
-- --------------------------- Jeremy Johnstone http://www.jeremyjohnstone.com jsjohnst@php.net

email.subject: Re: Fw: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Unable to load dynamic library
email.body:
Got it fixed. Fink had installed an libiconv-2.2 and was in the search path in front of the one which darwinports installed (2.3). I copied the file over and after fixing a few other errors along the way, I now have a fully functional (minus libGlade) GTK2 setup on OSX.
-Jeremy
On 10/9/05, Steph <steph@zend.com> wrote: > oops misread that some. You shouldn't be using dl() anyway, it's > deprecated. And you can of course use snaps for recent src too if you don't > have the tools/bandwidth to check out PHP_5_1 from CVS. > > ----- Original Message ----- > From: "Steph" <steph@zend.com> > To: "Jeremy Johnstone" <phpdev@gmail.com>; "PHP-GTK Dev" > <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> > Sent: Sunday, October 09, 2005 11:50 AM > Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Unable to load dynamic library > > > > There was an API bump in September to my knowledge - use snaps 5_1 for the > > doze version and let me know if you still have problems. > > > > http://snaps.php.net > > > > ----- Original Message ----- > > From: "Jeremy Johnstone" <phpdev@gmail.com> > > To: "PHP-GTK Dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> > > Sent: Sunday, October 09, 2005 5:36 AM > > Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Unable to load dynamic library > > > > > > Getting the following error when attempting to load php_gtk2 via php.ini: > > > > PHP Warning: PHP Startup: Unable to load dynamic library > > '/usr/local/lib/php/extensions/no-debug-non-zts-20050617/php_gtk.so' - > > (null) in Unknown on line 0 > > > > Similar error when loading via dl() > > > > Versions are as follows: > > GLIB 2.6.6 > > GTK+ 2.6.8 > > PHP 5.1.0RC2-dev > > Autoconf 2.59 > > OSX 10.4.2 > > PHP-GTK2 (latest CVS) > > > > Gonna try upgrading to newer PHP build, but if anyone has any other > > tips I would be greatly appreciative. > > > > > > -- > > --------------------------- > > Jeremy Johnstone > > http://www.jeremyjohnstone.com > > jsjohnst@php.net > > > > -- > > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > > > > -- > > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > > > >

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] minor but annoying issue
email.body:
Doubt anyone has any tips but worth a shot anyway.
In OSX, if I load the php-gtk2 extension via my normal php.ini and try to run the PHP CLI via the command line in a normal terminal window, php immediately exits without any errors or output (even something simple like /usr/local/bin/php -v). GDB doesn't give any further useful information other than the program exited with code 01.
Due to the fact that it works fine via an X11 xterm, I would assume it has something to do with not being able to attach to the display. I'm hoping there is some way to make PHP-GTK work without forcing me to use a seperate config file for it.
-Jeremy
-- --------------------------- Jeremy Johnstone http://www.jeremyjohnstone.com jsjohnst@php.net

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: minor but annoying issue
email.body:
php_gtk_ext.c wasn't being generated properly. Try now.
Jeremy Johnstone wrote: > Seems I answered my own question, but I don't like the answer. If I > set a DISPLAY variable in the environment then it works fine. Still > would be nice if we correctly detected if we were even accessing GTK > before requiring the DISPLAY to be set. > > -Jeremy > > On 10/9/05, Jeremy Johnstone <phpdev@gmail.com> wrote: >> Doubt anyone has any tips but worth a shot anyway. >> >> In OSX, if I load the php-gtk2 extension via my normal php.ini and try >> to run the PHP CLI via the command line in a normal terminal window, >> php immediately exits without any errors or output (even something >> simple like /usr/local/bin/php -v). GDB doesn't give any further >> useful information other than the program exited with code 01. >> >> Due to the fact that it works fine via an X11 xterm, I would assume it >> has something to do with not being able to attach to the display. I'm >> hoping there is some way to make PHP-GTK work without forcing me to >> use a seperate config file for it. >> >> -Jeremy >> >> >> -- >> --------------------------- >> Jeremy Johnstone >> http://www.jeremyjohnstone.com >> jsjohnst@php.net >> > > > -- > --------------------------- > Jeremy Johnstone > http://www.jeremyjohnstone.com > jsjohnst@php.net > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > >

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-GTK2 List Store ? - *nix tester needed please
email.body:
Steph wrote: > - it's very helpful to have test scripts, so yes, you could do that too > (Christian means the /test dir when he says 'the bugs dir'). But we'll > actually get around to fixing them if they're in the TODO ;)
Added two tests but I don't have the karma to update the TODO2 file. I have attached my version of the TODO2 file.
Scott
["todo2.txt" (text/plain)]
Generator ~~~~~~~~~ * Pointers * Write handlers for properties * Make property-based constructors use pre-code generated by arg types * gunichar arg type * Fix Boxed_Arg to require explicit CE in php_gtk_parse_args().
Base Functionality ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ * Some classes need to be coded in C entirely, see gtk-types.c * Interfaces * Atoms * Implement __gtype, __doc, and other special properties, if possible * Deal with clone() handler in Zend * Maybe use zend_call_function() instead of call_user_function_ex() to take advantage of function call cache * Construction of arbitrary GObjects() via argument lists * Integration with pkg-config * Fix GdkEventType property handlers to cope with GdkAtom, GdkRegion, GdkNativeWindow \ and GdkDragContext
Classes and Functions ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ * GdkGC implement property access (read/write) * GtkListStore * GtkTreeModel * GtkTreeStore Some iterator functions as get_iter() are expecting a GBoxed parameter. * GtkTreeView * GtkCellRenderer * GtkClipboard - GtkNotebook->append_page should allow just a string as second parameter (title for \ page) instead of only wanting a gtklabel or so - GtkNotebook crashes when connecting callback to move-focus-out signal - GtkNotebook->get_nth_page() crashes * GtkEntries can't be var_dumped, probably something missing - GtkTextBuffer->set_text's 2nd parameter should be optional * GtkTextBuffer->create_tag() is not implemented * GtkTextBuffer->move_mark_by_name('selection_bound', ...) moves both the the insert and select_bound marks * GtkTextTagTable->lookup() is not implemented * GtkTextTagTable->foreach() is not implemented * GtkTextTag does not do anything. Either the properties must be accessible or a method must be defined to set them (i.e. GtkTextBuffer->create_tag()). * GtkTreeModelFilter constructor doesn't take a model / does it have a constructor?? \ didn't see one in gtk.defs * Would it be good to call GtkLabel::set_ellipsize(PANGO::ELLIPSIZE_END) as part of an override for (left-justifying) GtkLabel::set_width_chars() (optional param)?
Fix ~~~ * StyleHelper does not implement handlers that ZE2 _requires_ right now. Need to change either ZE2 or StyleHelper.
Thoughts on reference counting and wrappers ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
1. We should probably not ref the GtkWindow/GtkInvisible after construction. It leaves a hanging reference around and the window will not get destroyed by Gtk+. The proper way to destroy the toplevel window is via gtk_window/widget_destroy(). Calling gtk::main_quit() is not enough.
2. Since we lack a garbage collector, we need to fake it. We need to override del_ref handler on the object, which will make sure that our wrapper is destroyed only if the referent gobject also has refcount of 1, which we means that only we own it. Otherwise, we need to keep our wrapper from being destroyed and save a pointer to the wrapper in the gobject with notification turned on, so that when gobject is destroyed by Gtk+ our wrapper is destroyed as well.
[ * todo - in progress ]
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] A bit of a makefile.frag situation...
email.body:
Hi Jani,
Is there a way to check for files during make and delay further processing until they're all generated?
The win32 build system generates 8 base gen_* files during configure and checks for their existence before the script is allowed to end, which works fine.
The *nix build system, on the other hand, generates the 8 base gen_* files from ext/gtk+/Makefile.frag, and then compiles them during ext/gtk+/config.m4. This approach caused a problem in the *nix build when gen_gtk.c included gen_gtk.h before it existed. Andrei addressed that problem by not including the gen_*.h files at all. This is fine for building PHP-GTK 2 itself, on either system, but of course the library produced in this way no longer contains PHP-GTK 2 exports. (The gen_*.h files consist solely of PHP_GTK_API extern PHP_GTK_EXPORT_CE() declarations). That means we can't build PHP-GTK 2 extensions any more, on either system.
Can you help?
Cheers,
- Steph
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: Correct PEAR package.xml php-gtk dependency
email.body:
>>Does somebody know what the correct dependency tag for php-gtk and >>php-gtk2 are? > Is this even possible? The PEAR installer won't necessarily be using > php-gtk itself (command-line installer installing gtk packages, for > instance).
I don't know if it's possible, that's why I'm asking. It's just the problem that there will be a number of php-gtk2 applications pearified in future, and it would help if the installer could say "sorry, please install php-gtk2 first", like it does currently with dependencies on other packages.
Could you add a "special case" for at least php-gtk2 deps? I know that php-gtk2 has to be loaded in php.ini (as loading dynamically is discouraged by Zend and Andrei), so the extension "php-gtk" should always be loaded - would that be enough for a check?
-- Regards/MfG, Christian Weiske
["signature.asc" (application/pgp-signature)]

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: Correct PEAR package.xml php-gtk dependencytag?
email.body:
Excuse me: 'discouraged by Zend and Andrei' is what we normally call 'deprecated'.
dl() is deprecated in PHP 5. That's all you need to say here.
Don't point fingers at team decisions. This one in particular, has been requested for a long time - and not by Zend, nor by Andrei.

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: Correct PEAR package.xml php-gtk dependency
email.body:
Greg Beaver wrote: >> Does somebody know what the correct dependency tag for php-gtk and >> php-gtk2 are? > > Is this even possible? The PEAR installer won't necessarily be using > php-gtk itself (command-line installer installing gtk packages, for > instance).
Personally, I'd like to see PHP-GTK 2 as a PECL package eventually, but that isn't my decision to make. If it were a PECL package, I think it would be easy to check if it has been installed and create the correct dependency tag:
<dependencies> <package> <name>PHP_GTK</name> <channel>pecl.php.net</channel> <min>2.0.0</min> </package> </required> </dependencies>
-- Scott Mattocks scott@crisscott.com http://www.crisscott.com
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: Correct PEAR package.xml php-gtk dependencytag?
email.body:
If it became a PECL package I'd have to rewrite the entire win32 build system from scratch :-\
The chief argument for keeping PHP-GTK entirely separate used to be that it's a GUI building tool rather than a web-based tool, and on that historical basis we now have a completely separate infrastructure established for everything - web, docs et al. The fact of that infrastructure existing is probably the strongest argument for keeping it separate now, as there are client-side extensions in PECL these days (I'm thinking particularly of http://pecl.php.net/package/newt).
Perhaps a better idea would be to figure some way to integrate <channel>gtk.php.net</channel> - could anyone point me to the PEAR installer mechanism's internals (backend) so I can look into that possibility?
- Steph
----- Original Message ----- From: "Scott Mattocks" <scott@crisscott.com> To: "Greg Beaver" <cellog@php.net> Cc: "Christian Weiske" <cweiske@cweiske.de>; "PHP-GTK Dev list" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net>; "PEAR Dev List" <pear-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Monday, October 24, 2005 2:10 PM Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: Correct PEAR package.xml php-gtk dependencytag?

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] php-gtk2 buildconf/configure/make error
email.body:
Hi Ivan,
The same thing happened...
[]'s Daniel Braga

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] php-gtk2 buildconf/configure/make error
email.body:
What version of PHP are you using? you need the last version of CVS compiled with --disable-cgi parameter, what version of gnu tools are you using?
On 6/2/05, Daniel Braga <daniel@comentar.com.br> wrote: > Hi Ivan, > > The same thing happened... > > []'s > Daniel Braga > > Ivan Rodriguez wrote: > > Hi Daniel, > > > > when you do ./configure ... you need to disable all extensions like > > gtkextra, scintilla and others and glibtest too, do make clean, > > cvsclean and start again > > > > On 6/1/05, Daniel Braga <daniel@comentar.com.br> wrote: > > > >>Hello! > >> > >>I'm trying to compile the php-gtk2 from cvs, but i'm getting de > >>following errors: > >> > >>[root@elza php-gtk]# ./buildconf > >>Configuring for: > >>PHP Api Version: 20041225 > >>Zend Module Api No: 20041031 > >>Zend Extension Api No: 220041031 > >>rebuilding aclocal.m4 > >>configure.in:5: warning: LT_AC_PATH_SEPARATOR is m4_require'd but is not > >>m4_defun'd > >>configure.in:5: LT_AC_PATH_SEPARATOR is required by... > >>acinclude.m4:2444: PHP_CONFIG_NICE is expanded from... > >>configure.in:5: the top level > >>configure.in:5: warning: LT_AC_PROG_SED is m4_require'd but is not > >>m4_defun'd > >>configure.in:5: LT_AC_PROG_SED is required by... > >>rebuilding configure > >>configure.in:5: warning: LT_AC_PATH_SEPARATOR is m4_require'd but is not > email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] php-gtk2 buildconf/configure/make error
email.body:
I compiled of cvs, with --disable-cgi parameter.
[root@elza ~]# php -v PHP 5.1.0-dev (cli) (built: Jun 1 2005 12:37:22) Copyright (c) 1997-2005 The PHP Group Zend Engine v2.1.0-dev, Copyright (c) 1998-2004 Zend Technologies [root@elza ~]# rpm -qa | grep automake automake-1.9.5-1 [root@elza ~]# rpm -qa | grep autoconf autoconf-2.59-5 [root@elza ~]# rpm -qa | grep libtool libtool-ltdl-1.5.16.multilib2-1 [root@elza ~]# rpm -qa | grep gawk gawk-3.1.4-5 [root@elza ~]# rpm -qa | grep atk atk-devel-1.9.1-1 atk-1.9.1-1 [root@elza ~]# rpm -qa | grep gcc gcc-4.0.0-8 libgcc-4.0.0-6 libgcc-4.0.0-8
[]'s Daniel Braga
Ivan Rodriguez wrote: > What version of PHP are you using? you need the last version of CVS > compiled with --disable-cgi parameter, what version of gnu tools are > you using? > > On 6/2/05, Daniel Braga <daniel@comentar.com.br> wrote: > >>Hi Ivan, >> >>The same thing happened... >> >>[]'s >>Daniel Braga >> >>Ivan Rodriguez wrote: >> >>>Hi Daniel, >>> >>>when you do ./configure ... you need to disable all extensions like >>>gtkextra, scintilla and others and glibtest too, do make clean, >>>cvsclean and start again >>> >>>On 6/1/05, Daniel Braga <daniel@comentar.com.br> wrote: >>> >>> email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] php-gtk2 buildconf/configure/make error
email.body:
[CC'd to to our configure god, Jani]
Daniel Braga wrote: > [root@elza ~]# rpm -qa | grep libtool > libtool-ltdl-1.5.16.multilib2-1
I'm using 1.4.2, but I can't say if that's the root of the problem.
> [root@elza ~]# rpm -qa | grep gcc > gcc-4.0.0-8 > libgcc-4.0.0-6 > libgcc-4.0.0-8
Using 3.3.5 here.
>>>>> [root@elza php-gtk]# ./buildconf >>>>> Configuring for: >>>>> PHP Api Version: 20041225 >>>>> Zend Module Api No: 20041031 >>>>> Zend Extension Api No: 220041031 >>>>> rebuilding aclocal.m4 >>>>> configure.in:5: warning: LT_AC_PATH_SEPARATOR is m4_require'd but >>>>> is not >>>>> m4_defun'd >>>>> configure.in:5: LT_AC_PATH_SEPARATOR is required by...
This is really looking wierd. What m4 version are you using? I'm using 1.4.2. I think most if not all problems steam from the underlying problem that all the macros are not properly initialized.
>>>>> [root@elza php-gtk]# './configure' '--prefix=/usr/local/php5' >>>>> '--exec-prefix=/usr/local/php5' '--disable-scrollpane' >>>>> '--disable-spaned' '--disable-sqpane' '--disable-combobutton' >>>>> '--disable-libglade' '--disable-piemenu' >>>>> -bash: ./configure: Permission denied
I'm having this problem repeatadly too.
>>>>> ./configure: line 2682: s/.*>//: No such file or directory
Also very wierd. Some expressions are not properly quoted/expanded or something like that.
>>>>> checking for gawk... (cached) gawk >>>>> ./configure: line 3262: -e: command not found >>>>> ./configure: line 3274: >>>>> s#@ext_srcdir@#/compartilhado/downloads/php-gtk2/php-gtk#g: No such >>>>> file >>>>> or directory >>>>> ./configure: line 3274: s#@ext_builddir@#.#g: command not found
Same as above. Looks really like one of the tools in the chain doesn't work properly.
>>>>> checking for GLIB - version >= 2.6.0... yes (version 2.6.4) >>>>> ./configure: line 9127: s/[^a-zA-Z0-9]/_/g: No such file or directory
I'm getting wondering if the shell could be the problem? But I don't think so.
Jani is the god when it comes to this stuff (cc'ed him).
Anyway, the current requirements for php-gtk2 are really very fragile at the moment as I'm running in similiar problems every time I need to set up a development environment (and try not to change it once it's running).
good luck,
- Markus
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] php-gtk2 buildconf/configure/make error
email.body:
Hi!
I'm using version 1.4.3 of m4.
[]'s Daniel Braga
Markus Fischer wrote: > [CC'd to to our configure god, Jani] > > Daniel Braga wrote: > >> [root@elza ~]# rpm -qa | grep libtool >> libtool-ltdl-1.5.16.multilib2-1 > > > I'm using 1.4.2, but I can't say if that's the root of the problem. > >> [root@elza ~]# rpm -qa | grep gcc >> gcc-4.0.0-8 >> libgcc-4.0.0-6 >> libgcc-4.0.0-8 > > > Using 3.3.5 here. > >>>>>> [root@elza php-gtk]# ./buildconf >>>>>> Configuring for: >>>>>> PHP Api Version: 20041225 >>>>>> Zend Module Api No: 20041031 >>>>>> Zend Extension Api No: 220041031 >>>>>> rebuilding aclocal.m4 >>>>>> configure.in:5: warning: LT_AC_PATH_SEPARATOR is m4_require'd but >>>>>> is not >>>>>> m4_defun'd >>>>>> configure.in:5: LT_AC_PATH_SEPARATOR is required by... > > > This is really looking wierd. What m4 version are you using? I'm using > 1.4.2. I think most if not all problems steam from the underlying > problem that all the macros are not properly initialized. > > >>>>>> [root@elza php-gtk]# './configure' '--prefix=/usr/local/php5' >>>>>> '--exec-prefix=/usr/local/php5' '--disable-scrollpane' >>>>>> '--disable-spaned' '--disable-sqpane' '--disable-combobutton' >>>>>> '--disable-libglade' '--disable-piemenu' >>>>>> -bash: ./configure: Permission denied > > > I'm having this problem repeatadly too. > >>>>>> ./configure: line 2682: s/.*>//: No such file or directory > > > Also very wierd. Some expressions are not properly quoted/expanded or > something like that. > >>>>>> checking for gawk... (cached) gawk >>>>>> ./configure: line 3262: -e: command not found >>>>>> ./configure: line 3274: >>>>>> s#@ext_srcdir@#/compartilhado/downloads/php-gtk2/php-gtk#g: No >>>>>> such file >>>>>> or directory >>>>>> ./configure: line 3274: s#@ext_builddir@#.#g: command not found > > > Same as above. Looks really like one of the tools in the chain doesn't > work properly. > >>>>>> checking for GLIB - version >= 2.6.0... yes (version 2.6.4) >>>>>> ./configure: line 9127: s/[^a-zA-Z0-9]/_/g: No such file or directory > > > I'm getting wondering if the shell could be the problem? But I don't > think so. > > > Jani is the god when it comes to this stuff (cc'ed him). > > > Anyway, the current requirements for php-gtk2 are really very fragile at > the moment as I'm running in similiar problems every time I need to set > up a development environment (and try not to change it once it's running). > > good luck, > > - Markus
____________________________________________________ Yahoo! Mail, cada vez melhor: agora com 1GB de espaço grátis! http://mail.yahoo.com.br
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] php-gtk2 buildconf/configure/make error
email.body:
Hi!
I'm using version 1.4.3 of m4.
[]'s Daniel Braga
