If it were such a special case, would it be possible to extend the php-gtk2 source generator to supply such reflection information as well?
Regards/MfG, Christian Weiske -- XMMS is playing now: Sarah Connor - Sweet Thang

Ah ok, this core stuff I better leave to the master.
A little digging showed me that in php-gtk/main/phpg_value.c in phpg_gvalue_to_zval() if you return SUCCESS instead of FAILURE in the switch/default branch, it doesn't crash (but it outputs the warning) and your handler gets properly called (though I didn't verify if doing anything serious in this handler continues to work).
I think the gpointer in that case isn't needed as you can pass custom php values anyway with signal(), but that's Andrei to do the right thing [tm].

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-Gtk2 and Reflection
email.body:
Yes, the extension sources need to implement special structures that describe the types and names of parameters. I have not implemented this as it would increase the size of the generated files even more. Is this really necessary? I understand that it's very cool to be able to browse the methods and see their parameters, but I guarantee you that it will adversely affect the build time of PHP-GTK.
-Andrei
On May 10, 2005, at 3:24 AM, Christian Weiske wrote:
> Do you know if the Reflection class implmentation is just buggy that it > doesn't have information about all method parameters, or do the classes > do need to have special comments or such that reflection can parse? > If it were such a special case, would it be possible to extend the > php-gtk2 source generator to supply such reflection information as > well?
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-Gtk2 and Reflection
email.body:
Hi Andrei,
> describe the types and names of parameters. I have not implemented this > as it would increase the size of the generated files even more. Is this > really necessary? IMO yes; for what are the reflection functions for? If nobody supports it, it isn't useful. For example, I love the Java Reflection API - once I built a tool similar to glade, but in Java - and the main work was doing some reflection, and *every* bean could be used with my program. If some bean authors would have decided (in Java you can't, but imagine) that they didn't want it, Reflection would be pretty useless. Sometimes it works, sometimes not.
> I understand that it's very cool to be able to browse > the methods and see their parameters, but I guarantee you that it will > adversely affect the build time of PHP-GTK. As we (?) don't compile PHP-Gtk every 10 minutes, this would be ok. A small configure switch could turn it off if wished by the user, but by default it should be activated. Maybe I can help with that; is there some documentation about that stuff?
Regards/MfG, Christian Weiske -- XMMS is playing now: Sarah Connor - Sweet Thang
["signature.asc" (application/pgp-signature)]

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-Gtk2 and Reflection
email.body:
-Andrei
On May 10, 2005, at 10:02 AM, Christian Weiske wrote: > IMO yes; for what are the reflection functions for? If nobody supports > it, it isn't useful.
Oh, come on Christian. Are you telling me that in the grand scheme of things the ability to query information about method parameters at runtime is crucial to the widespread use of PHP-GTK 2? The only thing it could potentially be useful for is a class browser like the one you wrote. I understand that it might come in handy when writing Java-like beans, but then you are worried about userland methods mostly, not C ones.
> As we (?) don't compile PHP-Gtk every 10 minutes, this would be ok. A > small configure switch could turn it off if wished by the user, but by > default it should be activated. > Maybe I can help with that; is there some documentation about that > stuff?
What stuff? Reflection? You can ask Marcus Boerger.
-Andrei

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Exposing signal in 'unknown signal name' error
email.body:
Hi,
a small one-liner to see the wrongly typed signal name.
- Markus
["phpg_gobject.diff.txt" (text/plain)]
Index: phpg_gobject.c =================================================================== RCS file: /repository/php-gtk/main/phpg_gobject.c,v retrieving revision 1.42 diff -u -r1.42 phpg_gobject.c --- phpg_gobject.c 16 Apr 2005 04:54:25 -0000 1.42 +++ phpg_gobject.c 9 May 2005 14:04:18 -0000 @@ -333,7 +333,7 @@
obj = PHPG_GOBJECT(this_ptr); if (!g_signal_parse_name(signal, G_OBJECT_TYPE(obj), &signal_id, &detail, TRUE)) \ { - php_error(E_WARNING, "%s(): unknown signal name", \ get_active_function_name(TSRMLS_C)); + php_error(E_WARNING, "%s(): unknown \ signal name '%s'", get_active_function_name(TSRMLS_C), signal); return; }

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] May News
email.body:
Ugh, so much trouble for so little payoff.. :)
On May 18, 2005, at 10:21 AM, Christian Weiske wrote:
> Hello Andrei, > >> How can you reflect a non-existing class? By the time generator runs, >> all the Gtk+ types should be mapped to PHP-GTK types. > That is right. But if there is one enum which isn't mapped, it there > will be the type hint > ZEND_ARG_OBJ_INFO(0, myParameter, SomeEnumClass, 0) > in the generated files. > If you reflect the function now, try to get the parameters and their > type (in our case the non-existant SomeEnumClass), you try to reflect > an > undefined class. > >> When would you run >> this script, really? > After the generator has been run and php-gtk has been installed. It > tries to find all the classes used as type in ZEND_ARG_OBJ_INFO, and > match them with the classes defined in the running php (so with the > get_declared_classes array). That's IMO the only way to find out if > there is an enum type which hasn't been mapped. > > > Regards/MfG, > Christian Weiske > -- > XMMS is playing now: > Reamonn - Everytime She Goes Away
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

> Hi , tricky indeed :D > > I made sure I had the same versions as yourself with the same > results. > Then after seeing on a google a ref to `aclocal --print-ac-dir` > noticed that the ac dir was in fact wrong (had to symlink /usr/ > local/share/aclocal to /usr/share/aclocal) > > That solved my original issue with AC_PROG_LIBTOOL , but now I get > stuck at AC_MSG_ERROR.... > > I also tried Andrei's advice in another thread ... > >> XANFIRE:/root_old/php-gtk/php-gtk# sh -x /root_old/php-5.0.3/ > scripts/phpize > which does call aclocal but I still get > configure.in:22: error: possibly undefined macro: > AC_MSG_ERROR ...etc > > The thing that PUZZLES me most is why when I ./buildconf --force > for PHP-5.0.3 itself I get no such errors ??? & AC_MSG_ERROR must > be defined somewhere as it gets called if I deliberately break ./ > configure > > So if it works for PHP5 itself surely it can't be my automake/ > autoconf/libtool versions that are the issue ? if that makes sense > where would I start looking to fix ? I have done a fair bit of > googling but obviously I am out of my depth at this level... a > starter for 10 would be the answer to where AC_MSG_ERROR is defined > or is it internal to aclocal or whatever , or why does it work for > PHP5 itself ? > > Regards, > Simon. > > > > > > > Markus Fischer wrote: > > >> Hi, >> >> yes its really tricky on debian. I'm fighting it every time I >> install it new and try not to modify my environment once it works. >> >> However one thing for me was pretty sure that I need automake 1.9 >> (currently 1.9.5). autoconf is 2.59, libtool is 1.4.3, flex is >> 2.5.4 (flex-old package). >> >> HTH >> >> Simon Wheeler wrote: >> >> >>> Hi , >>> I am having problems with buildconf on debian, I see the error >>> probably relates to versions of autoconf,automake & libtool >>> though I have to use autoconf >=2.5 for other (xandros) dependecies. >>> automake & libtool are `correct` versions 1.4 && 1.4.3. >>> >>> [Last time I tried I had no such issues on Fedora & it compiled >>> out of the box] >>> >>> >> >>> configure.in:65: error: possibly undefined macro: AC_PROG_LIBTOOL >>> If this token and others are legitimate, please use >>> m4_pattern_allow. >>> See the Autoconf documentation. >>> >>> Any workarounds or ideas for a non-hardcore linux user? >>> >>> Regards, >>> Simon. >>> >>> >> >> > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >

That being said, what about an exception? If you are really > trying to get the iter and it isn't initialized, I would think not > having th iter would be an exception case. Therefore, I would expect to > catch an exception. But I have never used this method/function in C or > PHP so I may not understand the context properly.

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] GtkRadioButton Prevent Input
email.body:
Brian Stumm wrote:
> I'm using GtkRadioButtons to display the status of dipswitch banks used > on some electronic circuit boards. I'd like to make these read only so > the client/user cannot change the on/off status of the buttons. How > would I go about doing this or what other widget might I look at to > accomplish this?
Try using set_sensative() (http://gtk.php.net/manual/en/gtk.gtkwidget.method.set_sensitive.php) It may have an undesired effect though since it tends to grey out the buttons.
You might also want to consider connecting the clicked signal to a method that just returns the button to the previous state. If neither of those approaches works what about using a small image to indicate the switches status?
-- Scott Mattocks scott@crisscott.com http://www.crisscott.com http://pear.php.net/user/scottmattocks
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] #26679 [Fbk->NoF]: php error messages in c files
email.body:
ID: 26679 Updated by: php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net Reported By: vpupkin at comcast dot net -Status: Feedback +Status: No Feedback Bug Type: PHP-GTK related Operating System: Linux PHP Version: Irrelevant New Comment: No feedback was provided for this bug for over a week, so it is being suspended automatically. If you are able to provide the information that was originally requested, please do so and change the status of the bug back to "Open". Previous Comments: ------------------------------------------------------------------------ [2005-03-30 08:57:57] sniper@php.net Does this happen still..? ------------------------------------------------------------------------ [2004-08-13 09:39:37] gbp at reddleman dot org I have the same problem and it looks like it might be a bug in Pear's Getopt. The problem is with calling PHP in this fashion php -f file.php -- -o opt_value argument The '--' is not interpreted as the end of PHP arguments, but rather as the first script argument. The solution is, after configure, to replace all occurences with a line in this style: php -q file.php -o opt_value argument i.e., replace -f with -q and remove the -- After that, run make clean find -name "gen_*" -exec rm {} \; make That did it for me. ------------------------------------------------------------------------ [2003-12-19 23:45:24] vpupkin at comcast dot net Description: ------------ to reproduce (php-gtk-1.0.0) $./buildconf $./configure ... ./configure: line 3665: syntax error near unexpected token `debug,' ./configure: line 3665: `PHP_GTK_ARG_ENABLE(debug, whether to include debugging symbols,' $aclocal $./buildconf $./configure $make files: /ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.c contains (it's inside the file): br /> Warning: fopen(--): failed to open stream: No such file or directory in /dev/php-gtk/generator/scheme.php on line 110

Warning: fgets(): supplied argument is not a valid stream resource in /dev/php-gtk/generator/scheme.php on line 34
/ext/gtk+/get_gdk.c contains:
Warning: filemtime(): Stat failed for -- (errno=2 - No such file or directory) in /dev/php-gtk/generator/scheme.php on line 101
you can remove those line from the files and do "make" (it will go a bit farther) again, but then you receive the folliwing: /dev/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_object.c: In function `php_gtk_arg_from_value': /dev/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_object.c:615: error: `gtk_object_ce' undeclared (first use in this function) /dev/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_object.c:615: error: (Each undeclared identifier is reported only once /dev/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_object.c:615: error: for each function it appears in.) /dev/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_object.c: In function `php_gtk_ret_from_value': /dev/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_object.c:892: error: `gtk_object_ce' undeclared (first use in this function) make: *** [main/php_gtk_object.lo] Error 1 Hope it helps. Thanks Alexander Kabanov ------------------------------------------------------------------------ -- Edit this bug report at http://bugs.php.net/?id=26679&edit=1 -- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

Hello,

Thanks, Scott

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] configure problem nowy
email.body:
You propably don't have the required pkg-config file (atk.pc) installed..for FC3 it needed atk-devel rpm to be installed. And propably some other devel packages as well..
That error message should be changed a bit. :)
--Jani
On Mon, 25 Apr 2005, Markus Fischer wrote:
> I've attached the config.log now. To me I can't find any indication to why it > really failed. > > - Markus > > Ivan Rodriguez wrote: >> Jani GTK+ version is 2.6.4 >> checking for GTK+ - version >= 2.6.0... yes (version 2.6.4) >> >> ... >> >> On 4/25/05, Jani Taskinen <sniper@iki.fi> wrote: >> >>> On Mon, 25 Apr 2005, Markus Fischer wrote: >>> >>> >>>> Jani Taskinen wrote: >>>> >>>>> On Mon, 25 Apr 2005, Markus Fischer wrote: >>>>> >>>>>> Can you provide the version numbers you're using for successful php-gtk >>>>>> compilatin (or Andrei) ? >>>>> >>>>> >>>>> autoconf 2.13 (the phpize part of the buildconf) >>>>> autoconf 2.59 (for the rebuild part) >>>>> automake 1.9.2 (for aclocal part) >>>>> >>>>> It works as fine with not setting PHP_AUTOCONF too..for you it's >>>>> not gonna help. autoconf should point to the latest.. >>>> >>>> Hmm .. so PHP needs two different autoconf version for different parts? >>>> How do >>> >>> PHP doesn't need anything but autoconf 2.13, it doesn't use automake at >>> all. >>> >>> >>>> you switch between those parts? So you set the env variable PHP_AUTOCONF >>>> with >>>> a full path to the version? >>> >>> I have PHP_AUTOCONF set to autoconf-2.13 but it would work fine with >>> autoconf 2.59 too. >>> It's just faster to use 2.13 with it. (autoconf 2.5x is really SLOW) >>> >>> >>>> Anyway, while writing this mail I purged automake 1.4 and installed 1.9 (I >>>> thought that 1.4 was an explicit requirement?) and the ./buildconf step >>>> did >>>> finish. >>>> >>>> I'm not stuck with the following: >>>> >>>> configure: error: PHP-GTK 2.x requires Gtk+ 2.x >>> >>> Well, check config.log for the real reason? >>> (assuming you do have Gtk+ 2.x..) >>> >>> --Jani >>> >>> -- >>> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) >>> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >>> >>> >> >> > >

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] configure problem now
email.body:
Jani Taskinen wrote: > On Mon, 25 Apr 2005, Markus Fischer wrote: >> Can you provide the version numbers you're using for successful >> php-gtk compilatin (or Andrei) ? > > > autoconf 2.13 (the phpize part of the buildconf) > autoconf 2.59 (for the rebuild part) > automake 1.9.2 (for aclocal part) > > It works as fine with not setting PHP_AUTOCONF too..for you it's > not gonna help. autoconf should point to the latest..
Hmm .. so PHP needs two different autoconf version for different parts? How do you switch between those parts? So you set the env variable PHP_AUTOCONF with a full path to the version?
Anyway, while writing this mail I purged automake 1.4 and installed 1.9 (I thought that 1.4 was an explicit requirement?) and the ./buildconf step did finish.
I'm not stuck with the following:
configure: error: PHP-GTK 2.x requires Gtk+ 2.x
Here's the complete output: ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ $ rm -Rf php-gtk && cp -a php-gtk.clean/ php-gtk && cd php-gtk && ./buildconf --with-phpize=/home/mfischer/install/php5/bin/phpize && ./configure && make && make install Configuring for: PHP Api Version: 20041225 Zend Module Api No: 20041031 Zend Extension Api No: 220041031 rebuilding aclocal.m4 rebuilding configure rebuilding config.h.in checking build system type... i686-pc-linux-gnu checking host system type... i686-pc-linux-gnu checking target system type... i686-pc-linux-gnu checking for gcc... gcc checking for C compiler default output file name... a.out checking whether the C compiler works... yes checking whether we are cross compiling... no checking for suffix of executables... checking for suffix of object files... o checking whether we are using the GNU C compiler... yes checking whether gcc accepts -g... yes checking for gcc option to accept ANSI C... none needed checking whether gcc and cc understand -c and -o together... yes checking if compiler supports -R... no checking if compiler supports -Wl,-rpath,... yes checking for PHP prefix... /home/mfischer/install/php5 checking for PHP includes... -I/home/mfischer/install/php5/include/php -I/home/mfischer/install/php5/include/php/main -I/home/mfischer/install/php5/include/php/TSRM -I/home/mfischer/install/php5/include/php/Zend checking for PHP extension directory... /home/mfischer/install/php5/lib/php/extensions/no-debug-non-zts-20041031 checking for re2c... no configure: WARNING: You will need re2c 0.94 or later if you want to regenerate PHP parsers. checking for gawk... gawk checking for PHP-GTK support... yes, shared checking for PHP executable in /home/mfischer/install/php5/bin... found version 5.1.0-dev checking for gawk... (cached) gawk checking for GtkCanvas support... no checking for GtkComboButton support... yes checking for GtkExtra support... no checking for GdkPixbuf support... no checking for pkg-config... /usr/bin/pkg-config checking for GLIB - version >= 2.6.0... yes (version 2.6.4) checking for pkg-config... (cached) /usr/bin/pkg-config checking for GTK+ - version >= 2.6.0... yes (version 2.6.4) checking pkg-config is at least version 0.9.0... yes checking for ATK_CFLAGS... checking for ATK_LIBS... configure: error: PHP-GTK 2.x requires Gtk+ 2.x ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
thanks, - Markus
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: demos (was: Relative paths in generator)
email.body:
On Apr 25, 2005, at 2:50 PM, Christian Weiske wrote:
> Yeah, a bit. > The framework has a listview instead of the treeview (as treeview has > some instantiation problems), double click doesn't work because php-gtk > crashes if it tries to call the callback function (but the demos are > included in a tab instead, but can be run standalone as well).
It would be good if you kept notes of what doesn't work exactly, so that I can concentrate on fixing that stuff.
> There are buttons (stock items seem not to work OR you have to tell me > how to pass the stock id to the factory method (something like "gtk-ok" > like in pygtk doesn't work)
I found a problem with GtkButton::new_from_stock() which I am fixing right now.
> entrycompletion is ok, expander too, in > sizegroups I didn't get the new_text factory method in GtkComboButton > to > work, so the dropdowns have no entries and the whole thing is useless. > That's all.
Could you put together an exact list of things you ran into?
> > And I noted that docgen doesn't generate the signatures (parameter > lists) for *some* functions. I'll have to dig in the code, but perhaps > this will be fixed automatically when more functions and classes are > supported.
Can you see if it's something in docgen? Better be sure than wait until it is "maybe" fixed.
-Andrei
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] configure problem now
email.body:
On Mon, 25 Apr 2005, Markus Fischer wrote:
> Jani Taskinen wrote: >> On Mon, 25 Apr 2005, Markus Fischer wrote: >>> Can you provide the version numbers you're using for successful php-gtk >>> compilatin (or Andrei) ? >> >> >> autoconf 2.13 (the phpize part of the buildconf) >> autoconf 2.59 (for the rebuild part) >> automake 1.9.2 (for aclocal part) >> >> It works as fine with not setting PHP_AUTOCONF too..for you it's >> not gonna help. autoconf should point to the latest.. > > Hmm .. so PHP needs two different autoconf version for different parts? How do
PHP doesn't need anything but autoconf 2.13, it doesn't use automake at all.
> you switch between those parts? So you set the env variable PHP_AUTOCONF with > a full path to the version?
I have PHP_AUTOCONF set to autoconf-2.13 but it would work fine with autoconf 2.59 too. It's just faster to use 2.13 with it. (autoconf 2.5x is really SLOW)
> Anyway, while writing this mail I purged automake 1.4 and installed 1.9 (I > thought that 1.4 was an explicit requirement?) and the ./buildconf step did > finish. > > I'm not stuck with the following: > > configure: error: PHP-GTK 2.x requires Gtk+ 2.x
Well, check config.log for the real reason? (assuming you do have Gtk+ 2.x..)
--Jani
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] demos
email.body:
Hi Andrei,
> I fixed this problem. You should be able to create stock buttons now. Thanks, works now.
> Could you put together an exact list of things you ran into? 1. GtkCombo can't be instantiated via new_text factory method: =============== $option_menu = GtkComboBox::new_text();
PHP Warning: PHP-GTK internal error: could not get typecode from value in /data/cvs/phpgtk2/php-gtk/demos/sizegroup.php on line 106
(sizegroup.php:13382): GLib-GObject-CRITICAL **: g_object_newv: assertion `G_TYPE_IS_OBJECT (object_type)' failed ===============
2. GtkBox doesn't support set_layout yet.
3. Do we use "Gtk::" or "gtk::" like in php-gtk1? I know for php it doesn't matter, but we should stay constant in docs.
4. Is there a way to get all registered constants?
Regards/MfG, Christian Weiske -- XMMS is playing now: The Cardigans - Explode
["signature.asc" (application/pgp-signature)]

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: Some missing things
email.body:
On Apr 27, 2005, at 5:06 AM, Christian Weiske wrote:
> Hi Andrei, > > > When doing the colordemo I noted some things: > - GdkColor is missing
Yes, the constructor needs to be written.
> - more serious: The GtkButton factory methods are not working.
What do you mean? GtkButton::new_from_stock() should work.
> - When I create a new GtkButton, the mnemonics aren't recognized. When > doing the same with a GtkCheckButton, they are (see sizegroupdemo, it > works there)
new GtkButton("_Click me", true)
Check gtk.overrides - you will see that use_underline is an optional method.
> - I suppose that functions like get_current_color of GtkColorSelection > requiring a GdkColor parameter instead of returning it will be fixed as > sool as GdkColor is supported?
No, they will have to be written by hand.
-Andrei
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Exception Stack Trace
email.body:
Hello,
The attached code snippet produces these two stack traces from exceptions:
Warning: GtkMenuItem::__construct() requires exactly 0 arguments, 1 given in /home/scott/php-gtk2_test.php on line 14 could not construct GtkMenuItem object #0 /home/scott/php-gtk2_test.php(28): func0('GtkMenuItem') #1 {main} TestClass __construct problem. #0 /home/scott/php-gtk2_test.php(21): TestClass->__construct('TestClass') #1 /home/scott/php-gtk2_test.php(28): func0('func0') #2 {main}
The thing that I don't understand is why the first trace puts the 'GtkMenuItem' parameter in the func0() call. Do stack traces with "built-in" objects behave differently than with user defined objects? Or is something not functioning right here?
Thanks, Scott
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
email.body:
Markus,
Change line 150 of generator/scheme.php from isset() to !empty(). Then remove the gen_* files and try again.
This worked for me but then I ran into some other problems. (see next message).
Scott
Markus Fischer wrote:
> Andrei Zmievski wrote: > >> You shouldn't be having this if you don't have any .cache files. >> Please remove all .cache files and also gen_* and try again. > > > I did so (there where no .cache files) and ran the process again. I've > atteched the output of make. > > The generator has some problems getting the input. > > thanks, > - Markus >
-- Scott Mattocks scott@crisscott.com http://www.crisscott.com http://pear.php.net/user/scottmattocks
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
email.body:
Shouldn't line 113 of gtkcombobutton.c read
gtk_combobutton_class_init (GtkComboButtonClass *class)
rather than
gtk_combobutton_class_init (GtkComboButtonClass *klass)
?
- and the same with the other widgets in the init declaration?
object_class = (GtkObjectClass*) class; widget_class = (GtkWidgetClass*) class;
(anyone in a position to suck it and see?)
----- Original Message ----- From: "Steph" <steph@zend.com> To: "Scott Mattocks" <scott@crisscott.com> Cc: <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Monday, April 25, 2005 7:55 PM Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
email.body:
Hi all,
> scrollpane/gtkscrollpane.c sufferes from the same problem. My config is the following:
#! /bin/sh # # Created by configure
'./configure' \ '--prefix=/data/cvs/php/php5install/' \ '--exec-prefix=/data/cvs/php/php5install/' \ '--with-php-config=/data/cvs/php/php5install/bin/php-config' \ '--disable-scrollpane' \ '--disable-spaned' \ '--disable-sqpane' \ '--disable-combobutton' \ '--disable-libglade' \ '--disable-piemenu' \ "$@"
Regards/MfG, Christian Weiske -- XMMS is playing now: The Cardigans - celia inside
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
email.body:
I wonder if the semantics of isset() on properties have changed. I'll change it to !empty() in the sources.
-Andrei
On Apr 25, 2005, at 11:41 AM, Scott Mattocks wrote:
> Markus, > > Change line 150 of generator/scheme.php from isset() to !empty(). Then > remove the gen_* files and try again. > > This worked for me but then I ran into some other problems. (see next > message). > > Scott > > Markus Fischer wrote: > >> Andrei Zmievski wrote: >>> You shouldn't be having this if you don't have any .cache files. >>> Please remove all .cache files and also gen_* and try again. >> I did so (there where no .cache files) and ran the process again. >> I've atteched the output of make. >> The generator has some problems getting the input. >> thanks, >> - Markus > > -- > Scott Mattocks > scott@crisscott.com > http://www.crisscott.com > http://pear.php.net/user/scottmattocks
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
email.body:
You should disable all the extensions. At this point, none of them work.
-Andrei
On Apr 25, 2005, at 11:45 AM, Scott Mattocks wrote:

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
email.body:
Andrei Zmievski wrote: > You should disable all the extensions. At this point, none of them work.
Okay, to know that in advance would have helped ... I got it compiling now, but the Gtk class is not available:
$ php -r 'gtk::main();' Fatal error: Call to undefined method Gtk::main() in Command line code on line 1
$ php -r 'var_dump(class_exists('gtk'));' bool(true)
So I assume though the generator did work it didn't work completely ..
- Markus
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
email.body:
Check gen_gtk.c for PHP_METHOD(Gtk, main) definition. Make sure you've installed the extension and are loading it via "extension=" line in .ini.
-Andrei
On Apr 25, 2005, at 12:36 PM, Markus Fischer wrote:
> Andrei Zmievski wrote: >> You should disable all the extensions. At this point, none of them >> work. > > Okay, to know that in advance would have helped ... I got it compiling > now, but the Gtk class is not available: > > $ php -r 'gtk::main();' > Fatal error: Call to undefined method Gtk::main() in Command line code > on line 1 > > $ php -r 'var_dump(class_exists('gtk'));' > bool(true) > > So I assume though the generator did work it didn't work completely .. > > - Markus

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
email.body:
Andrei Zmievski wrote:
> Check gen_gtk.c for PHP_METHOD(Gtk, main) definition. Make sure you've > installed the extension and are loading it via "extension=" line in .ini.
I got things working now I think. The extesion was missing .so on my system. Make sure it is named right and if it isn't rename it. (php_gtk2.so)
The demo doesn't seem to be working right but I will play around with that later. Thanks for all your help Andrei.
Scott

email.body:
Andrei Zmievski wrote: > Check gen_gtk.c for PHP_METHOD(Gtk, main) definition. Make sure you've > installed the extension and are loading it via "extension=" line in .ini.
It's is loaded and enabled in php.ini, I tried running the stock-browser2.php demo, but gives many warnings.
$ grep PHP_METHOD ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.c|grep main static PHP_METHOD(GtkActionGroup, set_translation_domain)
so there's no main defined ....
and
$ php demos/stock-browser2.php
Warning: GtkWindow::set_title() is deprecated in /home/mfischer/isrc/php/php-gtk/demos/stock-browser2.php on line 48 Warning: GtkWindow::set_position() is deprecated in /home/mfischer/isrc/php/php-gtk/demos/stock-browser2.php on line 49 Warning: GtkWindow::set_default_size() is deprecated in /home/mfischer/isrc/php/php-gtk/demos/stock-browser2.php on line 50 Warning: GtkContainer::set_border_width() is deprecated in /home/mfischer/isrc/php/php-gtk/demos/stock-browser2.php on line 51 Warning: GtkScrolledWindow::set_shadow_type() is deprecated in /home/mfischer/isrc/php/php-gtk/demos/stock-browser2.php on line 62 Warning: GtkScrolledWindow::set_policy() is deprecated in /home/mfischer/isrc/php/php-gtk/demos/stock-browser2.php on line 63 Warning: GtkBox::pack_start() is deprecated in /home/mfischer/isrc/php/php-gtk/demos/stock-browser2.php on line 64 Fatal error: Call to undefined method Gtk::stock_list_ids() in /home/mfischer/isrc/php/php-gtk/demos/stock-browser2.php on line 130

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
email.body:
Hi Markus,
> $ php demos/stock-browser2.php stock-browser.php is Andrei's original version, the stock-browser2.php is the one I changed a bit for the phpgtk2-demo.php suite.
I doubt there will any problems, but to be sure user stock-browser.php
Regards/MfG, Christian Weiske -- XMMS is playing now: 2Raumwohnung - Die Schwere

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
email.body:
Hello,
I am getting close to having a working PHP-GTK 2 but I am running into some troubles with generator.php and friends. The file paths (ext/gtk+/atk.overrides, etc...) are all relative but the script isn't changing directories when needed. I put a little check into overrides.php but other files are still complaining (scheme.php). Before I go crazy updating all of these scripts, is there something else I should be doing? Or is my set up wrong?
Thanks, -- Scott Mattocks scott@crisscott.com http://www.crisscott.com
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
email.body:
Are you using CGI or CLI version of PHP? Are you configuring and running make in the php-gtk directory or from outside of it? Can you cut & paste the shell execution of generator? Mine is:
guest-111% make ( \ /usr/local/php5//bin/php /Users/andrei/dev/php-gtk/generator/generator.php \ -l ext/gtk+/gen_gdk.log \ -r ext/gtk+/atk-types.defs \ -r ext/gtk+/pango-types.defs \ -r ext/gtk+/gdk-types.defs \ -r ext/gtk+/gtk-types.defs \ -o ext/gtk+/gdk.overrides \ -p gdk \ -f ext/gtk+/gen_gdk.c ext/gtk+/gdk.defs \ && grep -h "^PHP_GTK_EXPORT_CE" ext/gtk+/gen_gdk.c | sed -e "s!^!extern !" > ext/gtk+/gen_gdk.h \ ) ^Cmake: *** [ext/gtk+/gen_gdk.c] Interrupt
guest-111% pwd /Users/andrei/dev/php-gtk
-Andrei
On Apr 25, 2005, at 7:15 AM, Scott Mattocks wrote:
> Hello, > > I am getting close to having a working PHP-GTK 2 but I am running into > some troubles with generator.php and friends. The file paths > (ext/gtk+/atk.overrides, etc...) are all relative but the script isn't > changing directories when needed. I put a little check into > overrides.php but other files are still complaining (scheme.php). > Before I go crazy updating all of these scripts, is there something > else I should be doing? Or is my set up wrong? > > Thanks, > -- > Scott Mattocks > scott@crisscott.com > http://www.crisscott.com > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

Ok. I am getting closer. Now I get:
ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.c: In function `phpg_gtk_register_constants': ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.c:28: error: `gtk_ce' undeclared (first use in this function) ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.c:28: error: (Each undeclared identifier is reported only once ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.c:28: error: for each function it appears in.) make: *** [ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.lo] Error 1

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
email.body:
It's the result. It looks like the gtk-types.defs and other *-types.defs files aren't being parsed. Can you do a bit more digging in generator/scheme.php and see whether handler for include statement is actually parsing the included files. What does the output of generator say during 'make'?
-Andrei
On Apr 25, 2005, at 11:13 AM, Scott Mattocks wrote:
> Same problem. Actually all the gen_*.h files are empty. (atk, gdk, > gtk, pango). I took a look at the gen_gtk.log file and it is pretty > empty. I don't know if that is a symptom or a result though. > > Scott > > Andrei Zmievski wrote: > >> This is definitely a problem. There should be all kinds of class >> registrations in that function. Can you run: >> make clean-caches >> make clean-gen >> make >> -Andrei >> On Apr 25, 2005, at 11:01 AM, Scott Mattocks wrote: >>> void phpg_gtk_register_classes(void) >>> { >>> TSRMLS_FETCH(); >>> } > > -- > Scott Mattocks > scott@crisscott.com > http://www.crisscott.com > http://pear.php.net/user/scottmattocks
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
email.body:
You shouldn't be having this if you don't have any .cache files. Please remove all .cache files and also gen_* and try again.
-Andrei
On Apr 25, 2005, at 11:14 AM, Markus Fischer wrote:
> Scott Mattocks wrote: > > Ok. I am getting closer. Now I get: > > > > ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.c: In function `phpg_gtk_register_constants': > > ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.c:28: error: `gtk_ce' undeclared (first use in this > > function) > > ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.c:28: error: (Each undeclared identifier is reported > > only once > > ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.c:28: error: for each function it appears in.) > > make: *** [ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.lo] Error 1 > > > > This looks familiar but I didn't find anything in the mailing list > > archives. Any ideas? > > I'm there exactly now too. > > It seems the generator does not run properly: > ( \ > /home/mfischer/install/php5/bin/php > /home/mfischer/isrc/php/php-gtk/generator/generator.php \ > -l ext/gtk+/gen_atk.log \ > -r ext/gtk+/atk-types.defs \ > -r ext/gtk+/pango-types.defs \ > -r ext/gtk+/gdk-types.defs \ > -r ext/gtk+/gtk-types.defs \ > -o ext/gtk+/atk.overrides \ > -p atk \ > -f ext/gtk+/gen_atk.c ext/gtk+/atk.defs \ > && grep -h "^PHP_GTK_EXPORT_CE" ext/gtk+/gen_atk.c | sed -e > "s!^!extern !" > ext/gtk+/gen_atk.h \ > ) > Notice: unserialize(): Argument is not a string in > /home/mfischer/isrc/php/php-gtk/generator/scheme.php on line 196 > Warning: Invalid argument supplied for foreach() in > /home/mfischer/isrc/php/php-gtk/generator/scheme.php on line 196 > Notice: unserialize(): Argument is not a string in > /home/mfischer/isrc/php/php-gtk/generator/scheme.php on line 196 > Warning: Invalid argument supplied for foreach() in > /home/mfischer/isrc/php/php-gtk/generator/scheme.php on line 196 > Notice: unserialize(): Argument is not a string in > /home/mfischer/isrc/php/php-gtk/generator/scheme.php on line 196 > Warning: Invalid argument supplied for foreach() in > /home/mfischer/isrc/php/php-gtk/generator/scheme.php on line 196 > Notice: unserialize(): Argument is not a string in > /home/mfischer/isrc/php/php-gtk/generator/scheme.php on line 196 > Warning: Invalid argument supplied for foreach() in > /home/mfischer/isrc/php/php-gtk/generator/scheme.php on line 196 > Notice: unserialize(): Argument is not a string in > /home/mfischer/isrc/php/php-gtk/generator/scheme.php on line 196 > Warning: Invalid argument supplied for foreach() in > /home/mfischer/isrc/php/php-gtk/generator/scheme.php on line 196 > > - Markus > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
email.body:
Andrei Zmievski wrote: > You shouldn't be having this if you don't have any .cache files. Please > remove all .cache files and also gen_* and try again.
I did so (there where no .cache files) and ran the process again. I've atteched the output of make.
The generator has some problems getting the input.
thanks, - Markus

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
email.body:
Okay, guys, help me debug why it's not writing any functions. :) That's straight PHP code so you can hack it I'm sure..
-Andrei
On Apr 25, 2005, at 12:57 PM, Markus Fischer wrote:
> ======================================================================= > = > Gtk Coverage > ======================================================================= > = > Functions : none found > Methods : 81.3% written (1571/1933) > Constructors : 93.1% written (149/160) > Property accessors : 100.0% written (174/174)
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
email.body:
I added:
echo "VAR DUMP START\n"; var_dump($this->parser->functions); echo "VAR DUMP END\n";
at line 709. The output is attached. Everytime it runs, it prints an empty array.
Scott
Andrei Zmievski wrote: > Looks like no functions were generated.. That's disturbing. Could you > find write_functions() in generator/generator.php and put a > var_dump($this->parser->functions) there and run it again? > > -Andrei

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
email.body:
Andrei Zmievski wrote: > Okay, guys, help me debug why it's not writing any functions. :) That's > straight PHP code so you can hack it I'm sure..
I've to leave now and will continue tomorrow hopefully. However, a quick look shows that in write_classes() $this->parser->functions is an empty array, thus write_functions is never called.
- Markus
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
email.body:
If that array is empty, something is wrong in the scheme.php where it is supposed to be populated.
function handle_define_function($arg) { $function_def = new Function_Def($arg); if (isset($function_def->is_constructor_of)) { $old_def = @$this->functions[$function_def->c_name]; if (!isset($old_def) || $old_def->c_name == $old_def->name) { $this->constructors[$function_def->c_name] = $function_def; } } else { $old_def = @$this->functions[$function_def->c_name]; if (!isset($old_def) || $old_def->c_name == $old_def->name) { $this->functions[$function_def->c_name] = $function_def; } } $this->c_name[$function_def->c_name] = $function_def; }
I wonder if it's that isset() again.. Try changing it to empty() maybe?
-Andrei
On Apr 25, 2005, at 1:08 PM, Scott Mattocks wrote:
> I added: > > echo "VAR DUMP START\n"; > var_dump($this->parser->functions); > echo "VAR DUMP END\n"; > > at line 709. The output is attached. Everytime it runs, it prints an > empty array. > > Scott > > Andrei Zmievski wrote: >> Looks like no functions were generated.. That's disturbing. Could you >> find write_functions() in generator/generator.php and put a >> var_dump($this->parser->functions) there and run it again? >> -Andrei > ( \ > /usr/local/bin/php > email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
email.body:
Andrei Zmievski wrote:
> If that array is empty, something is wrong in the scheme.php where it > is supposed to be populated. > I wonder if it's that isset() again.. Try changing it to empty() maybe? > > -Andrei
The log says 55.2% functions written but I am still getting those deprecated method messages. I'll have to take a look a little later, its getting close to quittin' time.
Scott
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
email.body:
Andrei Zmievski wrote:
> Did you change it to empty()? How did you get 52% of functions now?
I changed the isset to !empty and the two !isset to empty. The attached file shows the code you gave, the output and the results of php -v.
Could it be something with the CVS version of PHP?
Scott
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
email.body:
Yes. I traced the problem to a change Marcus Boerger did on Apr 17. Use the modified code for now.. But stay tuned.
-Andrei
On Apr 25, 2005, at 1:37 PM, Scott Mattocks wrote:
> Andrei Zmievski wrote: > >> Did you change it to empty()? How did you get 52% of functions now? > > I changed the isset to !empty and the two !isset to empty. The > attached file shows the code you gave, the output and the results of > php -v. > > Could it be something with the CVS version of PHP? > > Scott > <scott.test>
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
email.body:
Okay. I reverted the bad change in PHP CVS. Please recompile PHP and then you can revert the code change you did to PHP-GTK.
-Andrei
On Apr 25, 2005, at 1:37 PM, Scott Mattocks wrote:
> Andrei Zmievski wrote: > >> Did you change it to empty()? How did you get 52% of functions now? > > I changed the isset to !empty and the two !isset to empty. The > attached file shows the code you gave, the output and the results of > php -v. > > Could it be something with the CVS version of PHP? > > Scott > <scott.test>
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
email.body:
Did you know you have array_merge() merging in two different directions just microseconds apart? sort_defs() does it kinda backwards..
----- Original Message ----- From: "Andrei Zmievski" <andrei@gravitonic.com> To: "Scott Mattocks" <scott@crisscott.com> Cc: <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net>; "Markus Fischer" <markus@fischer.name> Sent: Monday, April 25, 2005 9:15 PM Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
> If that array is empty, something is wrong in the scheme.php where it > is supposed to be populated. > > function handle_define_function($arg) > { > $function_def = new Function_Def($arg); > if (isset($function_def->is_constructor_of)) { > $old_def = @$this->functions[$function_def->c_name]; > if (!isset($old_def) || $old_def->c_name == $old_def->name) > { > $this->constructors[$function_def->c_name] = > $function_def; > } > } else { > $old_def = @$this->functions[$function_def->c_name]; > if (!isset($old_def) || $old_def->c_name == $old_def->name) > { > $this->functions[$function_def->c_name] = $function_def; > } > } > $this->c_name[$function_def->c_name] = $function_def; > } > > I wonder if it's that isset() again.. Try changing it to empty() maybe? > > -Andrei > > On Apr 25, 2005, at 1:08 PM, Scott Mattocks wrote: > > > I added: > > > > echo "VAR DUMP START\n"; > > var_dump($this->parser->functions); > > echo "VAR DUMP END\n"; > > > > at line 709. The output is attached. Everytime it runs, it prints an > > empty array. > > > > Scott > > > > Andrei Zmievski wrote: > >> Looks like no functions were generated.. That's disturbing. Could you > >> find write_functions() in generator/generator.php and put a > >> var_dump($this->parser->functions) there and run it again? > >> -Andrei > > ( \ > > /usr/local/bin/php > > /home/scott/src/php-gtk/generator/generator.php \ > > -l ext/gtk+/gen_atk.log \ > > -r ext/gtk+/atk-types.defs \ > > -r ext/gtk+/pango-types.defs \ > > -r ext/gtk+/gdk-types.defs \ > > -r ext/gtk+/gtk-types.defs \ > > -o ext/gtk+/atk.overrides \ > > -p atk \ > > -f ext/gtk+/gen_atk.c ext/gtk+/atk.defs \ > > && grep -h "^PHP_GTK_EXPORT_CE" ext/gtk+/gen_atk.c | sed -e > > "s!^!extern !" email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
email.body:
Where exactly?
-Andrei
On Apr 25, 2005, at 1:59 PM, Steph wrote:
> Did you know you have array_merge() merging in two different > directions just > microseconds apart? sort_defs() does it kinda backwards.. > > ----- Original Message ----- > From: "Andrei Zmievski" <andrei@gravitonic.com> > To: "Scott Mattocks" <scott@crisscott.com> > Cc: <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net>; "Markus Fischer" <markus@fischer.name> > Sent: Monday, April 25, 2005 9:15 PM > Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator > > >> If that array is empty, something is wrong in the scheme.php where it >> is supposed to be populated. >> >> function handle_define_function($arg) >> { >> $function_def = new Function_Def($arg); >> if (isset($function_def->is_constructor_of)) { >> $old_def = @$this->functions[$function_def->c_name]; >> if (!isset($old_def) || $old_def->c_name == >> $old_def->name) >> { >> $this->constructors[$function_def->c_name] = >> $function_def; >> } >> } else { >> $old_def = @$this->functions[$function_def->c_name]; >> if (!isset($old_def) || $old_def->c_name == >> $old_def->name) >> { >> $this->functions[$function_def->c_name] = >> $function_def; >> } >> } >> $this->c_name[$function_def->c_name] = $function_def; >> } >> >> I wonder if it's that isset() again.. Try changing it to empty() >> maybe? >> >> -Andrei >> >> On Apr 25, 2005, at 1:08 PM, Scott Mattocks wrote: >> >>> I added: >>> >>> echo "VAR DUMP START\n"; >>> var_dump($this->parser->functions); >>> echo "VAR DUMP END\n"; >>> >>> at line 709. The output is attached. Everytime it runs, it prints an >>> empty array. >>> >>> Scott >>> >>> Andrei Zmievski wrote: >>>> Looks like no functions were generated.. That's disturbing. Could >>>> you >>>> find write_functions() in generator/generator.php and put a >>>> var_dump($this->parser->functions) there and run it again? >>>> -Andrei >>> ( \ >>> /usr/local/bin/php >>> /home/scott/src/php-gtk/generator/generator.php \ >>> -l ext/gtk+/gen_atk.log \ >>> -r ext/gtk+/atk-types.defs \ >>> -r ext/gtk+/pango-types.defs \ >>> -r ext/gtk+/gdk-types.defs \ >>> -r ext/gtk+/gtk-types.defs \ >>> -o ext/gtk+/atk.overrides \ >>> -p atk \ >>> -f ext/gtk+/gen_atk.c ext/gtk+/atk.defs \ >>> && grep -h "^PHP_GTK_EXPORT_CE" ext/gtk+/gen_atk.c | sed -e >>> "s!^!extern !" > ext/gtk+/gen_atk.h \ >>> ) >>> >>> ===================================================================== >>> == >>> = >>> Atk Summary >>> ===================================================================== >>> == >>> = >>> >>> Atk >>> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ >>> VAR DUMP START >>> array(0) { >>> } >>> VAR email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Relative paths in generator
email.body:
Andrei Zmievski wrote:
> Okay. I reverted the bad change in PHP CVS. Please recompile PHP and > then you can revert the code change you did to PHP-GTK.
Fresh checkouts of PHP and PHP-GTK worked beautifully. Thanks.
Scott

Why this?¿
Any idea?¿
On 4/27/05, Sander Knopper <sander@knopper.tk> wrote: > I've got 2.6.4 running here and it compiles like it should when I disable all > the other extensions. > > Sander > > Op woensdag 27 april 2005 18:06, schreef Andrei Zmievski: > > I use 2.6.2. > > > > -Andrei > > > > On Apr 27, 2005, at 5:37 AM, Ivan Rodriguez wrote: > > > Andrei one question, what version of glib2 you use?¿ > > > > > > I can´t compile and i don´t know why :( > > > > > > On 4/26/05, Andrei Zmievski <andrei@gravitonic.com> wrote: > > >> Most, likely. I am not sure what to tell you, since no one else has > > >> run > > >> into this issue. > > >> > > >> -Andrei > > >> > > >> On Apr 26, 2005, at 11:49 AM, Ivan Rodriguez wrote: > > >>> The ./buildconf and ./configure commands run very well but make no :( > > >>> any idea? The error can be in the glib headers files?¿ > > > > > > -- > > > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > > > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Problems with make
email.body:
Ivan Rodriguez wrote:
> Hello > > I solved the other problem but now when I run make ocurred this: >
Make sure you are using the latest CVS version of PHP (or at least checked out after 2005-04-25). There was an issue with isset() a few days ago that Andrei had to revert.
Scott
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Problems with make
email.body:
Hi Scott
I read your post ... and I go to get the latest version of CVS and I go to try again
Thanks for your help :-)
On 4/28/05, Scott Mattocks <scott@crisscott.com> wrote: > Ivan Rodriguez wrote: > > > Hello > > > > I solved the other problem but now when I run make ocurred this: > > > > Make sure you are using the latest CVS version of PHP (or at least > checked out after 2005-04-25). There was an issue with isset() a few > days ago that Andrei had to revert. > > Scott >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Problems with make
email.body:
You need to rebuild your PHP from CVS, and try again.
-Andrei

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Problems with make
email.body:
Thanks Andrei I go to download now the CVS version of PHP :-)
if i compile today php-gtk2 if I compile php-gtk2 today I will be the happy person of the world :-)
regards
On 4/28/05, Andrei Zmievski <andrei@gravitonic.com> wrote: > You need to rebuild your PHP from CVS, and try again. > > -Andrei > > On Apr 28, 2005, at 5:10 AM, Ivan Rodriguez wrote: > > > Hello > > > email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Problems with make
email.body:
Hello
Finaly I compile php-gtk2 well :-)
Why the name of extension is php_gtk2 and not php_gtk2.so?¿
Regards
On 4/28/05, Ivan Rodriguez <epplestun@gmail.com> wrote: > Thanks Andrei I go to download now the CVS version of PHP :-) > > if i compile today php-gtk2 if I compile php-gtk2 today I will be the > happy person of the world :-) > > regards > > On 4/28/05, Andrei Zmievski <andrei@gravitonic.com> wrote: > > You need to rebuild your PHP from CVS, and try again. > > > > -Andrei > > > > On Apr 28, 2005, at 5:10 AM, Ivan Rodriguez wrote: > > > > > Hello > > > > > > I solved the other problem but now when I run make ocurred this: > > > > > > make > > > /bin/sh email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] ./buildconf not working with php5/head php-gtk/head
email.body:
This is disturbing. We may have to involve Jani here since he knows best about these sorts of things. I can't imagine why this macro would not be found, since it is a default autoconf macro.
Jani, any ideas? I believe Markus checked out php-gtk HEAD and tried to run ./buildconf in it against the latest PHP 5.1.
-Andrei
On Apr 17, 2005, at 12:40 PM, Markus Fischer wrote:
> Hi, > > I tried getting php-gtk head running with php5 head, but it breaks at > running ./buildconf: > > $ ./buildconf > Configuring for: > PHP Api Version: 20041225 > Zend Module Api No: 20041031 > Zend Extension Api No: 220041031 > autoconf: Undefined macros: > configure.in:20: AC_MSG_ERROR(Cannot find php-config. Please use > --with-php-config=PATH) > make: *** [buildmk.stamp] Error 1 > > I tried the fix written by Andrei > athttp://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=php-gtk-dev&m=111216704228211&w=2 > but it didn't work either. > > My exakt versions are is 2.13 . > > Is there anything else to watch out for? > > - Markus > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] ./buildconf not working with php5/head
email.body:

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] ./buildconf not working with php5/head php-gtk/head
email.body:
Could you please check if you have a glibconfig.h file in your glib-2.0 include directories?
pkg-config --cflags glib-2.0
This should tell you what they are.
-Andrei
On Apr 17, 2005, at 3:13 PM, Ivan Rodriguez wrote:

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] ./buildconf not working with php5/head php-gtk/head
email.body:
Fixed in CVS. :)
--Jani
On Sun, 17 Apr 2005, Andrei Zmievski wrote:
> This is disturbing. We may have to involve Jani here since he knows best about > these sorts of things. I can't imagine why this macro would not be found, > since it is a default autoconf macro. > > Jani, any ideas? I believe Markus checked out php-gtk HEAD and tried to run > ./buildconf in it against the latest PHP 5.1. > > -Andrei > > On Apr 17, 2005, at 12:40 PM, Markus Fischer wrote: > >> Hi, >> >> I tried getting php-gtk head running with php5 head, but it breaks at >> running ./buildconf: >> >> $ ./buildconf >> Configuring for: >> PHP Api Version: 20041225 >> Zend Module Api No: 20041031 >> Zend Extension Api No: 220041031 >> autoconf: Undefined macros: >> configure.in:20: AC_MSG_ERROR(Cannot find php-config. Please use >> --with-php-config=PATH) >> make: *** [buildmk.stamp] Error 1 >> >> I tried the fix written by Andrei >> athttp://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=php-gtk-dev&m=111216704228211&w=2 but it >> didn't work either. >> >> My exakt versions are is 2.13 . >> >> Is there anything else to watch out for? >> >> - Markus >> >> -- >> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) >> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >
-- Donate @ http://pecl.php.net/wishlist.php/sniper

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] ./buildconf not working with php5/head php-gtk/head
email.body:
I have the glibconfig.h file in /usr/lib/glib-2.0 dir, i copy the file to /usr/include/glib-2.0 dir but make command return the same error
In file included from /home/epplestun/php-dev/gtk/php-gtk/ext/gtk+/php_gtk+.c:23: /home/epplestun/php-dev/gtk/php-gtk/main/php_gtk.h: In function `phpg_object_check': /home/epplestun/php-dev/gtk/php-gtk/main/php_gtk.h:279: error: syntax error before "G_LIKELY" /home/epplestun/php-dev/gtk/php-gtk/main/php_gtk.h: At top level: /home/epplestun/php-dev/gtk/php-gtk/main/php_gtk.h:279: error: syntax error before '}' token /home/epplestun/php-dev/gtk/php-gtk/main/php_gtk.h:328: error: syntax error before '*' token /home/epplestun/php-dev/gtk/php-gtk/ext/gtk+/php_gtk+.c: In function `register_stock_constants': /home/epplestun/php-dev/gtk/php-gtk/ext/gtk+/php_gtk+.c:162: warning: assignment makes pointer from integer without a cast make: *** [ext/gtk+/php_gtk+.lo] Error 1

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] ./buildconf not working with php5/head php-gtk/head
email.body:
Hey Jani,
If I modify one of the ext/gtk+/ .m4 files, the ext.m4 is updated but aclocal is not run. So those changes don't end up in the configure.
-Andrei

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] ./buildconf not working with php5/head php-gtk/head
email.body:
Does adding ext.m4 as dependancy in the aclocal.m4 rule help? Should be as simple as that. And you do have cvsclean too? :) I don't think "regular" users pump into this problem that often? :)
--Jani

Please use >>>> --with-php-config=PATH) >>>> make: *** [buildmk.stamp] Error 1 >>>> I tried the fix written by Andrei >>>> athttp://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=php-gtk-dev&m=111216704228211&w=2 but it >>>> didn't work either. >>>> My exakt versions are is 2.13 . >>>> Is there anything else to watch out for? >>>> - Markus >>>> -- >>>> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) >>>> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >>> >> >> -- >> Donate @ http://pecl.php.net/wishlist.php/sniper >> >> -- >> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) >> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] ./buildconf not working with php5/head php-gtk/head
email.body:
Sorry for the long delay, unfortunately, it still doesn't work for me.
I really start to suspect my system is broken but not in a traceable way for me; or on the other it's something obvious I'm missing.
I'm testong debian sarge, currently up2date. I've installed PHP from the PHP_5_0 branch (which is currently named 5.0.5-dev).
autoconf reports 2.13 libtool reports 1.4.3 flex reports 2.5.4 The installed gtk version is 2.6.4, there are no multiple installations left
php-gtk is from current HEAD (cvs updating everytime before I run a new test build)
I've one apache php5 installation on my system which is in non-standard /opt/php5 . I've taking it our of the path and made my own installation in ~/install/php5 and made sure no other php5 files are in the path.
I used the following commands: PHP: ./buildconf && ./configure --prefix=/home/mfischer/install/php5 && make && make install PHP-GTK: ./buildconf && ./configure && make && make install
The relevant last lines are: Build complete. (It is safe to ignore warnings about tempnam and tmpnam).
Installing PHP SAPI module: cgi Installing PHP CGI into: /home/mfischer/install/php5/bin/ Installing PEAR environment: /home/mfischer/install/php5/lib/php/ [PEAR] Archive_Tar - installed: 1.1 [PEAR] Console_Getopt - installed: 1.2 [PEAR] PEAR - installed: 1.3.5 Wrote PEAR system config file at: /home/mfischer/install/php5/etc/pear.conf You may want to add: /home/mfischer/install/php5/lib/php to your php.ini include_path [PEAR] HTML_Template_IT- installed: 1.1 [PEAR] Net_UserAgent_Detect- installed: 2.0.1 [PEAR] XML_RPC - installed: 1.2.2 Installing build environment: /home/mfischer/install/php5/lib/php/build/ Installing header files: /home/mfischer/install/php5/include/php/ Installing helper programs: /home/mfischer/install/php5/bin/ program: phpize program: php-config program: phpextdist Configuring for: PHP Api Version: 20031224 Zend Module Api No: 20041030 Zend Extension Api No: 220040412 rebuilding aclocal.m4 rebuilding configure autoconf: Undefined macros: configure.in:20: AC_MSG_ERROR(Cannot find php-config. Please use --with-php-config=PATH) make[1]: *** [configure] Error 1 make: *** [all] Error 2
I'm happy to test anything out to resolve this problem.
- Markus
Markus Fischer wrote: > Ok great, will test it in a few hours from home. > > - Markus > > Jani Taskinen wrote: > >> >> Fixed in CVS. :) >> >> --Jani >> >> On Sun, 17 Apr 2005, Andrei Zmievski wrote: >> >>> This is disturbing. We may have to involve Jani here since he knows >>> best about these sorts of things. I can't imagine why this macro >>> would not be found, since it is a default autoconf macro. >>> >>> Jani, any ideas? I believe Markus checked out php-gtk HEAD and tried >>> to run ./buildconf in it against the latest PHP 5.1. >>> >>> -Andrei >>> >>> On Apr 17, 2005, at 12:40 PM, Markus Fischer wrote: >>> >>>> Hi, >>>> >>>> I tried getting php-gtk head running with php5 head, but it breaks >>>> at running ./buildconf: >>>> >>>> $ ./buildconf >>>> Configuring for: >>>> PHP Api Version: 20041225 >>>> Zend Module Api No: 20041031 >>>> Zend Extension Api No: 220041031 >>>> autoconf: Undefined macros: >>>> configure.in:20: AC_MSG_ERROR(Cannot find php-config. Please use >>>> --with-php-config=PATH) >>>> make: *** [buildmk.stamp] Error 1 >>>> >>>> I tried the fix written by Andrei >>>> athttp://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=php-gtk-dev&m=111216704228211&w=2 >>>> but it didn't work either. >>>> >>>> My exakt versions are is 2.13 . >>>> >>>> Is there anything else to watch out for? >>>> >>>> - Markus >>>> >>>> -- >>>> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) >>>> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >>> >>> >>> >> >

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] ./buildconf not working with php5/head php-gtk/head
email.body:
First of all, you'll need PHP 5.1.0-dev. Secondly, when you run buildconf, specify the location of phpize you just installed.
./buildconf --with-phpize=/home/mfischer/install/php5/bin/phpize
-Andrei

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] ./buildconf not working with php5/head php-gtk/head
email.body:
It's propably the same fault I had. Remove ALL autotools and libtool and then reinstall them. And if that doesn't help, install the latest versions of autoconf/automake/libtool. Those external macros used have some stuff in them that the old autoconf can't handle -> weird error.
--Jani
On Mon, 25 Apr 2005, Markus Fischer wrote:
> Thanks, I've tested it with 5.1.0-dev now too, still the same Issue. email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] ./buildconf not working with php5/head php-gtk/head
email.body:
Jani Taskinen wrote: > > It's propably the same fault I had. Remove ALL autotools and libtool > and > then reinstall them. And if that doesn't help, install the latest > versions of autoconf/automake/libtool. Those external macros used > have some stuff in them that the old autoconf can't handle -> weird > error.
Do you know which version this "old autoconf" was?
Currently I've installed:
ii autoconf 2.59a-3 automatic configure script builder ii autoconf2.13 2.13-54 automatic configure script builder ii automake1.4 1.4-p6-9 A tool for generating GNU ii libtool1.4 1.4.3-21 Generic library support script
Autoconf 2.59 is a debian dependency, I cannot install 2.13 without 2.59, however calling 'autoconf' always calls 2.13 .
I've already purged and reinstalled them all.
Can you provide the version numbers you're using for successful php-gtk compilatin (or Andrei) ?
thanks, - Markus
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] ./buildconf not working with php5/head php-gtk/head
email.body:
On Mon, 25 Apr 2005, Markus Fischer wrote:
> Jani Taskinen wrote: >> >> It's propably the same fault I had. Remove ALL autotools and libtool and >> then reinstall them. And if that doesn't help, install the latest >> versions of autoconf/automake/libtool. Those external macros used >> have some stuff in them that the old autoconf can't handle -> weird >> error. > > Do you know which version this "old autoconf" was? > > Currently I've installed: > > ii autoconf 2.59a-3 automatic configure script builder > ii autoconf2.13 2.13-54 automatic configure script builder > ii automake1.4 1.4-p6-9 A tool for generating GNU > ii libtool1.4 1.4.3-21 Generic library support script > > Autoconf 2.59 is a debian dependency, I cannot install 2.13 without 2.59, > however calling 'autoconf' always calls 2.13 .
There we go. That sucks since it should call the 'latest'. And only explicitly saying 'autoconf2.13' should call the old.
So blame gentoo (yuck :).
> Can you provide the version numbers you're using for successful php-gtk > compilatin (or Andrei) ?
autoconf 2.13 (the phpize part of the buildconf) autoconf 2.59 (for the rebuild part) automake 1.9.2 (for aclocal part)
It works as fine with not setting PHP_AUTOCONF too..for you it's not gonna help. autoconf should point to the latest..
--Jani
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.body:
Hello
I'm trying to compile PHP-GTK2 with autoconf 2.59 automake 1.9.5 but when I run ./buildconf ...
./buildconf Configuring for: PHP Api Version: 20041225 Zend Module Api No: 20041031 Zend Extension Api No: 220041031 rebuilding aclocal.m4 /usr/local/share/aclocal/winsz.m4:5: warning: underquoted definition of AM_HEADER_TIOCGWINSZ_NEEDS_SYS_IOCTL run info '(automake)Extending aclocal' or see http://sources.redhat.com/automake/automake.html#Extending-aclocal /usr/local/share/aclocal/termios.m4:5: warning: underquoted definition of AM_SYS_POSIX_TERMIOS /usr/local/share/aclocal/strtod.m4:30: warning: underquoted definition of AM_FUNC_STRTOD /usr/local/share/aclocal/sanity.m4:5: warning: underquoted definition of AM_SANITY_CHECK /usr/local/share/aclocal/regex.m4:17: warning: underquoted definition of AM_WITH_REGEX /usr/local/share/aclocal/ptrdiff.m4:5: warning: underquoted definition of AM_TYPE_PTRDIFF_T /usr/local/share/aclocal/protos.m4:8: warning: underquoted definition of AM_C_PROTOTYPES /usr/local/share/aclocal/obstack.m4:4: warning: underquoted definition of AM_FUNC_OBSTACK /usr/local/share/aclocal/multi.m4:4: warning: underquoted definition of AM_ENABLE_MULTILIB /usr/local/share/aclocal/mktime.m4:6: warning: underquoted definition of AM_FUNC_MKTIME /usr/local/share/aclocal/missing.m4:6: warning: underquoted definition of AM_MISSING_PROG /usr/local/share/aclocal/maintainer.m4:6: warning: underquoted definition of AM_MAINTAINER_MODE /usr/local/share/aclocal/lispdir.m4:8: warning: underquoted definition of AM_PATH_LISPDIR /usr/local/share/aclocal/lex.m4:6: warning: underquoted definition of AM_PROG_LEX /usr/local/share/aclocal/init.m4:10: warning: underquoted definition of AM_INIT_AUTOMAKE /usr/local/share/aclocal/header.m4:3: warning: underquoted definition of AM_CONFIG_HEADER /usr/local/share/aclocal/gtkextra.m4:8: warning: underquoted definition of AM_PATH_GTK_EXTRA /usr/local/share/aclocal/error.m4:4: warning: underquoted definition of AM_FUNC_ERROR_AT_LINE /usr/local/share/aclocal/dmalloc.m4:8: warning: underquoted definition of AM_WITH_DMALLOC /usr/local/share/aclocal/cond.m4:3: warning: underquoted definition of AM_CONDITIONAL /usr/local/share/aclocal/ccstdc.m4:23: warning: underquoted definition of AM_PROG_CC_STDC rebuilding configure configure.in:20: error: possibly undefined macro: AC_MSG_ERROR If this token and others are legitimate, please use m4_pattern_allow. See the Autoconf documentation. make[1]: *** [configure] Error 1 make: *** [all] Error 2
What is the meaning of this?¿
What can I do?¿
On 4/25/05, Andrei Zmievski <andrei@gravitonic.com> wrote: > I have autoconf-2.59 and automake 1.8.5. > > -Andrei > > On Apr 25, 2005, at 1:58 AM, Markus Fischer wrote: > > > Jani Taskinen wrote: > >> It's propably the same fault I had. Remove ALL autotools and > >> libtool and > >> then reinstall them. And if that doesn't help, install the latest > >> versions of autoconf/automake/libtool. Those external macros used > >> have some stuff in them that the old autoconf can't handle -> > >> weird error. > > > > Do you know which version this "old autoconf" was? > > > > Currently I've installed: > > > > ii autoconf 2.59a-3 automatic configure script builder > > ii autoconf2.13 2.13-54 automatic configure script builder > > ii automake1.4 1.4-p6-9 A tool for generating GNU > > ii libtool1.4 1.4.3-21 Generic library support script > > > > Autoconf 2.59 is a debian dependency, I cannot install 2.13 without > > 2.59, however calling 'autoconf' always calls 2.13 . > > > > I've already purged and reinstalled them all. > > > > Can you provide the version numbers you're using for successful > > php-gtk compilatin (or Andrei) ? > > > > thanks, > > - Markus > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > >

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] ./buildconf not working with php5/head php-gtk/head
email.body:
This means you have old automake macros installed, propably leftovers from previous version you had. Or those packages which provide them just don't support the very latest version you installed. :)
--Jani
On Mon, 25 Apr 2005, Ivan Rodriguez wrote:

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] ./buildconf not working with php5/head php-gtk/head
email.body:
Maybe you should install an older automake? Getting all those macros to work with the latest and "greatest" automake is impossible.
--Jani

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] ./buildconf not working with php5/head php-gtk/head
email.body:
Hello
I solved the problems of aclocal, automake and autoconf ... but the problem follows there :-(
rebuilding configure configure.in:20: error: possibly undefined macro: AC_MSG_ERROR If this token and others are legitimate, please use m4_pattern_allow. See the Autoconf documentation. make[1]: *** [configure] Error 1 make: *** [all] Error 2
I have autoconf-2.59 and automake-1.8.5, the same versions that Andrei uses, I use PHP-GTK from CVS I update all now ... but the problem follows there :-( what can I do to add this macro to autoconf?¿
On 4/25/05, Ivan Rodriguez <epplestun@gmail.com> wrote: > How can I remove all this macros?¿ If i remove this macros and if I > install the 1.8.5 version? > > On 4/25/05, Jani Taskinen <sniper@iki.fi> email.body:
It's NOT that macro that is failing, it's the other macros you propably don't even have..
--Jani

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: Some missing things
email.body:
Andrei,
>> - more serious: The GtkButton factory methods are not working. > What do you mean? GtkButton::new_from_stock() should work. That's the only one. new_with_label and new_with_mnemonic didn't work yesterday.
>> - When I create a new GtkButton, the mnemonics aren't recognized. When >> doing the same with a GtkCheckButton, they are (see sizegroupdemo, it >> works there) > new GtkButton("_Click me", true)
IMO it should be consistent over classes, and requiring a second parameter for the GtkButton constructor to achieve the same as GtkCheckButton does without is not consistent.
Regards/MfG, Christian Weiske -- XMMS is playing now: 2raumwohnung - Wir Sind Die Anderen (Fruehlin
["signature.asc" (application/pgp-signature)]

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: Some missing things
email.body:
On Apr 27, 2005, at 10:46 PM, Christian Weiske wrote:
> That's the only one. new_with_label and new_with_mnemonic didn't work > yesterday.
That's right, because they are ignored explicitly. We can do things much simpler in PHP, since we have optional arguments.
> >>> - When I create a new GtkButton, the mnemonics aren't recognized. >>> When >>> doing the same with a GtkCheckButton, they are (see sizegroupdemo, it >>> works there) >> new GtkButton("_Click me", true) > > IMO it should be consistent over classes, and requiring a second > parameter for the GtkButton constructor to achieve the same as > GtkCheckButton does without is not consistent.
Then I need to fix GtkCheckButton.
-Andrei
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: Some missing things
Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: Some missing things
email.body:
Andrei,
> I just checked and GtkCheckButton does the same thing as GtkButton. > Are you saying it doesn't work?
Ok, ok, now I see it: I use a set_use_underline after it
Sorry for the senseless mails!
> That's right, because they are ignored explicitly.
Can I get docgen to ignore them as well? How?
Regards/MfG, Christian Weiske -- XMMS is playing now: 2raumwohnung - Wir Sind Die Anderen (Fruehlin

get_defined_constants() returns all registered ones, HTH.
- Markus

email.body:
You can also use Reflection API.
-Andrei

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] demos
email.body:
On Apr 25, 2005, at 10:02 PM, Christian Weiske wrote: > 1. GtkCombo can't be instantiated via new_text factory method: > =============== > $option_menu = GtkComboBox::new_text(); > > PHP Warning: PHP-GTK internal error: could not get typecode from value > in /data/cvs/phpgtk2/php-gtk/demos/sizegroup.php on line 106 > > (sizegroup.php:13382): GLib-GObject-CRITICAL **: g_object_newv: > assertion `G_TYPE_IS_OBJECT (object_type)' failed > ===============
Fixed.
> 2. GtkBox doesn't support set_layout yet.
GtkBox doesn't _have_ set_layout() method at all. What are you trying to do?
> 3. Do we use "Gtk::" or "gtk::" like in php-gtk1? I know for php it > doesn't matter, but we should stay constant in docs.
Maybe standardize on titlecased names? "Gtk" instead of "gtk" since we call toolkit Gtk+?
> 4. Is there a way to get all registered constants?
$r = new ReflectionClass('Gtk'); var_dump($r->getConstants());
-Andrei
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] configure problem now
email.body:
I've attached the config.log now. To me I can't find any indication to why it really failed.
- Markus
Ivan Rodriguez wrote: > Jani GTK+ version is 2.6.4 > > checking for GTK+ - version >= 2.6.0... yes (version 2.6.4) > > ... > > On 4/25/05, Jani Taskinen <sniper@iki.fi> wrote: > >>On Mon, 25 Apr 2005, Markus Fischer wrote: >> >> >>>Jani Taskinen wrote: >>> >>>>On Mon, 25 Apr 2005, Markus Fischer wrote: >>>> >>>>>Can you provide the version numbers you're using for successful php-gtk >>>>>compilatin (or Andrei) ? >>>> >>>> >>>> autoconf 2.13 (the phpize part of the buildconf) >>>> autoconf 2.59 (for the rebuild part) >>>> automake 1.9.2 (for aclocal part) >>>> >>>> It works as fine with not setting PHP_AUTOCONF too..for you it's >>>> not gonna help. autoconf should point to the latest.. >>> >>>Hmm .. so PHP needs two different autoconf version for different parts? How do >> >> PHP doesn't need anything but autoconf 2.13, it doesn't use automake at all. >> >> >>>you switch between those parts? So you set the env variable PHP_AUTOCONF with >>>a full path to the version? >> >> I have PHP_AUTOCONF set to autoconf-2.13 but it would work fine with autoconf 2.59 too. >> It's just faster to use 2.13 with it. (autoconf 2.5x is really SLOW) >> >> >>>Anyway, while writing this mail I purged automake 1.4 and installed 1.9 (I >>>thought that 1.4 was an explicit requirement?) and the ./buildconf step did >>>finish. >>> >>>I'm not stuck with the following: >>> >>>configure: error: PHP-GTK 2.x requires Gtk+ 2.x >> >> Well, check config.log for the real reason? >> (assuming you do have Gtk+ 2.x..) >> >> --Jani >> >>-- >>PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) >>To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >> >> > >

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] configure problem now
email.body:
Markus Fischer wrote: > Jani Taskinen wrote: > >> You propably don't have the required pkg-config file (atk.pc) >> installed..for FC3 it needed atk-devel rpm to be installed. >> And propably some other devel packages as well.. > > > Unfortunately not .. > > $ locate atk.pc > /usr/lib/pkgconfig/atk.pc > > $ pkg-config --modversion atk > 1.8.0 > > But do you think the problem is that atk doesn't get detected properly?
Well ok, the message is clear now:
configure: error: PHP-GTK 2.x requires ATK 1.8.0 or higher
Seems there's something not kosher, as I've 1.8.0 installed. The config.log is still the same and doesn't tell me what is wrong with the atk detection:
configure:6922: checking for ATK_CFLAGS configure:6939: result: configure:6941: checking for ATK_LIBS configure:6958: result: configure:6966: error: PHP-GTK 2.x requires ATK 1.8.0 or higher
thanks, - Markus
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] configure problem now
email.body:
Can you run checks by hand?
pkg-config --cflags atk pkg-config --libs atk
I don't know what else to tell you, except to see how pkg.m4 runs those checks and try to debug them.
-Andrei
On Apr 25, 2005, at 5:31 AM, Markus Fischer wrote:
> Well ok, the message is clear now: > > configure: error: PHP-GTK 2.x requires ATK 1.8.0 or higher > > Seems there's something not kosher, as I've 1.8.0 installed. The > config.log is still the same and doesn't tell me what is wrong with > the atk detection: > > configure:6922: checking for ATK_CFLAGS > configure:6939: result: > configure:6941: checking for ATK_LIBS > configure:6958: result: > configure:6966: error: PHP-GTK 2.x requires ATK 1.8.0 or higher > > thanks, > - Markus
