email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] configure problem now
email.body:
Hi,
i've all the necessary dev files installed, but just discovered the following:
pkg_failed=no echo "$as_me:$LINENO: checking for ATK_CFLAGS" >&5 echo $ECHO_N "checking for ATK_CFLAGS... $ECHO_C" >&6 if test "${pkg_cv_ATK_CFLAGS+set}" = set; then echo $ECHO_N "(cached) $ECHO_C" >&6 else if test "x$ac_cv_env_ATK_CFLAGS_set" = "xset"; then pkg_cv_ATK_CFLAGS=$ac_cv_env_ATK_CFLAGS_value elif test -n "$PKG_CONFIG"; then if $PKG_CONFIG --exists "atk >= atk_required_version" >/dev/null 2> then pkg_cv_ATK_CFLAGS=`$PKG_CONFIG --cflags "atk >= atk_required_version" 2>/dev/null` else pkg_failed=yes fi else pkg_failed=untried fi fi
If you look at the line PKG_CONFIG --exists you will see
$PKG_CONFIG --exists "atk >= atk_required_version"
so this definitely won't work.
After I manually edited the configure files it blow on the Pango check -> same issue. After fixing these, I finally was able to run a compile but it did fail soon. I'll investigate further.
- markus
Andrei Zmievski wrote: > Can you run checks by hand? > > pkg-config --cflags atk > pkg-config --libs atk > > I don't know what else to tell you, except to see how pkg.m4 runs those > checks and try to debug them. > > -Andrei > > On Apr 25, 2005, at 5:31 AM, Markus Fischer wrote: > >> Well ok, the message is clear now: >> >> configure: error: PHP-GTK 2.x requires ATK 1.8.0 or higher >> >> Seems there's something not kosher, as I've 1.8.0 installed. The >> config.log is still the same and doesn't tell me what is wrong with >> the atk detection: >> >> configure:6922: checking for ATK_CFLAGS >> configure:6939: result: >> configure:6941: checking for ATK_LIBS >> configure:6958: result: >> configure:6966: error: PHP-GTK 2.x requires ATK 1.8.0 or higher >> >> thanks, >> - Markus > > >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] configure problem now
email.body:
The problem is that atk_required_version did not get expanded to 1.8.0. pkg-config supports expressions like:
pkg-config --exists "atk >= 1.8.0"
So I would try to investigate why the expansion didn't happen.
-Andrei
On Apr 25, 2005, at 10:43 AM, Markus Fischer wrote:
> If you look at the line PKG_CONFIG --exists you will see > > $PKG_CONFIG --exists "atk >= atk_required_version" > > so this definitely won't work. > > After I manually edited the configure files it blow on the Pango check > -> same issue. After fixing these, I finally was able to run a compile > but it did fail soon. I'll investigate further. >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

No. PHP-GTK does not use re2c.
-Andrei

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-GTK 2 Configure help
email.body:
pkg-config is just a big wrapper. The real work of determining configuration settings is in gtk+-2.0.pc. Try running pkg-config from command line:
# pkg-config --modversion gtk+-2.0
-Andrei
On Apr 22, 2005, at 1:20 PM, Scott Mattocks wrote:
> Andrei Zmievski wrote: > >> Look for gtk+-2.0.pc file on your system. Maybe you have two versions >> of it somewhere. > > I had two version right after I installed but I moved the new (2.6.7) > file to the right directory and replaced the old version. Does this > file also point to where gtk+-2.0 is? The new version should have > installed over top of the old one right? > > Scott
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-GTK 2 Configure help
email.body:
Andrei Zmievski wrote:
> pkg-config is just a big wrapper. The real work of determining > configuration settings is in gtk+-2.0.pc. Try running pkg-config from > command line: > > # pkg-config --modversion gtk+-2.0
Did that. That's how I new it had the wrong pc file. Anything that I install lately is putting pc files in /usr/lib/pkgconfig/ instead of /usr/local/lib/pkgconfig/ where all of the other pc files are. If I run that command now I get 2.6.7. When I run configure it says something like: (not in front of my laptop at the moment sorry)
pkg-config is reproting Gtk+-2.0 version 2.6.7 but Gtk+ version 2.4.0 found. (Then it give some suggestions that I can't exactly remember)
Scott
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-GTK 2 Configure help
email.body:
Okay, so you have some sort of mix up. gtk+-2.0.pc says the version if 2.6.7, but your actual .so files say 2.4.0. Check where you have libgtk-2.0.so (or maybe it's libgtk-x11-2.0.so). Try removing one of them. In the worst case, you might have to deinstall gtk+ package, clean up manually, and install again.
-Andrei
On Apr 22, 2005, at 1:29 PM, Scott Mattocks wrote:
> Andrei Zmievski wrote: > >> pkg-config is just a big wrapper. The real work of determining >> configuration settings is in gtk+-2.0.pc. Anything that I > install lately is putting pc files in /usr/lib/pkgconfig/ instead of > /usr/local/lib/pkgconfig/ where all of the other pc files are. If I > run that command now I get 2.6.7. email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] April News
email.body:
I would say the two biggest pieces of news I know (note the limitation in that statement) about would be the following:
1.) Seems Christian has made some real progress on getting PHP-GTK2 docs started. We could theoretically have docs with substance for PHP-GTK2 in the very near future now that the framework is started.
2.) GTK talks from Andrei and Ben (think those were it, sorry if I missed someone else) in less than a month at the International PHP Conference.
-Jeremy
On Apr 11, 2005 10:15 AM, Scott Mattocks <scott@crisscott.com> wrote: > Hello, > > Please send me any PHP-GTK related news you might have.
-- --------------------------- Jeremy Johnstone http://www.jeremyjohnstone.com jsjohnst@php.net

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] April News
email.body:
I am feeling lazy today so how does this work for an April News item?
A message from Andrei [2005-04-21] I finished porting the first demo from PyGTK, the stock item browser. It's in demos/stock-browser.php and in the process I've implemented a fair amount of new GtkTreeView/GtkListStore functions. PHP-GTK is coming along!
Maybe a very early alpha release is due..
-Andrei
Is that last line something that shouldn't be posted on the homepage?
Thanks, Scott

email.body:

Thanks, Scott
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] April News
email.body:
Hi all of you readers,
> Christian whats the latest on the docgen stuff? I'm currently implementing the signal generation functions in docgen which *are* (I must force myself) done this evening, in 2 or 3 hours. The rest of docgen is working, and if there were some people, they could begin writing the manual.
What not works: - haven't tested docmerger yet; I assume it has to be changed a bit because classes can have multiple constructors now - livedocs don't work yet - "make testclasses" doesn't work yet - no configure script and no makefile. everything is done by some shellscripts (I don't have enough experience with config and makefile creation, so don't expect anything in this direction from me). But you nearly don't need a configure script for now, and one of the shell scripts works like "make"
It would have been more easy to link to this last mail: http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=php-gtk-doc&m=111316563116664&w=2
Regards/MfG, Christian Weiske -- XMMS is playing now: Juli - Warum
["signature.asc" (application/pgp-signature)]

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] #27630 [Opn->Csd]: cannot buildconf or configure
email.body:
ID: 27630 Updated by: sniper@php.net Reported By: samh at hcon dot com dot au -Status: Open +Status: Closed Bug Type: PHP-GTK related Operating System: Linux RH9 PHP Version: 4.3.4 New Comment:
This bug has been fixed in CVS.
Snapshots of the sources are packaged every three hours; this change will be in the next snapshot. You can grab the snapshot at http://snaps.php.net/.
Thank you for the report, and for helping us make PHP better.
Previous Comments: ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[2004-08-26 00:25:27] andrei@php.net
What version of PHP-GTK are you trying to build?
------------------------------------------------------------------------
[2004-08-26 00:17:41] news4 at php-it dot de
Same Problem on SuSE9.1-64Bit. As I'm not an expert in autoconf, I've no clue how to fix it. I really would like to play with php-gtk, but since this bug is open for a while, there is not much hope... Even the latest cvs-Version is not working...
------------------------------------------------------------------------
[2004-03-17 20:31:12] samh at hcon dot com dot au
Description: ------------ I am unable to ./buildconf - with errors reported =
configure.in:22: error: possibly undefined macro: AC_MSG_ERROR If this token and others are legitimate, please use m4_pattern_allow. See the Autoconf documentation. configure.in:65: error: possibly undefined macro: AC_PROG_LIBTOOL configure:3069: error: possibly undefined macro: AM_PATH_GLIB_2_0 configure:3183: error: possibly undefined macro: AM_PATH_GTK_2_0
I am running = RedHat9 gtk+-2.2.4 autoconf-2.59 I have no idea how to correct this issue or use "m4_pattern_allow" as the error suggests.
Expected result: ---------------- I expect buildconf to complete
------------------------------------------------------------------------
-- Edit this bug report at http://bugs.php.net/?id=27630&edit=1
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PHP-GTK 2 Configure help
email.body:
Andrei Zmievski wrote:
> Okay, so you have some sort of mix up. gtk+-2.0.pc says the version if > 2.6.7, but your actual .so files say 2.4.0. Check where you have > libgtk-2.0.so (or maybe it's libgtk-x11-2.0.so). Try removing one of > them. In the worst case, you might have to deinstall gtk+ package, clean > up manually, and install again.
Ok thanks. I will give that a try. I think I might have to reinstall the whole OS by now because of all the uneducated tinkering I have done :)
Thanks again, Scott

> The problem is that atk_required_version did not get expanded to 1.8.0. > pkg-config supports expressions like: > > pkg-config --exists "atk >= 1.8.0" > > So I would try to investigate why the expansion didn't happen. > > -Andrei > > On Apr 25, 2005, at 10:43 AM, Markus Fischer wrote: > >> If you look at the line PKG_CONFIG --exists you will see >> >> $PKG_CONFIG --exists "atk >= atk_required_version" >> >> so this definitely won't work. >> >> After I manually edited the configure files it blow on the Pango check -> >> same issue. After fixing these, I finally was able to run a compile but it >> did fail soon. I'll investigate further. >> >

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] demos (was: Relative paths in generator)
email.body:
Hi Andrei,
> You've been working on demos? Cool. :) Yeah, a bit. The framework has a listview instead of the treeview (as treeview has some instantiation problems), double click doesn't work because php-gtk crashes if it tries to call the callback function (but the demos are included in a tab instead, but can be run standalone as well).
There are buttons (stock items seem not to work OR you have to tell me how to pass the stock id to the factory method (something like "gtk-ok" like in pygtk doesn't work), entrycompletion is ok, expander too, in sizegroups I didn't get the new_text factory method in GtkComboButton to work, so the dropdowns have no entries and the whole thing is useless. That's all.
And I noted that docgen doesn't generate the signatures (parameter lists) for *some* functions. I'll have to dig in the code, but perhaps this will be fixed automatically when more functions and classes are supported.
Regards/MfG, Christian Weiske -- XMMS is playing now: The Cardigans - Explode
["signature.asc" (application/pgp-signature)]

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: demos (was: Relative paths in generator)
email.body:
On Apr 25, 2005, at 4:17 PM, Andrei Zmievski wrote:
>> There are buttons (stock items seem not to work OR you have to tell me >> how to pass the stock id to the factory method (something like >> "gtk-ok" >> like in pygtk doesn't work) > > I found a problem with GtkButton::new_from_stock() which I am fixing > right now.
I fixed this problem. You should be able to create stock buttons now.
$button = GtkButton::new_from_stock(Gtk::STOCK_OK);
-Andrei
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] demos
email.body:
The change was in the generator code, so you need to run "make clean-gen" and then "make".
-Andrei

> Hi Andrei, > >>> 1. GtkCombo can't be instantiated via new_text factory method: >> Fixed. > updated from cvs, did a "make clean" and rebuilt all, but doesn't help. > Still a > PHP-GTK internal error: could not get typecode from value in > /data/cvs/phpgtk2/php-gtk/demos/sizegroup.php on line 106 > > Regards/MfG, > Christian Weiske > -- > XMMS is playing now: > The Cardigans - Explode
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Some missing things
email.body:
You need to load the overrides file and check. See how generator does it. But it won't tell you the parameters for overriden functions, since those are done in C. You need to check the actual implementation or ask me. GtkDialog constructor is somewhat complicated..
You can check http://pygtk.org/pygtk2reference/class-gtkdialog.html#constructor- gtkdialog since that's basically what I did.
-Andrei
On Apr 27, 2005, at 5:53 AM, Christian Weiske wrote:
> Again me, > > > If found the problem to the missing constructor docs: > > Have a look at gtk.defs#4943 > ================= > (define-function gtk_dialog_new > (is-constructor-of "GtkDialog") > (c-name "gtk_dialog_new") > (caller-owns-return #t) > (return-type "GtkWidget*") > ) > > (define-function gtk_dialog_new_with_buttons > (is-constructor-of "GtkDialog") > (c-name "gtk_dialog_new_with_buttons") > (caller-owns-return #t) > (return-type "GtkWidget*") > (parameters > '("const-gchar*" "title" (default "NULL") (null-ok)) > '("GtkWindow*" "parent" (default "NULL") (null-ok)) > '("GtkDialogFlags" "flags") > '("const-gchar*" "first_button_text" (default "NULL") (null-ok)) > ) > (varargs #t) > ) > ================== > > docgen uses the first one as constructor, so there are no parameters > generated. > > Now php-gtk seems to take the second one as constructor, and has > parameters. > > How can I distinguish between "normal" constructors and such overridden > ones? > > > Regards/MfG, > Christian Weiske > -- > XMMS is playing now: > Silbermond - Letzte Bahn
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

Pablo,
Couldn't email you directly because the msg bounced.
This is fixed now.
-Andrei

> MenuItem constructor is different from PyGtk docs: > > $Menu = new GtkMenuItem('Utilitarios'); > Warning: GtkMenuItem::__construct() requires exactly 0 arguments, 1 > given in /home/pablo/doc/book/php-gtk2/exemplos/samples/old/menu.php on > line 10
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: Some missing things
email.body:
On Apr 27, 2005, at 11:00 PM, Christian Weiske wrote:
> Andrei, > > >> I just checked and GtkCheckButton does the same thing as GtkButton. >> Are you saying it doesn't work? > > Ok, ok, now I see it: I use a set_use_underline after it > > Sorry for the senseless mails! >
You don't really need to use set_use_underline(). This should work:
$button = new GtkCheckButton("_Click", true);
> >> That's right, because they are ignored explicitly. > > Can I get docgen to ignore them as well? How? >
Did you see my email about overrides? You need to load override files and call is_ignored() method.
-Andrei
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

autoconf?¿ > > > > On 4/25/05, Ivan Rodriguez <epplestun@gmail.com> wrote: > >> How can I remove all this macros?¿ If i remove this macros and if I > >> install the 1.8.5 version? > >> > >> On impossible. > >>> > >>> --Jani > >>> > >>> On Mon, 25 Apr 2005, Ivan Rodriguez wrote: > >>> > >>>> Hi Jani > >>>> > >>>> How I can change the old macros to the new macros?¿ > >>>> > >>>> On 4/25/05, Jani Taskinen <sniper@iki.fi> wrote: > >>>>> > >>>>> This means you have old automake macros installed, > >>>>> propably leftovers from previous version you had. > >>>>> Or those packages which provide them just don't support the > >>>>> very latest version you installed. :) > >>>>> > >>>>> --Jani > >>>>> > >>>>> > >>>>> On Mon, 25 Apr 2005, Ivan Rodriguez wrote: > >>>>> > >>>>>> Hello > Then run: /usr/local/bin/php /home/epplestun/php-gtk-dev/php-gtk/generator/generator.php \ -r atk-types.defs \ -r pango-types.defs \ -r gdk-types.defs \ -r gtk-types.defs \ -o atk.overrides \ -p atk \ -f gen_atk.c atk.defs 2>&1 | tee gen_atk.log - Andrei -- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Where to put certain functions/constants
email.body:
I started implementing main loop related functions, when I realized that the old gtk_timeout_add() and gtk_idle_add() functions have been deprecated actually. The new ones are provided by GLib library itself, but we do not have .defs files for GLib, of course. So, the question is where these functions should be located: in Gtk:: namespace or in a new one, possibly Glib::, G::, or PHPG::. So far I have decided to dump everything into Gtk:: namespace, mostly for BC reasons, but I wanted to know if anyone has other suggestions. PyGtk has these functions under GObject:: namespace, but I think that's just arbitrary decision, since GObject itself has nothing to do with main loops.
-Andrei
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

Hi all, Just compiled CVS on Fedora3 and got a big smile on my dial :) , `thanks` does not quite say it but you know what I mean~
To documentation , I know this has been discussed before but a long time ago I think. Are we (and by 'we' I mean I intend to contibute something more useful than to date) going to simply add any new functions and depracate the old in the existing manual or are we going to start from scratch for V2 ?
If from scratch are we going to stick with the existing interesting but cryptic build system or perhaps get radical and use PHP itself ?
Regards, Simon.

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Need new name for connect_object()
email.body:
It swaps the signal object and user data parameters when invoking a callback. But it makes sense only in C, since the callback signature is predetermined.
-Andrei
On Mar 20, 2005, at 8:43 AM, Steph wrote:
> connect_vanilla() > connect_simple() > connect_pure() > > What exactly does connect_swapped() do?
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Need new name for connect_object()
email.body:
Andrei Zmievski wrote: > it and make a new method. So far I came up with connect_direct() and > connect_without(). Any others?
Since it only passes user defined parameters connect_user_only()
Since it doesn't pass the signal connect_no_signal()
Since it doesn't pass any system defined parameters connect_no_system()
Scott
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Need new name for connect_object()
email.body:
Actually, it does pass the rest of signal arguments. So, if normally it passes, for example:
function ($widget, $row, $col) { }
Then connect_object() would invoke it with only $row and $col. Don't know if it makes sense..
On Mon, 21 Mar 2005, Scott Mattocks wrote: > Andrei Zmievski wrote: > >it and make a new method. So far I came up with connect_direct() and > >connect_without(). Any others? > > Since it only passes user defined parameters > connect_user_only() > > Since it doesn't pass the signal > connect_no_signal() > > Since it doesn't pass any system defined parameters > connect_no_system() > > Scott
- Andrei
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Need new name for connect_object()
email.body:
I'm probably being too simplistic here, but what about
connect_other()
since it does the same things as connect, including parms, but it does it for another object.
Madeleine D.
At 09:40 AM 3/21/05 -0800, you wrote: >Actually, it does pass the rest of signal arguments. So, if normally it >passes, for example: > >function ($widget, $row, $col) >{ >} > >Then connect_object() would invoke it with only $row and $col. Don't >know if it makes sense.. > >On Mon, 21 Mar 2005, Scott Mattocks wrote: >> Andrei Zmievski wrote: >> >it and make a new method. So far I came up with connect_direct() and >> >connect_without(). Any others? >> >> Since it only passes user defined parameters >> connect_user_only() >> >> Since it doesn't pass the signal >> connect_no_signal() >> >> Since it doesn't pass any system defined parameters >> connect_no_system() >> >> Scott > > > >- Andrei > >-- >PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) >To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > >

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Need new name for connect_object()
email.body:
Not really. What it does currently is "omit" the signal object, passes the rest of parameters, adding on the user specified-ones at the end. So, if originally the parameters to be passed were ($signal_widget, $col, $row), and we connect it as:
$w->connect_object('foo', 'myfoo', $myobj);
the parameters it'll pass are ($col, $row, $myobj).
I guess what I am asking is whether this behavior is useful at all, or if we would rather really substitute the user specified object instead of the signal one, or not pass any signal parameters at all, or what. Or maybe have a connection function for all three cases:
1) connect normally: pass signal widget plus additional signal-specific parameters 2) connect replace: substitute user-specified object instead of the signal one, and pass additional signal-specific parameters 3) connect simple: pass only user specified parameters
-Andrei
On Mar 21, 2005, at 11:29 AM, Madeleine D. wrote:
> I'm probably being too simplistic here, but what about > > connect_other() > > since it does the same things as connect, including parms, but it does > it > for another object. > > Madeleine D. >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Need new name for connect_object()
email.body:
I'm failing to see the difference between 2) and 3) here... am I being dim?
And yes, it's very definitely useful behaviour :)

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Need new name for connect_object()
email.body:
I just realized that Gtk+ 2 does not have a function called connect_object() - it has something called connect_swapped(). I think connect_object() name is really misleading; if anything, it does not pass the signal object, contrary to the name. So, I'd like to deprecate it and make a new method. So far I came up with connect_direct() and connect_without(). Any others?
-Andrei
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Need new name for connect_object()
email.body:
function my_callback() { var_dump(func_get_args()); }
Suppose the signal parameters are (signal_widget, row, col).
2) $o->connect_replace('signal', 'my_callback', $myobj, $arg1, arg2); The output of var_dump() here would be: $myobj, $row, $col, $arg1, $arg2.
3) $o->connect_simple('signal', 'my_callback', $myobj, $arg1, $arg2); The output here would be: $myobj, $arg1, $arg2.
-Andrei
On Mar 21, 2005, at 1:13 PM, Steph wrote:
> I'm failing to see the difference between 2) and 3) here... am I > being dim? > > And yes, it's very definitely useful behaviour :) >> >> 1) connect normally: pass signal widget plus additional >> signal-specific >> parameters >> 2) connect replace: substitute user-specified object instead of the >> signal one, and pass additional signal-specific parameters >> 3) connect simple: pass only user specified parameters >> >> -Andrei

So, I guess my vote would be for 3 different ones - for clarity's sake.
Madeleine D.

http://www.crisscott.com/download.php?file=15
Scott
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.body:
Hmm, that means setting up a new CVS module, new ACLs, etc. Can't we simply branch and leave old stuff on the branch and use HEAD for new stuff?
-Andrei
>> IMO we should keep the current file format, just all utf8 and a >> complete >> new php-gtk2-doc directory.

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Need new name for connect_object()
email.body:
Hi Scott and Andrei,
>>> IMO we should keep the current file format, just all utf8 and a complete >>> new php-gtk2-doc directory.
> Hmm, that means setting up a new CVS module, new ACLs, etc. Can't we > simply branch and leave old stuff on the branch and use HEAD for new stuff?
I personally don't like (read: nearly hate) the concept of branches for complete new developments. It makes you have problems checking out into the same base directory and in viewcvs I can't determine at first view what is what.
Regards/MfG, Christian Weiske -- XMMS is playing now: Reamonn - Promised Land

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: segfault on close
email.body:
Having same issues. Edit the files and find where you have things like:
# include <tsrm_config.h>
Change them to:
# include "tsrm_config.h"
I only had to fix includes in like 3 places, so just keep fixing them until they all go away (one of them was in main/php.h on line 400 and you needed to change it to ../TSRM/tsrm_virtual_cwd.h instead of just tsrm_virtual_cwd.h)
Hope this helps!
-Jeremy
On Wed, 16 Mar 2005 15:34:12 -0500, Scott Mattocks <scott@crisscott.com> wrote: > Andrei Zmievski wrote: > > > What are the problems you are having? libxml related or something else? > > Damn your good! If I disable > libxml it does the same things at zlib. > > Any ideas? > > Thanks, > Scott > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > >
-- --------------------------- Jeremy Johnstone http://www.jeremyjohnstone.com jsjohnst@php.net

OK , me just moaning as I just am not a great fan of XSLT etc so please ignore.
I take it that we will just continue to update/work-with the existing manual then ?

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Is PHP-GTK 2 funcional?
email.body:
Hello
I'm testing PHP-GTK2, I'm trying to work with some new widgets like GtkTreView, GtkTreeViewColum, GtkCellRendererText, ... and I want to add a GtkListStore into the TreeView but I can't create a ListStore, if I do new GtkListStore PHP says :
Fatal error: Class GtkListStore cannot be instantiated directly
And my question is, how can I add a ListStore into TreeView, is posible? ¿ or not yet that can be done.
Regards
-- Ivan Rodriguez <epplestun@gmail.com>
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

I checked out and compiled the latest version from CVS and then tried to run some of the examples in the test directory. After updating the module name I ran the file selection test. Not everything worked but I didn't expect it to. But when I clicked the X to close the app I got a seg fault. This happened every time no matter what I did while the app was open. It may be expected at this stage of development but I wanted to point it out anyway.
Thanks, Scott

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Is PHP-GTK 2 funcional?
email.body:
Andrei Zmievski wrote:
> This should be fixed in CVS now.
I tried again last night and got the same result. If you want another backtrace let me know.
I'd like to help out by cleaning up the tests to get rid of the deprecated classes and methods. I know that I can't get everything done now but I can at least get started. Is that ok? If so is there any special way you want me to go about it?
Also, (if I am getting too far ahead let me know) is there anyway to determine what exceptions a widget throws? I didn't see anything in the relection API. It would really help for writing the docs to be able to automatically generate a list of exceptions thrown.
Scott
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Is PHP-GTK 2 funcional?
email.body:
On Fri, 11 Mar 2005, Scott Mattocks wrote: > >This should be fixed in CVS now. > > I tried again last night and got the same result. If you want another > backtrace let me know.
Yes, please. Forgive me for asking, but you are sure you updated from CVS, compiled and installed the module in the appropriate directory?
> I'd like to help out by cleaning up the tests to get rid of the > deprecated classes and methods. I know that I can't get everything done > now but I can at least get started. Is that ok? If so is there any > special way you want me to go about it?
Yes, that would help a lot. You can either modify existing tests or look at demos that come with Gtk+ and PyGTK and port those.
> Also, (if I am getting too far ahead let me know) is there anyway to > determine what exceptions a widget throws? I didn't see anything in the > relection API. It would really help for writing the docs to be able to > automatically generate a list of exceptions thrown.
So far there are only a couple of exceptions. PhpGtkConstructException is thrown when a widget cannot be constructed due to bad parameters or otherwise. And PhpGtkGErrorException is generated by functions that return GError internally, like GdkPixbuf::new_from_file().
- Andrei
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

I thought I didn't update properly too but I am pretty sure that I did. The php-gtk2.so file has a new created date.
> So far there are only a couple of exceptions. PhpGtkConstructException > is thrown when a widget cannot be constructed due to bad parameters or > otherwise. And PhpGtkGErrorException is generated by functions that > return GError internally, like GdkPixbuf::new_from_file().
Are the thrown exceptions in a convenient place in the source or do they get automatically built from the c code during the build process?
Thanks, Scott

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Is PHP-GTK 2 funcional?
email.body:
On Fri, 11 Mar 2005, Scott Mattocks wrote: > Understandable question. I completely removed the source and then > redownloaded it and went through the entire build process. I even check > the source against the CVS commit's diff output. I thought I didn't > update properly too but I am pretty sure that I did. The php-gtk2.so > file has a new created date.
And the script you were testing is fileselection one?
> Are the thrown exceptions in a convenient place in the source or do they > get automatically built from the c code during the build process?
Not sure what you mean. Decision on whether to throw an exception and if so which one is done in the C code. Some of is generated (like constructors) and some is in the supporting code.
- Andrei
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Is PHP-GTK 2 funcional?
email.body:
Andrei Zmievski wrote:
> On Fri, 11 Mar 2005, Scott Mattocks wrote: > And the script you were testing is fileselection one?
Yes.
> Not sure what you mean. Decision on whether to throw an exception and if > so which one is done in the C code. Some of is generated (like > constructors) and some is in the supporting code.
From my understanding, C doesn't have exceptions. So where do they come from? The docs won't really be complete unless we can say something like, "GtkBin::add() throws a GtkContainerFull exception if it already has a child when you try to add another widget." I don't know how to tell what exceptions a given method might throw. The only method I have found so far is to purposely do something I know is wrong.
Scott
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Is PHP-GTK 2 funcional?
email.body:
Gtk+ does not throw any exceptions by default. PHP-GTK decides to throw certain exceptions in certain cases - like PhpGtkConstructException if construction fails. Each one has to be done on a case by case basis, except for the functions that return errors using GError type - those are generated automatically and will always throw PhpGtkGErrorException.
-Andrei
On Mar 11, 2005, at 12:38 PM, Scott Mattocks wrote:
> From my understanding, C doesn't have exceptions. So where do they > come from? The docs won't really be complete unless we can say > something like, "GtkBin::add() throws a GtkContainerFull exception if > it already has a child when you try to add another widget." I don't > know how to tell what exceptions a given method might throw. The only > method I have found so far is to purposely do something I know is > wrong.
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Latest CVS commit
email.body:
I know why it's happening. And it's not something that's fixed easily, if at all.
Basically, the problem is that the extension is loaded via dl() instead of through .ini mechanism. I talked to Andi Gutmans from Zend and their position is that dl() should be deprecated completely because it has many inherent problems with shutdown mechanism and so on. This discussion has come up multiple times on PHP internals mailing list, but with no result.
So, the short answer is - don't use dl(). Whether we can prevent people from doing so - I'm not sure.
-Andrei

Done now, and please >> re-run buildconf to pick it up. > > Compiling worked with out a problem but I am still getting the seg > fault when I close the fileselection test. I don't get this error when > I run the gtk or hello, but that may be because I get another error > about loading shared libraries. I will save that for another email > though. > > gdb output is attached. > > Could this be some problem related to my computer? email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Where to put certain functions/constants
email.body:
Hi Andrei,
> Hmm, I guess that's possible. Could you look through > http://developer.gnome.org/doc/API/2.0/glib/index.html and see whether > there is anything there that has the potential for being part of GLib:: > namespace? If it's only a couple of functions, then I'd rather not bother.
- I don't know if support for threads is planned, if yes this would be a great enhancement, if not, this doesn't count. - Gettext is already covered by php. (even php5? don't know) - The "automatic string completion" seems interesting
As I looked though the list, it seems to me that almost everything can be/is already covered by php itself, so it's unlikely that more functions will come. You've won :)
Regards/MfG, Christian Weiske -- XMMS is playing now: Reamonn - If I go

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: segfault on close
email.body:
Rasmus Lerdorf wrote:
> Or update to HEAD. I fixed this a while ago.
An update from HEAD as of 10:00ish this morning only solved the tsrm_virtual_cwd.h problem. The others I still had to do manually. It still didn't work though. There were SPL issues (which I got rid of with --disable-spl) and a whole mess of error messages from ext/standardvar.c
After reading all the way to the bottom of the php CVS page, I realized that the problem may be on my system. It says libtool 1.5 won't work and I have 1.5.6.
Anyway, thank you Jeremy and Rasmus for your help.
Scott
> > Jeremy Johnstone wrote: > >> Having same issues. Edit the files and find where you have things like: >> >> # include <tsrm_config.h> >> >> Change them to: >> >> # include "tsrm_config.h" >> >> I only had to fix includes in like 3 places, so just keep fixing them >> until they all go away (one of them was in main/php.h on line 400 and >> you needed to change it to ../TSRM/tsrm_virtual_cwd.h instead of just >> tsrm_virtual_cwd.h) >> >> Hope this helps! >> >> -Jeremy >> >> >> On Wed, 16 Mar 2005 15:34:12 -0500, Scott Mattocks >> <scott@crisscott.com> wrote: >> >>> Andrei Zmievski wrote: >>> >>> >>>> What are the problems you are having? libxml related or something else? >>> >>> >>> Damn your good! email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Interfaces, shminterfaces..
Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Need new name for connect_object()
email.body:
On Thu, 24 Mar 2005, Christian Weiske wrote: > I personally don't like (read: nearly hate) the concept of branches for > complete new developments.
The branch would be for old stuff. New development will be on HEAD.
> It makes you have problems checking out into the same base directory > and in viewcvs I can't determine at first view what is what.
Problems checking out into the same base directory? You'll have to set up different directories for both branches on your local machine, just like you would have to do if we added another CVS module. And Chora (cvs.php.net) actually does a decent job of showing you branches:
http://cvs.php.net/history.php/php-gtk/php_gtk.m4
If it makes you happy I can setup an alias in CVS: "php-gtk1-doc" that will checkout the branch automatically. That's how we do it with main /php-src module.
- Andrei

email.body:
ID: 29220 Updated by: sniper@php.net Reported By: MasterEuclid at hotmail dot com -Status: Open +Status: Closed Bug Type: PHP-GTK related Operating System: linux PHP Version: Irrelevant New Comment:
This bug has been fixed in CVS.
Snapshots of the sources are packaged every three hours; this change will be in the next snapshot. You can grab the snapshot at http://snaps.php.net/.
Thank you for the report, and for helping us make PHP better.
Previous Comments: ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[2004-07-17 08:46:23] MasterEuclid at hotmail dot com
Description: ------------ I have tried moving files around, starting over, getting the lastest automake and auto-conf I have tried ./buildconf aclocal and phpize in many different orders, I have used both php_gtk_new.m4 and php_gtk_old.m4 as php_gtk.m4 both produce the same result I have installed GTK 1.6 and 1.9, I can not get ./buildconf to work

Actual result: -------------- root@eucnet:/home/euclid/php-gtk-1.0.0# ./buildconf Configuring for: PHP Api Version: 20031224 Zend Module Api No: 20040412 Zend Extension Api No: 220040412 configure.in:9: warning: underquoted definition of PHP_WITH_PHP_CONFIG run info '(automake)Extending aclocal' or see http://sources.redhat.com/automake/automake.html#Extending%20aclocal configure.in:32: warning: underquoted definition of PHP_EXT_BUILDDIR configure.in:33: warning: underquoted definition of PHP_EXT_DIR configure.in:34: warning: underquoted definition of PHP_EXT_SRCDIR configure.in:35: warning: underquoted definition of PHP_ALWAYS_SHARED php_gtk.m4:10: warning: underquoted definition of PHP_GTK_EXTENSION php_gtk.m4:44: warning: underquoted definition of PHP_GTK_ARG_ANALYZE php_gtk.m4:75: warning: underquoted definition of PHP_GTK_ARG_ENABLE php_gtk.m4:79: warning: underquoted definition of PHP_GTK_REAL_ARG_ENABLE php_gtk.m4:91: warning: underquoted definition of PHP_GTK_ARG_WITH php_gtk.m4:95: warning: underquoted definition of PHP_GTK_REAL_ARG_WITH acinclude.m4:19: warning: underquoted definition of PHP_PROG_RE2C acinclude.m4:1903: warning: underquoted definition of PHP_TEST_BUILD /usr/local/share/aclocal/gtk.m4:7: warning: underquoted definition of AM_PATH_GTK configure.in:65: error: possibly undefined macro: AC_PROG_LIBTOOL If this token and others are legitimate, please use m4_pattern_allow. email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] #26679 [Opn->Fbk]: php error messages in c files
email.body:
ID: 26679 Updated by: sniper@php.net Reported By: vpupkin at comcast dot net -Status: Open +Status: Feedback Bug Type: PHP-GTK related Operating System: Linux PHP Version: Irrelevant New Comment: Does this happen still..? Previous Comments: ------------------------------------------------------------------------ [2004-08-13 09:39:37] gbp at reddleman dot org I have the same problem and it looks like it might be a bug in Pear's Getopt. The problem is with calling PHP in this fashion php -f file.php -- -o opt_value argument The '--' is not interpreted as the end of PHP arguments, but rather as the first script argument. The solution is, after configure, to replace all occurences with a line in this style: php -q file.php -o opt_value argument i.e., replace -f with -q and remove the -- After that, run make clean find -name "gen_*" -exec rm {} \; make That did it for me. ------------------------------------------------------------------------ [2003-12-19 23:45:24] vpupkin at comcast dot net Description: ------------ to reproduce (php-gtk-1.0.0) $./buildconf $./configure ... ./configure: line 3665: syntax error near unexpected token `debug,' ./configure: line 3665: `PHP_GTK_ARG_ENABLE(debug, whether to include debugging symbols,' $aclocal $./buildconf $./configure $make files: /ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.c contains (it's inside the file): br /> Warning: fopen(--): failed to open stream: No such file or directory in /dev/php-gtk/generator/scheme.php on line 110

Warning: fgets(): supplied argument is not a valid stream resource in /dev/php-gtk/generator/scheme.php on line 34
/ext/gtk+/get_gdk.c contains:
Warning: filemtime(): Stat failed for -- (errno=2 - No such file or directory) in /dev/php-gtk/generator/scheme.php on line 101
you can remove those line from the files and do "make" (it will go a bit farther) again, but then you receive the folliwing: /dev/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_object.c: In function `php_gtk_arg_from_value': /dev/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_object.c:615: error: `gtk_object_ce' undeclared (first use in this function) /dev/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_object.c:615: error: (Each undeclared identifier is reported only once /dev/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_object.c:615: error: for each function it appears in.) /dev/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_object.c: In function `php_gtk_ret_from_value': /dev/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_object.c:892: error: `gtk_object_ce' undeclared (first use in this function) make: *** [main/php_gtk_object.lo] Error 1 Hope it helps. Thanks Alexander Kabanov ------------------------------------------------------------------------ -- Edit this bug report at http://bugs.php.net/?id=26679&edit=1 -- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] #31362 [Opn->Bgs]: GtkFileSelection->complete more complete
email.body:
ID: 31362 Updated by: sniper@php.net Reported By: ceo at l-i-e dot com -Status: Open +Status: Bogus Bug Type: PHP-GTK related PHP Version: Irrelevant New Comment:
.
Previous Comments: ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[2005-01-01 23:44:03] jed@php.net
gtk_file_selection_complete() doesn't offer this in GTK. PHP-GTK is simply a wrap over GTK itself.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
[2004-12-31 05:58:34] ceo at l-i-e dot com
Description: ------------ It would be Really Nifty (tm) if GtkFileSelection->complete took an optional second argument which would make the pattern matching 'pervasive'
IE, the dialog would continue to only present filenames that matched the given expression.
Providing the same functionality through some other mechanism would be fine, of course.
I suppose one could, in theory, dig down into the guts of the Widget, and find all the widgets inside that can affect the selection, and then connect() a function to each one that would call complete() repeatedly...
But it would be Really Hard for your mere mortal programmer to find *ALL* the possible circumstances that could change the selection....
------------------------------------------------------------------------
-- Edit this bug report at http://bugs.php.net/?id=31362&edit=1
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Compiling PHP-GTK2
email.body:
Scott,
This should be fixed in latest CVS. To answer your question, no, there is no CVS tag to check for latest compilable files. I usually try to keep the tree compilable, but I missed this particular problem.
-Andrei On Feb 1, 2005, at 8:34 AM, Scott Mattocks wrote:
> Hello, > > Here is what I got when trying to compile last night (2005-01-31) with > the latest CVS files: > > make: *** [ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.lo] Error 1 > ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.c: In function `phpg_GtkTextAttributes_read_bg_color': > ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.c:27510: error: structure has no member named > `bg_color' > ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.c: In function `phpg_GtkTextAttributes_read_fg_color': > ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.c:27521: error: structure has no member named > `fg_color' > make: *** [ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.lo] Error 1 > > I would assume that the CVS files are not always supposed to compile > since it is still a work in progress. Is there any CVS tag that I can > use for the last know compileable files? > > Thanks, > Scott > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: #29220 [NEW]: buildconf is broken
email.body:
Phpdiscuss - Php Newsgroups And Mailing Lists wrote:
I am also seeing the same errors trying to build pdflib under php-5.0.3 on a solaris9 box that should also be current with automake, autoconf, libtool and m4. Has anyone found a resolution for this?
> Mastereuclid At Hotmail Dot Com wrote:
> > From: MasterEuclid at hotmail dot com > > Operating system: linux > > PHP version: Irrelevant > > PHP Bug Type: PHP-GTK related > > Bug description: buildconf is broken
> I am having a similar problem with trying to install pdflib.
> I am on a Solaris9 box using what should be current > builds of autoconf, automake, libtool and m4. I was > able to get past the stage you are at by installing libtool, but > then I got stuck by the macro expansion of AC_PROG_LIBTOOL. > Getting this error:
> configure.in:32: warning: underquoted definition of PHP_EXT_BUILDDIR > configure.in:33: warning: underquoted definition of PHP_EXT_DIR > configure.in:34: warning: underquoted definition of PHP_EXT_SRCDIR > configure.in:35: warning: underquoted definition of PHP_ALWAYS_SHARED > acinclude.m4:19: warning: underquoted definition of PHP_PROG_RE2C > configure.in:65: /usr/local/bin/m4: ERROR: Reading inserted file: No such > file or > directory > autom4te: /usr/local/bin/m4 failed with exit status: 1 > aclocal: autom4te failed with exit status: 1
> Unfortunately, I am not familiar with autoconf/m4 and am completely stuck > on this as well. I wish it would tell me what file it thinks its trying > to read. That would give me someplace to start. I have been playing > around getting debugging and verbose output going, but still nothing > obvious telling me where the problem is. I expect that I will have to get > much more familiar with m4 to figure out whats going on.
> > Description: > > ------------ > > I have tried moving files around, starting over, getting > > the lastest automake and auto-conf I have > > tried ./buildconf aclocal and phpize in many different > > orders, I have used both php_gtk_new.m4 and php_gtk_old.m4 > > as php_gtk.m4 both produce the same result I have > > installed GTK 1.6 and 1.9, I can not get ./buildconf to > > work
> > Expected result: > > ---------------- > > ../buildconf makes the configure files, I am very happy
> > Actual result: > > -------------- > > root@eucnet:/home/euclid/php-gtk-1.0.0# ./buildconf > > Configuring for: > > PHP Api Version: 20031224 > > Zend Module Api No: 20040412 > > Zend Extension Api No: 220040412 > > configure.in:9: warning: underquoted definition of > > PHP_WITH_PHP_CONFIG > > run info '(automake)Extending aclocal' > > or see > > http://sources.redhat.com/automake/automake.html#Extending%20aclocal > > configure.in:32: warning: underquoted definition of > > PHP_EXT_BUILDDIR > > configure.in:33: warning: underquoted definition of > > PHP_EXT_DIR > > configure.in:34: warning: underquoted definition of > > PHP_EXT_SRCDIR > > configure.in:35: warning: underquoted definition of > > PHP_ALWAYS_SHARED > > php_gtk.m4:10: warning: underquoted definition of > > PHP_GTK_EXTENSION > > php_gtk.m4:44: warning: underquoted definition of > > PHP_GTK_ARG_ANALYZE > > php_gtk.m4:75: warning: underquoted definition of > > PHP_GTK_ARG_ENABLE > > php_gtk.m4:79: warning: underquoted definition of > > PHP_GTK_REAL_ARG_ENABLE > > php_gtk.m4:91: warning: underquoted definition of > > PHP_GTK_ARG_WITH > > php_gtk.m4:95: warning: underquoted definition of > > PHP_GTK_REAL_ARG_WITH > > acinclude.m4:19: warning: underquoted definition of > > PHP_PROG_RE2C > > acinclude.m4:1903: warning: underquoted definition of > > PHP_TEST_BUILD > > /usr/local/share/aclocal/gtk.m4:7: warning: underquoted > > definition of AM_PATH_GTK > > configure.in:65: error: possibly undefined macro: > > AC_PROG_LIBTOOL > > If this token and others are legitimate, please use > > m4_pattern_allow. > > See the Autoconf documentation. > > make: *** [buildmk.stamp] Error 1

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Property access
email.body:
Andrei Zmievski wrote:
> var_dump() on $win worked fine for me when I tested. Can you please get > rid of all the *.cache and gen_* files and recompile it again? If it > persists, I'll take a look.
I'll try that tonight and see what happens. I think it may have to do with the fact that I called show_all before trying to print the object. In you example, $win shouldn't have had a GdkWindow object when you called var_dump() because it isn't created until you realize the object, right?
Anyways, I'll try recompiling and then run some more test. I'll let you know what I find.
Scott
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] February News
email.body:
Christian Weiske wrote: > First they rejected us to be in Amsterdam, then they blackhole all > php-gtk news.... what's next?
I left out the S&S conspiracy for fear of retribution. Plus I found a late entry about bcompiler. Here is what I have for a (small) February news item.
(I can't come up with a good headline) February Update
It's getting close to conference season and with that comes a few talks about PHP-GTK. At the International PHP Conference, Ben Ramsey will be holding a talk titled "PHP in a Whole New World: Desktop Applications Built in PHP-GTK." At the same conference Andrei Zmievski will be giving a much anticipated talk called, "Say hello to PHP-GTK 2." The latest issue of the International PHP Magazine has an article by David Heath called "Free You CMS" which talks about "building an offline desktop client tool that is a synthesis of several exciting technologies: PHP-GTK, SQLite, and XML-RPC."
PECL developers, Alan Knowles and Val Khokhlov have release a new version of bcompiler. bcompiler lets you "create a exe file of a PHP-GTK application."
Thanks, Scott
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Testing PHP-GTK 2
email.body:
Hi,
I'd like to ask those of you on this list to start testing PHP-GTK 2, especially in the areas of signal connection and handling and subclassing default objects. Please check out the latest CVS tree and compile from that, making sure that your development environment setup reflects the latest PHP 5 as well; meaning that headers, libraries, and phpize, php-config, etc are all from the latest PHP install.
Thank you,
-Andrei

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Property access
email.body:
On Fri, 04 Feb 2005, Scott Mattocks wrote: > Andrei Zmievski wrote: > >But wait, there's more! > > > >$w = new GtkWindow(); > >$w->mine = 'i am art vandelay'; > >var_dump($w); > > I got PHP-GTK2 to compile with no problems yesterday and simple things > like making a window with a label in it worked perfectly. When I tried > to run some code like the lines above I ran into a problem though. I tried: > > $win = new GtkWindow(); > $win->test = 'TEST'; > $win->show_all(); // Causes the window to be realized > print_r($win); > > gtk::main(); > > When I ran that I got a fatal error message about instantiating an > abstract class GdkWindow. Is that an expected result?
var_dump() on $win worked fine for me when I tested. Can you please get rid of all the *.cache and gen_* files and recompile it again? If it persists, I'll take a look.
- Andrei

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] #31362 [Opn]: GtkFileSelection->complete more complete
email.body:
ID: 31362 Updated by: jed@php.net Reported By: ceo at l-i-e dot com Status: Open -Bug Type: Feature/Change Request +Bug Type: PHP-GTK related PHP Version: Irrelevant New Comment:
gtk_file_selection_complete() doesn't offer this in GTK. PHP-GTK is simply a wrap over GTK itself.
Previous Comments: ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[2004-12-31 05:58:34] ceo at l-i-e dot com
Description: ------------ It would be Really Nifty (tm) if GtkFileSelection->complete took an optional second argument which would make the pattern matching 'pervasive'
IE, the dialog would continue to only present filenames that matched the given expression.
Providing the same functionality through some other mechanism would be fine, of course.
I suppose one could, in theory, dig down into the guts of the Widget, and find all the widgets inside that can affect the selection, and then connect() a function to each one that would call complete() repeatedly...
But it would be Really Hard for your mere mortal programmer to find *ALL* the possible circumstances that could change the selection....
------------------------------------------------------------------------
-- Edit this bug report at http://bugs.php.net/?id=31362&edit=1
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] GtkSheetRange struct to object
email.body:
Hi
I´m thinking to something like this to implement GtkSheetRange object:
(object SheetRange (in-module Gtk) (parent Widget (Gtk)) (c-name GtkSheetRange) )
(method set_range (of-object SheetRange (Gtk)) (c-name gtk_sheet_range_get_points) (return-type GtkSheetRange) (parameter (type-and-name gint* *row0)) (parameter (type-and-name gint* *col0)) (parameter (type-and-name gint* *rowi)) (parameter (type-and-name gint* *coli)) )
The problem is that there is no a function like the written one and I don´t know how to assing the values to the object, what can I do?
regards
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: [PHP-GTK] Re: GtkSheet style
email.body:
On Thu, 13 Jan 2005, Ivan Rodriguez wrote: > Hello > > I write this in the extra.defs file: > > (struct SheetRange > (in-module Gtk) > (c-name GtkSheetRange) > (field (type-and-name gint row0)) > (field (type-and-name gint col0)) > (field (type-and-name gint rowi)) > (field (type-and-name gint coli)) > ) > > Now if y do this in PHP: > > $cmap = gtk::widget_get_default_colormap(); > $bgcolor = $cmap->alloc('#eae8e3'); > > $sheet = new GtkSheet(5, 5, "test"); > $sheet->range_set_background(1, $bgcolor); > $sheet->show(); > > PHP says: > Warning: range_set_background() expects argument 1 to be GtkSheetRange, > integer given in /home/epplestun/sheet.php on line 24 > > But I don't know how to create a GtkSheetRange in PHP code, I try with > new GtkSheetRange but not work :-( > > Any idea? ¿
Well, obviously the range_set_background() definition requires a GtkSheetRange as the first argument. Why are you passing 1? What error do you get when you try to instantiate GtkSheetRange class?
- Andrei
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] GtkSheetRange constructor problems
[PHP-GTK-DEV] Fw: GtkSheetRange constructor problems
email.body:
Helps some if I hit the right button...
----- Original Message ----- From: "Steph" <steph@zend.com> To: "Ivan Rodriguez" <epplestun@gmail.com> Sent: Friday, January 14, 2005 4:45 PM Subject: Re: GtkSheetRange constructor problems
> grr :( > > It was a slightly different problem with GtkComboButton (where I stole that > thought from). The thing was actually called gtkcombobutton throughout the > C file (unusually) and the generator tried to make it live with > gtk_combo_button... > > I wonder if getting the case right would help any? e.g. #define > gtksheet_range gtksheetrange > > I'm not sure because I don't know where it's coming in from. Andrei, you > know the generator code (if you can remember that far back? ;) - any idea > where would be the best place to prevent GtkSheet_Range from occuring at a > crucial point? It's getting everything right apart from the function > entries. > > static function_entry php_gtk_sheet_range_functions[] = { > {"GtkSheetRange", PHP_FN(gtksheetrange), NULL}, > {"gtksheet_range", PHP_FN(gtksheetrange), NULL}, > {NULL, NULL, NULL} > }; > > This is the only thing stopping Ivan from being a full-on php.net developer > at present :) > > - Steph > > ----- Original Message ----- > From: "Ivan Rodriguez" <epplestun@gmail.com> > To: <steph@zend.com>; <andrei@gravitonic.com>; <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> > Sent: Friday, January 14, 2005 4:12 PM > Subject: GtkSheetRange constructor problems > > > > Hi Steph > > > > I try to do what you say, I include: > > > > #define GTKSHEET_RANGE GTK_SHEETRANGE > > > > In the header of extra.overrides but not work :-( > > > > The problem is in the struct generation, I don't know why the generator > > no creates gtksheetrange function, all objects has two constructor > > functionsm the first GtkWindow for example and the second gtkwindow, > > there are two functions but the second has lower letters, and in the > > GtkSheetrange no :-(. In this case, the generator don't generate the > > second function and this is the error, the generator generates > > gtksheet_range function and I don't know why, I read the code of > > generator and If I changed something like '_' in the structs generation > > the C code crash, the problem is this, why generator generate > > gtksheet_range function? > > > > > > this code is the responsable :-( > > > > /* write the initializer */ > > fwrite($fp, sprintf($struct_init_tpl, > > $struct_module . '_' . $struct_lname, > > $struct->in_module . $struct->name, > > $struct->ce, implode('', $init_prop_code))); > > > > /* write getter */ > > fwrite($fp, sprintf($struct_get_tpl, > > $struct_module . '_' . $struct_lname, > > $struct->in_module . $struct->name, > > $struct->ce, implode('', $get_prop_code))); > > > > /* write the constructor */ > > fwrite($fp, sprintf($struct_construct_tpl, > > strtolower($struct->c_name), > > $var_list->to_string(), > > $specs, > > implode(', ', $parse_list), > > implode('', $construct_prop_code))); > > $functions_decl = sprintf($functions_decl_tpl, $struct_module . '_' . > > $struct_lname); > > $functions_decl .= sprintf($function_entry_tpl, > > $struct->in_module . $struct->name, > > strtolower($struct->c_name), > > 'NULL'); > > $functions_decl .= sprintf($function_entry_tpl, > > $struct_module . $struct_lname, > > strtolower($struct->c_name), > > 'NULL'); > > $functions_decl .= $this->functions_decl_end; > > > > Any sugestion? > > -- > > Ivan Rodriguez <epplestun@gmail.com> >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] php-gtk-doc down?
email.body:
Christian Weiske wrote: > Does somebody know if there is a problem with php-gtk-doc? I comitted > something yesterday, and sent a mail four hours ago - but nothing came > up in the list.
Sorry if my response is too late, but a lot of my messages are delayed serveral hours. So I don't know if anyone has replied yet.
Anyway, I assume you are talking about the Russian pages. The time stamp on the manual says it was updated and the pages look to have been updated to me.
Scott
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Compile a PHP-Gtk script
email.body:
Hi all guru programming, maybe there isn't a right place but this mailing-list is the last place for me. I want compile my first PHP-GTk application but the compilation process is a problem to solve for me. I have try with RoadSend compiler but i have find a bug : http://www.roadsend.com/p/forum/viewThread.php?mID=8161a7e2175a595a915a650a1b8d7c3a&pa \ geID=comForum&tID=bb8a22750f8bd7e69cc560ab71a5778c&expandedIds=bb8a22750f8bd7e69cc560ab71a5778c At this point i have try with Priadoblender compiler. With Priado i have compiled simple script but when i have try with PHP-GTk there are problem like dependencies or module. The last version of project cannot install on my system (i'm not lucky man). Sorry for Off Topic post but i don't be able to solve this problem. Thanks so much and good work to all :):):) P.S: Andrei have you advice for me ?
____________________________________________________________ Libero ADSL: 3 mesi gratis e navighi a 1.2 Mega. E poi hai l'Adsl senza limiti a meno \ di 1 euro al giorno. Abbonati subito senza costi di attivazione su \ http://www.libero.it

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: [PHP-GTK] Re: GtkSheet style
email.body:
Ivan, next time you foray into C, would you mind using the php-gtk-dev list? You're scaring the newbies! ;)
Did you try coding the gdkcolor in a way that doesn't rely on your OS? - things like 'yellow' are open to interpretation (via rgb.txt or whatever).
- Steph
----- Original Message ----- From: "Ivan Rodriguez" <epplestun@gmail.com> To: "Alan Knowles" <alan@akbkhome.com> Cc: <php-gtk-general@lists.php.net> Sent: Tuesday, January 11, 2005 8:06 PM Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK] Re: GtkSheet style
Hi Alan
I edit the gen_extra.c file and I wirte this:
PHP_FUNCTION(gtk_sheet_range_set_background) { int row0, col0, rowi, coli; GtkSheetRange *range; zval *php_color; GdkColor *color;
NOT_STATIC_METHOD();
if (!php_gtk_parse_args(ZEND_NUM_ARGS(), "iiiiO", &row0, &col0, &rowi, &coli, &php_color, gdk_color_ce)) return;
range->row0 = (gint)row0; range->col0 = (gint)col0; range->rowi = (gint)rowi; range->coli = (gint)coli;
color = PHP_GDK_COLOR_GET(php_color); gtk_sheet_range_set_background(GTK_SHEET(PHP_GTK_GET(this_ptr)), (GtkSheetRange *) range, color); RETURN_NULL(); } .... {"range_set_background", PHP_FN(gtk_sheet_range_set_background), NULL},
The code works fine, but I have one problem, the color is not the orignal color, for example:
$bgcolor = &new GdkColor("yellow"); $sheet->range_set_background(0, 0, 0, 2, $bgcolor);
This code colorize the first 3 colums of the first row, but the background color is not yellow, the color change when I start the script, and puts green, red or other colors, why this?
Any sugestion?
El mar, 11-01-2005 a las 05:40, Alan Knowles escribiÃ³: > I suspect I never wrote bindings for GtkSheetRange.. or that method is > not generated due to the const-GtkSheetRange, It's been a long while > since I looked at it.. > > Regards > Alan > > Ivan Rodriguez wrote: > > >Hi > > > >I read the file extra.defs and here the methods are defined > > > >.... > >(method range_set_background > > (of-object Sheet (Gtk)) > > (c-name gtk_sheet_range_set_background) > > (return-type none) > > (parameter (type-and-name const-GtkSheetRange* range)) > > (parameter (type-and-name const-GdkColor* color)) > >) > > > >(method range_set_foreground > > (of-object Sheet (Gtk)) > > (c-name gtk_sheet_range_set_foreground) > > (return-type none) > > (parameter (type-and-name const-GtkSheetRange* range)) > > (parameter (type-and-name const-GdkColor* color)) > >) > >... > > > >But the GtkSheet object don't have the methods to use in PHP, why this? > >I don't understand because other methods works fine. > > > >Any sugestion? > > > >Regards > > > >El lun, 10-01-2005 a las 17:44, Ivan Rodriguez escribiÃf ³: > > > > > >>Hi > >> > >>IÃ, ´m trying to set a backgorund color to cell of GtkSheet, but I donÃ, ´t > >>know how to set, I believe that the object does not support all the > >>metodos of the real object, since they do not appear many methods in > >>the manual, i.e: range_set_background, range_set_border, > >>range_set_font ... and many more > >> > >>My question is, is posible to set a background color to cell? > >> > >>Regards > >> > >> -- Ivan Rodriguez <epplestun@gmail.com>
-- PHP-GTK General Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: [PHP-GTK] Re: GtkSheet style
email.body:
Steph excuse me :-(
But works perfect, I talk with Andrei and the form to put th GdkColor is usign:
$cmap = gtk::widget_get_default_colormap(); $color = $cmap->alloc('#ffcc00');
$sheet->range_set_background(0, 0, 0, 0, $bgcolor);
regards

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: [PHP-GTK] Re: GtkSheet style
email.body:
Can you send over a diff to the extra.overides
-have a look at the file, and add this method to it + the %% override command. -run cvs diff -u > mypatch.txt - send the mypatch.txt to the mailing list.
And I'll patch the source.
Regards Alan

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: GtkSheetRange constructor problems
email.body:
Please try the attached patch.
On Fri, 14 Jan 2005, Ivan Rodriguez wrote: > Hi Steph > > I try to do what you say, I include: > > #define GTKSHEET_RANGE GTK_SHEETRANGE > > In the header of extra.overrides but not work :-( > > The problem is in the struct generation, I don't know why the generator > no creates gtksheetrange function, all objects has two constructor > functionsm the first GtkWindow for example and the second gtkwindow, > there are two functions but the second has lower letters, and in the > GtkSheetrange no :-(. In this case, the generator don't generate the > second function and this is the error, the generator generates > gtksheet_range function and I don't know why, I read the code of > generator and If I changed something like '_' in the structs generation > the C code crash, the problem is this, why generator generate > gtksheet_range function? > > > this code is the responsable :-( > > /* write the initializer */ > fwrite($fp, sprintf($struct_init_tpl, > $struct_module . '_' . $struct_lname, > $struct->in_module . $struct->name, > $struct->ce, implode('', $init_prop_code))); > > /* write getter */ > fwrite($fp, sprintf($struct_get_tpl, > $struct_module . '_' . $struct_lname, > $struct->in_module . $struct->name, > $struct->ce, implode('', $get_prop_code))); > > /* write the constructor */ > fwrite($fp, sprintf($struct_construct_tpl, > strtolower($struct->c_name), > $var_list->to_string(), > $specs, > implode(', ', $parse_list), > implode('', $construct_prop_code))); > $functions_decl = sprintf($functions_decl_tpl, $struct_module . '_' . > $struct_lname); > $functions_decl .= sprintf($function_entry_tpl, > $struct->in_module . $struct->name, > strtolower($struct->c_name), > 'NULL'); > $functions_decl .= sprintf($function_entry_tpl, > $struct_module . $struct_lname, > strtolower($struct->c_name), > 'NULL'); > $functions_decl .= $this->functions_decl_end; > > Any sugestion? > -- > Ivan Rodriguez <epplestun@gmail.com>
- Andrei
["generator.diff" (text/plain)]
Index: generator/generator.php =================================================================== RCS file: /repository/php-gtk/generator/generator.php,v retrieving revision 1.43.2.1 diff -u -p -r1.43.2.1 generator.php --- generator/generator.php 7 Aug 2004 06:49:35 -0000 1.43.2.1 +++ generator/generator.php 14 Jan 2005 18:19:52 -0000 @@ -460,7 +460,7 @@ class Generator { strtolower($struct->c_name), 'NULL'); $functions_decl .= sprintf($function_entry_tpl, - $struct_module . $struct_lname, + strtolower($struct->in_module . $struct->name), strtolower($struct->c_name), 'NULL'); $functions_decl .= $this->functions_decl_end;
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

In this case, the generator don't generate the > > second function and this is the error, the generator generates > > gtksheet_range function and I don't know why, I read the code of > > generator and If I changed something like '_' in the structs generation > > the C code crash, the problem is this, why generator generate > > gtksheet_range function? > > > > > > this code is the responsable :-( > > > > /* write the initializer */ > > fwrite($fp, sprintf($struct_init_tpl, > > $struct_module . '_' . $struct_lname, > > $struct->in_module . $struct->name, > > $struct->ce, implode('', $init_prop_code))); > > > > /* write getter */ > > fwrite($fp, sprintf($struct_get_tpl, > > $struct_module . '_' . $struct_lname, > > $struct->in_module . $struct->name, > > $struct->ce, implode('', $get_prop_code))); > > > > /* write the constructor */ > > fwrite($fp, sprintf($struct_construct_tpl, > > strtolower($struct->c_name), > > $var_list->to_string(), > > $specs, > > implode(', ', $parse_list), > > implode('', $construct_prop_code))); > > $functions_decl = sprintf($functions_decl_tpl, $struct_module . '_' . > > $struct_lname); > > $functions_decl .= sprintf($function_entry_tpl, > > $struct->in_module . $struct->name, > > strtolower($struct->c_name), > > 'NULL'); > > $functions_decl .= sprintf($function_entry_tpl, > > $struct_module . $struct_lname, > > strtolower($struct->c_name), > > 'NULL'); > > $functions_decl .= $this->functions_decl_end; > > > > Any sugestion? > > -- > > Ivan Rodriguez <epplestun@gmail.com> > > > > - Andrei >

Regards!

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Some patch for extra.defs and generator.php
email.body:
I think you got your diff arguments the wrong way round - you should end up with lots of lines with + (Eg. added), rather than - (eg. removed)
Regards Alan
Ivan Rodriguez wrote:
>Hello, it sent the archives to them with the applied changes here to >give support to GtkSheetRange and to other functions of the GtkSheet >object. > >Regards! > > email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Some patch for extra.defs and generator.php
email.body:
Hi Alan
This is the diff patch:
--- c:\PHP-GTK\php-gtk-dev\old\extra.defs Mon Jan 17 08:30:15 2005 +++ c:\PHP-GTK\php-gtk-dev\extra.defs Mon Jan 17 08:31:08 2005 @@ -1890,3 +1890,11 @@ (parameter (type-and-name gfloat y_align)) )
+(struct SheetRange + (in-module Gtk) + (c-name GtkSheetRange) + (field (type-and-name gint row0)) + (field (type-and-name gint col0)) + (field (type-and-name gint rowi)) + (field (type-and-name gint coli)) +) \ No newline at end of file
On Mon, 17 Jan 2005 08:45:31 +0800, Alan Knowles <alan@akbkhome.com> wrote: > > I think you got your diff arguments the wrong way round - you should end > up with lots of lines with + (Eg. added), rather than - (eg. removed) > > Regards > Alan > > Ivan Rodriguez wrote: > > > Hello, it sent the archives to them with the applied changes here to > > give support to GtkSheetRange and to other functions of the GtkSheet > > object. > > > > Regards! > > > > > > ------------------------------------------------------------------------ > > > > --- /home/epplestun/sources/php-gtk-1.0.1/ext/extra/extra.defs 2005-01-16 \ > > 21:52:12.000000000 +0100 > > +++ extra.defs 2005-01-16 22:09:10.000000000 +0100 > > @@ -1,4 +1,3 @@ > > - On Sat, 15 Jan 2005 14:42:01 +0200, Steph <steph@zend.com> wrote: > Ah, that's the line I looked for and couldn't find :) > > Ivan? > > ----- Original Message ----- > From: "Andrei Zmievski" <andrei@gravitonic.com> > To: "Ivan Rodriguez" <epplestun@gmail.com> > Cc: <steph@zend.com>; <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> > Sent: Friday, January 14, 2005 8:20 PM > Subject: Re: GtkSheetRange constructor problems > > > Please try the attached patch. > > > > On Fri, 14 Jan 2005, Ivan Rodriguez wrote: > > > Hi Steph > > > > > > I try to do what you say, I include: > > > > > > #define GTKSHEET_RANGE GTK_SHEETRANGE > > > > > > In the header of extra.overrides but not work :-( > > > > > > The problem is in the struct generation, I don't know why the generator > > > no creates gtksheetrange function, all objects has two constructor > > > functionsm the first GtkWindow for example and the second gtkwindow, > > > there are two functions but the second has lower letters, and in the > > > GtkSheetrange no :-(. In this case, the generator don't generate the > > > second function and this is the error, the generator generates > > > gtksheet_range function and I don't know why, I read the code of > > > generator and If I changed something like '_' in the structs generation > > > the C code crash, the problem is this, why generator generate > > > gtksheet_range function? > > > > > > > > > this code is the responsable :-( > > > > > > /* write the initializer */ > > > fwrite($fp, sprintf($struct_init_tpl, > > > $struct_module . '_' . $struct_lname, > > > $struct->in_module . $struct->name, > > > $struct->ce, implode('', $init_prop_code))); > > > > > > /* write getter */ > > > fwrite($fp, sprintf($struct_get_tpl, > > > $struct_module . '_' . $struct_lname, > > > $struct->in_module . $struct->name, > > > $struct->ce, implode('', $get_prop_code))); > > > > > > /* write the constructor */ > > > fwrite($fp, sprintf($struct_construct_tpl, > > > strtolower($struct->c_name), > > > $var_list->to_string(), > > > $specs, > > > implode(', ', $parse_list), > > > implode('', $construct_prop_code))); > > > $functions_decl = sprintf($functions_decl_tpl, $struct_module . '_' . > > > $struct_lname); > > > $functions_decl .= sprintf($function_entry_tpl, > > > $struct->in_module . $struct->name, > > > strtolower($struct->c_name), > > > 'NULL'); > > > $functions_decl .= sprintf($function_entry_tpl, > > > $struct_module . $struct_lname, > > > strtolower($struct->c_name), > > > 'NULL'); > > > $functions_decl .= $this->functions_decl_end; > > > > > > Any sugestion? > > > -- > > > Ivan Rodriguez <epplestun@gmail.com> > > > > > > > > - Andrei > > >

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: [PHP-GTK] Re: GtkSheet style
email.body:
Hi Ivan,
gen_* means the file is generated...
The generated files come out of merging the .c file(s) and the overrides file. So the new function needs to be in the overrides file.
HTH,
- Steph

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: [PHP-GTK] Re: GtkSheet style
email.body:
you need to put them in extra.overrides - otherwise they will get deleted at build time if anything happens to touch the defs or overrides file.
the overrides format is very simple - just 2 extra lines above each method.
Regards Alan
Ivan Rodriguez wrote:
>Hi Alan > >I´m implement this methods: > >range_set_bakcground >range_set_foreground >range_set_border >range_set_border_color > >To implement this methods I´m writting the code into the gen_extra.c >file, i don´t know if this way is the correct one to do it. email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] January News
email.body:
Hello Everyone,
It is just about the middle of the month, which means it is time for me to annoy everyone on this list with a request for news items again. Anybody have any new articles, applications, or anything else news worthy?
Ivan Rodriguez had mentioned on IRC and the general list that he has been working on implementing some missing functions from GtkSheet. Any chance these will get into PHP-GTK 1.0.2?
The only thing I have to contribute for now is a new PEAR class (http://pear.php.net/package/Gtk_Styled)
Please send anything else you have my way. Thanks, -- Scott Mattocks scott@crisscott.com http://www.crisscott.com http://pear.php.net/user/scottmattocks

PHP-GTK 2 is about 30-35% implemented (Andrei, if you have time can you update the wiki so that we have something to point to?) PHP-GTK-ers are recognized on the Zend Who's Who Ivan is working on some GtkExtra classes (PHP-GTK 1.1?) Yet another PEAR class

Thanks for everyone's help, Scott

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] January News
email.body:
Here is version one without any links. I will be out of town for the rest of the week so I will try to get this up today after adding links and making any recommended changes.
Thanks, Scott
Expanding Horizons PHP-GTK development is growing in serveral directions. A recent barage of commits by Andrei shows that PHP-GTK 2 is moving ever closer towards a working release. At the same time, Ivan Rodriguez has been helping to add some GtkExtra classes to PHP-GTK 1.
Other PHP communities are contributing to PHP-GTK development in their own way. PEAR has released another class, Gtk_Styled, to help PHP-GTK developers write cleaner, more stable code. The folks over at zend have recognized everyone who has contributed to PHP-GTK development, documentation or the web site by adding them to the "Zend Who's Who of PHP".
In other news, the GDK section of the manual has been completely translated into Russian.
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php
