email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] XID on win32
email.body:
Hi
Here are some changes that will allow xid to return the Hwnd value.
In gdk.overrides:
%% override-prop GdkDrawable xid PHPG_PROP_READER { #if defined(GDK_WINDOWING_X11) RETVAL_LONG(GDK_DRAWABLE_XID(((GdkDrawable *)((phpg_gobject_t *)object)->obj))); #else RETVAL_LONG((long) GDK_WINDOW_HWND((GdkDrawable *)((phpg_gobject_t *)object)->obj)); #endif return SUCCESS; }
And in php_gtk+_types.c remove:
#ifndef PHP_WIN32 "xid", #endif
just leaving "xid"
There are 3 places to change. --
Tom
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] XID on win32
email.body:
I applied the gdk.overrides patch. Don't worry about php_gtk+_types.c - the code there is old and will be removed soon.
-Andrei
On Dec 15, 2005, at 7:02 AM, Tom Rogers wrote:
> Hi > > Here are some changes that will allow xid to return the Hwnd value. > > In gdk.overrides: > > %% > override-prop GdkDrawable xid > PHPG_PROP_READER > { > #if defined(GDK_WINDOWING_X11) > RETVAL_LONG(GDK_DRAWABLE_XID(((GdkDrawable *)((phpg_gobject_t *) > object)->obj))); > #else > RETVAL_LONG((long) GDK_WINDOW_HWND((GdkDrawable *) > ((phpg_gobject_t *)object)->obj)); > #endif > return SUCCESS; > } > > And in php_gtk+_types.c remove: > > #ifndef PHP_WIN32 > "xid", > #endif > > just leaving "xid" > > There are 3 places to change. > -- > > Tom > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: [PHP-GTK] Re: GtkSheet style
email.body:
Hello Alan
I rewrite the extra.overrides file, but I have a problem, the functions use GtkSheetRange, and I build this struct into the function, in the function I pass four int values, and not GtkSheetRange object, I change the extra.defs file but don´t works because the C function needs GtkSheetRange, If I put the C code into gen_extra.c all works fine but if I put into extra.overrides and in the extra.defs don´t work :-(
I believe that it is necessary to create the GtkSheetrange object but I don´t know how to do it, how to pass C struct to object ... ?¿ How can I do?
I go to view some source codes to implent this struct ..... any sugestion to start?

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: [PHP-GTK] Re: GtkSheet style
email.body:
Hi
I´m thinking to something like:
(object SheetRange (in-module Gtk) (parent Widget (Gtk)) (c-name GtkSheetRange) )
(method set_range (of-object SheetRange (Gtk)) (c-name gtk_sheet_range_get_points) (return-type GtkSheetRange) (parameter (type-and-name gint* *row0)) (parameter (type-and-name gint* *col0)) (parameter (type-and-name gint* *rowi)) (parameter (type-and-name gint* *coli)) )
The problem is that there is no a function like the written one and I don´t know how to assing the values to the object, what can I do?

email.body:
the struct is define in gtksheet.h and not into gtkextra.h If I understand you if I put this struct into the extra.overrides will work well no? i will try ...
El jue, 13-01-2005 a las 22:07, Steph escribiÃ³: > It's an object, no? > > Firstly - is it defined in gtkextra.h? (I don't have this on board > currently.) If it isn't you'll need to find the definition and add the > relevant header to overrides before you can wrap it. > > ----- Original Message ----- > From: "Ivan Rodriguez" <epplestun@gmail.com> > To: <alan@akbkhome.com> > Cc: <steph@zend.com>; <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> > Sent: Thursday, January 13, 2005 10:59 PM > Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: [PHP-GTK] Re: GtkSheet style > > > Hello > > I write this in the extra.defs file: > > (struct SheetRange > (in-module Gtk) > (c-name GtkSheetRange) > (field (type-and-name gint row0)) > (field (type-and-name gint col0)) > (field (type-and-name gint rowi)) > (field (type-and-name gint coli)) > ) > > > > With this code the functions range_set_* compile perfect and generate > the C code in gen_extra.c > > PHP_GTK_EXPORT_CE(gtk_sheet_range_ce); > > /* struct GtkSheetRange */ > > zval *PHP_GTK_EXPORT_FUNC(php_gtk_sheet_range_new)(GtkSheetRange *obj) > { > zval *result; > TSRMLS_FETCH(); > > if (!obj) { > MAKE_STD_ZVAL(result); > ZVAL_NULL(result); > return result; > } > > MAKE_STD_ZVAL(result); > object_init_ex(result, gtk_sheet_range_ce); > > add_property_long(result, "row0", obj->row0); > add_property_long(result, "col0", obj->col0); > add_property_long(result, "rowi", obj->rowi); > add_property_long(result, "coli", obj->coli); > > return result; > } > > > zend_bool PHP_GTK_EXPORT_FUNC(php_gtk_sheet_range_get)(zval *wrapper, > GtkSheetRange *obj) > { > zval **item; > TSRMLS_FETCH(); > > if (!php_gtk_check_class(wrapper, gtk_sheet_range_ce)) > return 0; > > if (zend_hash_find(Z_OBJPROP_P(wrapper), "row0", sizeof("row0"), (void > **)&item) == SUCCESS && Z_TYPE_PP(item) == IS_LONG) > obj->row0 = (gint)Z_LVAL_PP(item); > else > return 0; > > if (zend_hash_find(Z_OBJPROP_P(wrapper), "col0", sizeof("col0"), (void > **)&item) == SUCCESS && Z_TYPE_PP(item) == IS_LONG) > obj->col0 = (gint)Z_LVAL_PP(item); > else > return 0; > > if (zend_hash_find(Z_OBJPROP_P(wrapper), "rowi", sizeof("rowi"), (void > **)&item) == SUCCESS && Z_TYPE_PP(item) == IS_LONG) > obj->rowi = (gint)Z_LVAL_PP(item); > else > return 0; > > if (zend_hash_find(Z_OBJPROP_P(wrapper), "coli", sizeof("coli"), (void > **)&item) == SUCCESS && Z_TYPE_PP(item) == IS_LONG) > obj->coli = (gint)Z_LVAL_PP(item); > else > return 0; > > > return 1; > } > > > PHP_FUNCTION(gtksheetrange) > { > long row0, col0, rowi, coli; > > NOT_STATIC_METHOD(); > > if (!php_gtk_parse_args(ZEND_NUM_ARGS(), "iiii", &row0, &col0, &rowi, > &coli)) { > php_gtk_invalidate(this_ptr); > return; > } > > add_property_long(this_ptr, "row0", row0); > add_property_long(this_ptr, "col0", col0); > add_property_long(this_ptr, "rowi", rowi); > add_property_long(this_ptr, "coli", coli); > } > > > static function_entry php_gtk_sheet_range_functions[] = { > {"GtkSheetRange", PHP_FN(gtksheetrange), NULL}, > {"gtksheet_range", PHP_FN(gtksheetrange), NULL}, > {NULL, NULL, NULL} > }; > > INIT_CLASS_ENTRY(ce, "GtkSheetRange", php_gtk_sheet_range_functions); > gtk_sheet_range_ce = zend_register_internal_class_ex(&ce, NULL, NULL > TSRMLS_CC); > > Now if y do this in PHP: > > $cmap = gtk::widget_get_default_colormap(); > $bgcolor = $cmap->alloc('#eae8e3'); > > $sheet = new GtkSheet(5, 5, "test"); > $sheet->range_set_background(1, $bgcolor); > $sheet->show(); > > PHP says: > Warning: range_set_background() expects argument 1 to be GtkSheetRange, > integer given in /home/epplestun/sheet.php on line 24 > > But I don't know how to create a GtkSheetRange in PHP code, I try with > new GtkSheetRange but not work :-( > > Any idea?Ã‚ ¿ > > > El jue, 13-01-2005 a las 15:38, Ivan Rodriguez escribiÃƒ ³: > > Hi > > > > IÃ‚ ´m thinking to something like: > > > > (object SheetRange > > (in-module Gtk) > > (parent Widget (Gtk)) > > (c-name GtkSheetRange) > > ) > > > > (method set_range > > (of-object SheetRange (Gtk)) > > (c-name gtk_sheet_range_get_points) > > (return-type GtkSheetRange) > > (parameter (type-and-name gint* *row0)) > > (parameter (type-and-name gint* *col0)) > > (parameter (type-and-name gint* *rowi)) > > (parameter (type-and-name gint* *coli)) > > ) > > > > The problem is that there is no a function like the written one and I > > donÃ‚ ´t know how to assing the values to the object, what can I do? -- Ivan Rodriguez <epplestun@gmail.com>

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Property access
[PHP-GTK-DEV] Compiling PHP-GTK2
email.body:
I tried compiling PHP-GTK2 last night and got this message:
ext/gtk+/gen_pango.c: In function `zif_pango_pango_language_from_string': ext/gtk+/gen_pango.c:69: warning: assignment makes pointer from integer without a cast ext/gtk+/gen_pango.c: In function `zif_PangoColor___construct': ext/gtk+/gen_pango.c:1191: warning: passing arg 1 of `pango_color_parse' from incompatible pointer type ext/gtk+/gen_pango.c:1191: error: too few arguments to function `pango_color_parse' ext/gtk+/gen_pango.c:1191: warning: assignment makes pointer from integer without a cast make: *** [ext/gtk+/gen_pango.lo] Error 1
Any suggestions?
Thanks, -- Scott Mattocks scott@crisscott.com http://www.crisscott.com http://pear.php.net/user/scottmattocks
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.body:
Hi , I can build on debian (xandros) but only after editing configure directly to remove any checks for atk version , atk is correct version but whatever method configure uses for checking this version does not work (at least on my debian)
PyGTK 2.6 builds without such problems so I don't think its my system??
Any Ideas ?
Regards, Simon.

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: [php-gtk-cvs] cvs: php-gtk /ext/gtk+gtktreeview.overrides
email.body:
OK, got it. iter_next() doesn't return an iter object, it returns a _pointer_ to an iter object. So the code attached works, although the path part probably won't.
The question is - should it?
It's perfectly normal to do something like this in GTK terms, but you're probably right in that the return you expected in PHP terms is what should be provided in PHP-GTK.
Andrei - deliver a pronunciation on policy?
nb it would be stupidly easy to make it the way Pablo thinks it should be. It would take one line.
- Steph

email.subject: Fw: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: [php-gtk-cvs] cvs: php-gtk /ext/gtk+gtktreeview.overrides
[PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: [php-gtk-cvs] cvs: php-gtk /ext/gtk+ gtktreeview.overrides
email.body:
Andrei,
I still think the gtktreepath functions are extremely useful in iteration - especially to_string(), but also the ways gtktreepath offers of manoeveuring between next/prev/up/down. Can I please commit that 'boxed treepath' patch?
- Steph
----- Original Message ----- From: "Andrei Zmievski" <andrei@php.net> To: <php-gtk-cvs@lists.php.net> Sent: Saturday, November 05, 2005 4:37 AM Subject: [php-gtk-cvs] cvs: php-gtk /ext/gtk+ gtktreeview.overrides
> andrei Fri Nov 4 23:37:45 2005 EDT > > Modified files: > /php-gtk/ext/gtk+ gtktreeview.overrides > Log: > Make GtkTreeModel::iter_next() return the next iterator _without_ > changing the input one. > > > http://cvs.php.net/diff.php/php-gtk/ext/gtk+/gtktreeview.overrides?r1=1.22&r2=1.23&ty=u > Index: php-gtk/ext/gtk+/gtktreeview.overrides > diff -u php-gtk/ext/gtk+/gtktreeview.overrides:1.22 php-gtk/ext/gtk+/gtktreeview.overrides:1.23 > --- php-gtk/ext/gtk+/gtktreeview.overrides:1.22 Wed Nov 2 15:31:32 2005 > +++ php-gtk/ext/gtk+/gtktreeview.overrides Fri Nov 4 23:37:43 2005 > @@ -584,7 +584,7 @@ > override gtk_tree_model_iter_next > PHP_METHOD > { > - GtkTreeIter *iter; > + GtkTreeIter iter; > zval *php_iter; > > NOT_STATIC_METHOD(); > @@ -592,13 +592,13 @@ > if (!php_gtk_parse_args(ZEND_NUM_ARGS(), "O", &php_iter, gtktreeiter_ce)) > return; > > - iter = (GtkTreeIter *) PHPG_GBOXED(php_iter); > + iter = *(GtkTreeIter *) PHPG_GBOXED(php_iter); > > - if (!gtk_tree_model_iter_next(GTK_TREE_MODEL(PHPG_GOBJECT(this_ptr)), iter)) { > - RETURN_FALSE; > + if (gtk_tree_model_iter_next(GTK_TREE_MODEL(PHPG_GOBJECT(this_ptr)), &iter)) { > + phpg_gboxed_new(&return_value, GTK_TYPE_TREE_ITER, &iter, TRUE, TRUE TSRMLS_CC); > + } else { > + RETURN_NULL(); > } > - > - phpg_gboxed_new(&return_value, GTK_TYPE_TREE_ITER, &iter, TRUE, TRUE TSRMLS_CC); > } > > %% > > -- > PHP-GTK CVS Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >

Seems that iter_next() isn't working properly > yet :-( > > regards > Pablo > > On Qua, 2005-11-02 at 20:31 +0000, Steph Fox wrote: > > sfox Wed Nov 2 15:31:32 2005 EDT > > > > Modified files: > > /php-gtk/ext/gtk+ gtktreeview.overrides > > Log: > > GtkCellRenderer::get_fixed_size() and GtkTreeModel::iter_next() > > > > http://cvs.php.net/diff.php/php-gtk/ext/gtk+/gtktreeview.overrides?r1=1.21&r2=1.22&ty=u > > Index: php-gtk/ext/gtk+/gtktreeview.overrides > > diff -u php-gtk/ext/gtk+/gtktreeview.overrides:1.21 php-gtk/ext/gtk+/gtktreeview.overrides:1.22 > > --- php-gtk/ext/gtk+/gtktreeview.overrides:1.21 Sun Oct 30 17:08:08 2005 > > +++ php-gtk/ext/gtk+/gtktreeview.overrides Wed Nov 2 15:31:32 2005 > > @@ -13,6 +13,7 @@ > > gtk_tree_path_* > > %% > > ignore > > + gtk_cell_renderer_get_size > > gtk_list_store_newv > > gtk_list_store_set_valist > > gtk_tree_row_reference_new_proxy > > @@ -86,6 +87,24 @@ > > } > > %% }}} > > > > +%% {{{ GtkCellRenderer > > +%% > > +override gtk_cell_renderer_get_fixed_size > > +PHP_METHOD > > +{ > > + int width, height = 0; > > + > > + NOT_STATIC_METHOD(); > > + > > + if (!php_gtk_parse_args(ZEND_NUM_ARGS(), "")) > > + return; > > + > > + gtk_cell_renderer_get_fixed_size(GTK_CELL_RENDERER(PHPG_GOBJECT(this_ptr)), &width, &height); > > + php_gtk_build_value(&return_value, "(ii)", width, height); > > +} > > + > > +%% }}} > > + > > %% {{{ GtkListStore > > %% > > add-arginfo GtkListStore __construct > > @@ -492,6 +511,7 @@ > > > > phpg_gboxed_new(&return_value, GTK_TYPE_TREE_ITER, &iter, TRUE, TRUE TSRMLS_CC); > > } > > + > > %% > > override gtk_tree_model_get_value > > PHP_METHOD > > @@ -554,6 +574,34 @@ > > } > > > > %% > > +add-arginfo GtkTreeModel iter_next > > +static > > +ZEND_BEGIN_ARG_INFO(ARGINFO_NAME, 0) > > + ZEND_ARG_INFO(0, iter) > > +ZEND_END_ARG_INFO(); email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: [php-gtk-cvs] cvs: php-gtk /ext/gtk+gtktreeview.overrides
email.body:
Mmm, okay, some experimentation later it seems you're right. The iter being returned doesn't belong to the model in your test script.
Strangely, it does in mine...! I need to look into this. Can't do so 'til tomorrow, PHP London tonight.
- Steph

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Gtk::idle_add
email.body:
Hello,
I was looking in the overrides file and I saw that Gtk::idle_add and friends is ignored. The comment for that section says "TBD". Why is that being ignored? Is there any reason it can't be un-ignored? I wouldn't say it is a vitally important feature but I think it could be very useful.
Thanks, Scott
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] last build
email.body:
Pablo,
> /usr/local/src/php-gtk/main/phpg_support.c: In function > `phpg_init_object': > /usr/local/src/php-gtk/main/phpg_support.c:246: error: structure has no > member named `guards' > make: ** [main/phpg_support.lo] Erro 1
What php version do you use? The latest 5.1.1?
-- Regards/MfG, Christian Weiske
["signature.asc" (application/pgp-signature)]

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] GTKUiManager
email.body:
Hello again
I'm having dificulties using GTKUiManager
I use :
$menu->add_ui_from_string($menustring);
Fatal error: Call to undefined method GtkUIManager::add_ui_from_string() in main.php on line 62
Is there a new version on the CVS that has this method?
Regards Pedro
["GTKUiManager" (message/rfc822)]
Message-ID: <43949AB4.805@phelios.org> Date: Mon, 05 Dec 2005 19:53:24 +0000 From: "Webmaster Phelios.org" <webmaster@phelios.org> User-Agent: Mozilla Thunderbird 1.0.7 (Windows/20050923) X-Accept-Language: en-us, en MIME-Version: 1.0 To: php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net Subject: GTKUiManager Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1; format=flowed Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Hello again
I'm having dificulties using GTKUiManager
I use :
$menu->add_ui_from_string($menustring);
Fatal error: Call to undefined method GtkUIManager::add_ui_from_string() in main.php on line 62
Is there a new version on the CVS that has this method?
Regards Pedro
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Overrides for GtkUIManager and GtkCalendar
Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Overrides for GtkUIManager and GtkCalendar
email.body:
Thanks Tom,
Up to the eyeballs in it at present (4.4 upgrade hit a large patch of code I'm responsible for), so if you don't get a review fairly soon just keep poking.
- Steph
----- Original Message ----- From: "Tom Rogers" <trogers@kwikin.com> To: <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Saturday, December 10, 2005 7:28 AM Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Overrides for GtkUIManager and GtkCalendar
> Hi > > Here is a combined UiManager and GtkCalendar patch for gtk2 > I have added a fourth value to the array returned by > GtkCalendar::get_date() which is a string suitable for use in the php > strtotime() function (ie. '2005-12-10') > > The month I have left in the 0-11 format to match the rest of the > calendar functions. > > The UiMangager functions I provided before were missing > NOT_STATIC_METHOD(); > > Hope this helps. > > -- > > Tom
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
> -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Overrides for GtkUIManager and GtkCalendar
email.body:
Tom, hi,
Would you mind putting short test scripts in with your patches? It takes much longer to review things like this when I'm having to look through sources to figure out what the expected behaviour is and how to reproduce it via PHP... and I'd guess you tested it already, no?
I'm really not sure about the date addition. I can see where you're coming from with the idea but it's a diversion from the target of language binding... and it's pretty trivial to produce that kind of a string from the data already available in GTK, with userland PHP code.
Andrei, anyone - any strong feelings about it, either way?
- Steph
----- Original Message ----- From: "Tom Rogers" <trogers@kwikin.com> To: <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Saturday, December 10, 2005 7:28 AM Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Overrides for GtkUIManager and GtkCalendar
> Hi > > Here is a combined UiManager and GtkCalendar patch for gtk2 > I have added a fourth value to the array returned by > GtkCalendar::get_date() which is a string suitable for use in the php > strtotime() function (ie. '2005-12-10') > > The month I have left in the 0-11 format to match the rest of the > calendar functions. > > The UiMangager functions I provided before were missing > NOT_STATIC_METHOD(); > > Hope this helps. > > -- > > Tom
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
> -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Overrides for GtkUIManager and GtkCalendar
email.body:
Oh holy Steph,
> Tom wants to make GtkCalendar::get_date() return something that can be > used with PHP's strtotime() function, e.g.'2005-12-10'. This to be the > fourth element in what is currently a three-element array. > Speak now or forever hold your peace!
I'd even vote for a timestamp - you can use date() with it.
-- Regards/MfG, Christian Weiske
["signature.asc" (application/pgp-signature)]

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Crash in closure code
email.body:
Should be fixed in CVS.
-Andrei
On Dec 3, 2005, at 5:41 PM, Tom Rogers wrote:
> Hi > > The following sample will cause a crash in windows. > If you change the connect() to connect_simple() no crash > > <?php > class window extends GtkWindow { > function __construct() { > parent::__construct(); > $this->connect_simple('destroy', array('gtk', 'main_quit')); > $this->set_title('Notebook Demos'); > $this->set_default_size(800, 400); > $hbox = new GtkHBox(false, 3); > $this->add($hbox); > $notebook = new GtkNotebook(); > $hbox->pack_start($notebook, true); > $notebook->connect('switch_page', array($this,'page_switch')); > $text = new GtkTextView(); > $notebook->append_page($text, new GtkLabel('Test')); > $this->show_all(); > } > function page_switch($a){ > echo "Page switch called.\n"; > return; > } > } > new window(); > gtk::main(); > ?> > > > Here is a stack dump: > > > _efree(void * 0x00000044, char * 0x010676a4 `string', unsigned int > 42, char * 0x00000000, unsigned int 0) line 286 + 3 bytes > phpg_free_gdkatom_storage(phpg_gdkatom_t * 0x00dc10c8, void * * * > 0x00da2938) line 42 + 44 bytes > zend_objects_store_del_ref(_zval_struct * 0x00dc1080, void * * * > 0x00da2938) line 169 + 18 bytes > _zval_dtor_func(_zval_struct * 0x00dc1080, char * 0x105b5108 > `string', unsigned int 35) line 52 + 19 bytes > _zval_dtor(_zval_struct * 0x00dc1080, char * 0x105bd874 `string', > unsigned int 386) line 35 + 16 bytes > _zval_ptr_dtor(_zval_struct * * 0x00dc0148, char * 0x0106774c > `string', unsigned int 141) line 386 + 27 bytes > phpg_closure_marshal(_GClosure * 0x01a35ec0, _GValue * 0x00000000, > unsigned int 3, const _GValue * 0x0012f4f4, void * 0x0012f3ac, void > * 0x00000000) line 141 + 34 bytes > LIBGOBJECT-2.0-0! 012a34de() > LIBGOBJECT-2.0-0! 012b662e() > LIBGOBJECT-2.0-0! 012b5434() > LIBGOBJECT-2.0-0! 012b5676() > LIBGTK-WIN32-2.0-0! 014f8b59() > LIBGTK-WIN32-2.0-0! 014f9f1e() > LIBGTK-WIN32-2.0-0! 014f953d() > zif_GtkNotebook_append_page(int 2, _zval_struct * 0x00dc0a88, > _zval_struct * * 0x00000000, _zval_struct * 0x00dc0100, int 0, void > * * * 0x00da2938) line 26665 + 79 bytes > zend_do_fcall_common_helper_SPEC(_zend_execute_data * 0x0012f908, > void * * * 0x00da2938) line 188 + 97 bytes > ZEND_DO_FCALL_BY_NAME_SPEC_HANDLER(_zend_execute_data * 0x0012f908, > void * * * 0x00da2938) line 310 + 13 bytes > execute(_zend_op_array * 0x00dc2db0, void * * * 0x00da2938) line 88 > + 15 bytes > zend_do_fcall_common_helper_SPEC(_zend_execute_data * 0x0012fa94, > void * * * 0x00da2938) line 222 + 33 bytes > ZEND_DO_FCALL_BY_NAME_SPEC_HANDLER(_zend_execute_data * 0x0012fa94, > void * * * 0x00da2938) line 310 + 13 bytes > execute(_zend_op_array * 0x00dbf7a8, void * * * 0x00da2938) line 88 > + 15 bytes > zend_execute_scripts(int 8, void * * * 0x00da2938, _zval_struct * * > 0x00000000, int 3) line 1090 + 33 bytes > php_execute_script(_zend_file_handle * 0x0012ff44, void * * * > 0x00da2938) line 1704 + 27 bytes > main(int 4, char * * 0x00da2580) line 1039 + 19 bytes > mainCRTStartup() line 338 + 17 bytes > KERNEL32! 7c581af6() > > > The relevent bit of code from phpg_free_gdkatom_storage() > (object->name is invalid at this point - 0x00000044) > > static void phpg_free_gdkatom_storage(phpg_gdkatom_t *object > TSRMLS_DC) > { > zend_hash_destroy(object->zobj.properties); > FREE_HASHTABLE(object->zobj.properties); >>>>>> if (object->name) efree(object->name); > efree(object); > } > > > And from phpg_closure_marshal(); (i=1 and n_param_values = 3) > > > err_marshal: > efree(callback_name); > i = (phpg_closure->connect_type == PHPG_CONNECT_REPLACE) ? 1 : 0; > for ( ; i < n_param_values; i++) { >>>>>>> zval_ptr_dtor(params[i]); > efree(params[i]); > } > efree(params); > } > > > Hope this helps. > Let me know if there is something I can do to help further. > > -- > > Tom > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PangoFontDescription::set_size
email.body:
Hi
Been playing with pango and suggest a small change to PangoFontDescription::set_size();
Pango is expecting the size in pango_units.
You can put in the constructor string:
$fontdescription = new PangoFontDescription("Ariel 30");
when you use $fontdescription->set_size(30); the resulting font size is 0.29296875
The patch to pango.overriodes will multiply the size by PANGO_SCALE making the 2 methods match.
I hope that makes sense :)
I still haven't worked out how to make it find the Ariel font but thats another story. --
Tom ["pangodiffs.txt" (text/plain)]
RCS file: /repository/php-gtk/ext/gtk+/pango.overrides,v retrieving revision 1.7 diff -u -w -b -r1.7 pango.overrides --- pango.overrides 31 Jul 2005 10:14:44 -0000 1.7 +++ pango.overrides 11 Dec 2005 08:13:26 -0000 @@ -70,3 +70,26 @@ ink.height, logical.x, logical.y, logical.width, logical.height); } + +%% +add-arginfo PangoFontDescription set_size +static +ZEND_BEGIN_ARG_INFO_EX(ARGINFO_NAME, 0, 0, 0) + ZEND_ARG_INFO(0, size) +ZEND_END_ARG_INFO(); + +%% +override pango_font_description_set_size +PHP_METHOD +{ + + long size; + + NOT_STATIC_METHOD(); + + if (!php_gtk_parse_args(ZEND_NUM_ARGS(), "i", &size)) + return; + + pango_font_description_set_size((PangoFontDescription *)PHPG_GBOXED(this_ptr), \ (gint)size * PANGO_SCALE); + +}
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] GtkColorButton proposal
Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] GtkColorButton proposal
email.body:
Also, I've been wondering about the GdkColor constructor... Supplying it with RGB values must be very rare, personally I belive it would be nice to have it accept strings as parse() method does, something like: $red = new GdkColor("red"); $red = new GdkColor("#ff0000");
Sure, it'd be nice, but it wouldn't be simple to implement. Assuming it's possible at all. The respective GTK methods expect those parameters - integers in the GdkColor constructor, or a color spec in the form of a string for Gdk::color_parse. Given that color specification strings are system-dependant (rgb.txt) I think it's probably better to let sleeping dogs lie... but I'll defer to Andrei :)

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: [php-gtk-cvs] cvs: php-gtk /ext/gtk+ gtk.overrides
[PHP-GTK-DEV] GtkCTreeNode and other pointers
email.body:
Hi Andrei, all,
I was looking at implementing GtkCTreeNode, not realizing it had already been implemented as a pointer - I'm still seeing 38 unwritten GtkCTree methods with 'unknown type 'GtkCTreeNode*'' in the build logs here. I think we ought to _try_ and support GtkCTree/GtkCList because there's legacy code out there using both widgets...
There are also 8 'unknown type 'gpointer'' messages, which seems weird to me given that we have support for gpointer now. The affected methods are: Gtk::accel_map_foreach(), Gtk::accel_map_foreach_unfiltered(), Gtk::binding_set_by_class(), Gtk::item_factory_popup_data_from_widget(), GtkTreeSelection::get_user_data(), GtkCList::find_row_from_data(), GtkCList::get_row_data() and GtkCList::set_row_data().
Back to GtkCTreeNode, which suddenly works (okay, compiles) when it's defined as either boxed or as an object in gtk-types.defs. That says to me that the generator probably doesn't know as much as it ought to know about gpointer, but it could be talking bs.
Any ideas? - I'd hate to have to write those 66 methods by hand.
- Steph
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Fw: [PHP-GTK-DEV] GtkCList, GtkCTree and memleaks
email.body:
OK, I took advice on this now (thanks Tony) and the memleaks are finally dead. Need to test clist, will commit tomorrow (I don't think there's anything contentious here - it's more or less the same behaviour we had before).
- Steph (gorn)
----- Original Message ----- From: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> To: "Andrei" <andrei@gravitonic.com> Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Saturday, December 17, 2005 10:05 PM Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] GtkCList, GtkCTree and memleaks
> Andrei, > > Looking into GtkCList and GtkCTree constructors, both of which need > overrides to avoid the '_with_titles' variant and to get some i18n > support. > The first bit of code below comes directly from the php-gtk1 overrides and > suffers from memory leaks: > > > target_hash = HASH_OF(php_titles); > titles = emalloc(sizeof(gchar *) * columns); > zend_hash_internal_pointer_reset(target_hash); > > while (zend_hash_get_current_data(target_hash, (void > **)&temp_title) > == SUCCESS) { > convert_to_string_ex(temp_title); > titles[i++] = estrndup(Z_STRVAL_PP(temp_title), > Z_STRLEN_PP(temp_title)); /* this leaks 1 byte per title char (+ 1) */ > zend_hash_move_forward(target_hash); > } > > The second bit of code is a much-reduced version of what I currently have: > > titles = emalloc(sizeof(gchar *) * columns); > zend_hash_internal_pointer_reset(Z_ARRVAL_P(php_titles)); > > while (zend_hash_get_current_data(Z_ARRVAL_P(php_titles), (void > **)&temp_title) == SUCCESS) { > convert_to_string_ex(temp_title); > titles[i++] = Z_STRVAL_PP(temp_title); /* this doesn't leak at > all, but it doesn't feel too safe either... */ > zend_hash_move_forward(Z_ARRVAL_P(php_titles)); > } > > Is it better to live with the leaks in this situation? Either way works, > for practical purposes... or is there a third way I didn't fall across > yet? > > - Steph > > (ISP's been broken all day following stormy weather here - sorry, you'll > be > getting everything at once from me :-\) > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >

email.subject: Re[2]: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PangoFontDescription::set_size
Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] PangoFontDescription::set_size
email.body:
Hi,
Sunday, December 11, 2005, 6:26:08 PM, you wrote: TR> Hi
TR> Been playing with pango and suggest a small change to TR> PangoFontDescription::set_size();
TR> Pango is expecting the size in pango_units.
TR> You can put in the constructor string:
TR> $fontdescription = new PangoFontDescription("Ariel 30");
TR> when you use $fontdescription->set_size(30); the resulting font size TR> is 0.29296875
TR> The patch to pango.overriodes will multiply the size by PANGO_SCALE TR> making the 2 methods match.
TR> I hope that makes sense :)
TR> I still haven't worked out how to make it find the Ariel font but TR> thats another story.
Another option would be to make the constant Gtk::PANGO_SCALE available. Then the function could be used as advertised.
$fontdescription->set_size(30 * Gtk::PANGO_SCALE);
-- regards, Tom

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] GtkListStore: Behavior of insert_before and insert_after should be
email.body:
Hello,
When writing the docs for GtkListStore, I noted the too C-ish style of insert_before and insert_after.
> insert_before($iter, $sibling) inserts a *new* row before $sibling, and changes the $iter to the new iterator. That pointer change is c-ish and not php-like.
IMO it should be that way: > $iter = $store->insert_before($sibling); or, with an optional parameter as insert() has: > $iter = $store->insert_before($sibling, array('value0', 'value1'));
So that one doesn't have to create an GtkTreeIter before one can insert a row before another one. (And we can't even create that on our own!)
The same applies to insert_after.
-- Regards/MfG, Christian Weiske
["signature.asc" (application/pgp-signature)]

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] GtkTreeIter comparison
email.body:
Hello all,
When trying to compare two GtkTreeIter, I always get true when using "==", and a false when using "===" for comparison - equal if they point to the same path or not. Is that a bug, or are TreeIters not meant to be compared?
-- Regards/MfG, Christian Weiske
["signature.asc" (application/pgp-signature)]

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] GtkTreeModel::iter_n_children behavior has to be changed
email.body:
Hello,
Another c-ish method: > $store->iter_nth_child($iter, $parent, 0); sets $iter to the first child of $parent instead of returning it.
It should be that way: > $iter = $store->iter_nth_child($parent, 0);
-- Regards/MfG, Christian Weiske
["signature.asc" (application/pgp-signature)]

email.body:
Christian, hi and happy holidays -
I just picked up five bug reports (or 'wrong behaviour' reports') from you, all of which came without any scripts to run so we can see exactly what you're doing and what you're seeing.
You obviously have some script there - how about attaching enough of it for us to run next time? (Or put it in the /tests dir as a bug testing script.)
Thanks,
- Steph

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: [PHP-GTK] Dev_Inspector
email.body:
Christian,
> What it not does, is adding reflection information for hand written > methods as some constructors. This has to be done by hand, and I am the > one responsible for it. I only can promise to do that some days after > christmas; but until then you have to take other sources for doccing.
Perhaps I can help you out here. The parameters are already shown in php-gtk/ext/gtk+/gtk.defs. The only place where the parameters are not not mentioned are in the overrides. Will adding the parameters in gtk.overrides (for, say, GtkDialog?) be enough for the reflection browser to show the parameters?
I am not very good at reading source codes, this is my first time. Do correct me if I am wrong. We may be able to quickly document many classes if you have help at hand!
Regards, -- Anant Narayanan ------------------------- Find Freedom! http://www.kix.in/

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Extending PHP-Gtk2
email.body:
Hello All!
I just stumbled upon something called a GtkSourceView. It's an interesting extension to the GtkTextView widget. (http://gtksourceview.sourceforge.net/)
Chances are many of you would of heard of it already. How about implementing it in PHP-Gtk2? (pyGtk has! :-))
I'd really like to help out, but all that C code makes my head spin. If someone could just give an intro as to how exactly classes are implemented... maybe I could help.
Anyway, just an idea. Thought it would add some more value.
Wishing everyone a bashing New Year!
Regards, -- Anant Narayanan ------------------------- Find Freedom! http://www.kix.in/

Simon: can we just check what you mean by 'correct version' here?
Under win32 there were three ATK releases with the same version numbering (to my knowledge) that aren't actually the same, so - fairly or otherwise - I'd tend to suspect a touch of messiness over the RC.

> Hi , I can build on debian (xandros) but only after editing configure > directly to remove any checks for atk version , atk is correct version > but whatever method configure uses for checking this version does not > work (at least on my debian) > > PyGTK 2.6 builds without such problems so I don't think its my system?? > > > Any Ideas ? > > Regards, > Simon. > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] guint64, gint64, AtkState?
email.body:
Hi again Andrei,
I've been looking at the handful of items that aren't being generated in ATK currently.
One of the simplest-looking methods to fix probably doesn't need an override - it's just that we don't define guint64 or gint64 anywhere, and AtkState is a guint64 type.
There doesn't seem to be anywhere else in GTK+ these are needed (in the sense that we need to know about them for args). Both types are used throughout glib, in a handful of private and 'semi-private' GtkFileSystem methods, and within the GtkTreeDataList struct, but nowhere else public.
My compiler's happy if I simply add AtkState to the IntArg() list in the generator (making it "i", long, and cast to AtkState for the ATK call only). Is that approach kosher, or do I need to define the AtkState type as an OS-specific unsigned long long/__int64 in the overrides and write the function manually? If the latter, what should I give it where the generator presents "i", given that win32 treats long as 32-bit even in a 64-bit compile in PHP?
- Steph
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Open Letter to Christian
email.body:
Let me give your scripts/howto a whirl and we will go from there. Steph's email about dependencies is gonna be an issue, but if I have a list of what those dependencies exactly are it shouldn't be too hard to work up an autoconf script to handle that (Andrei's big concern). Andrei gave me a list of requirements for the docs that he sees necessary to get them up on gtk.php.net. Unfortunately I don't have those on me at the moment, but I will try and get those sent off by tomorrow (since I leave Friday morning for Frankfurt). I land in Frankfurt at noon on Saturday and will be available to meet with anyone who wants to meet any time between then and Wednesday evening (I leave for Rome before dawn on Thursday, so won't be up super late on Wed).
-Jeremy
On 11/2/05, Christian Weiske <cweiske@cweiske.de> wrote: > Jeremy, > > > > I apologize for having to call this out in public, but I can't get a > > response to my emails to you. > Never got one :/ My spamfilter tells me there were none in the last 3 days. > > > What I am needing is a list of changes (in as > > much detail as possible) > - Restructured the whole directory: > - manual files aren't directly in the root any more, there is a > manual/ dir with the base files and all language dirs beneath it > - There are an example/ and an images/ directory with - examples and > images > - no utf-8 dir any more. All doc files have to be written in utf-8, so > there's no need to convert them. > - Stylesheets have changed internally, but nothing you'd see from > outside. > - the build/ dir still has language subdirs, and below them are the > "type" subdirs (html, phpweb, ...) > - phpweb won't work from the start; at least I haven't tried it yet > - there are no config and no make files any more; I don't like them > and I don't know how to make them. You volunteered to do them some > months ago, but you missed it, right? However, there is a > gen_manual.sh file which does all that. Just call it without any > params, and it will show you some help. > - There is a runfirst.sh script you'll need to run first > - build files (at least html ones) are distributed over several > directories after compilation has finished. That makes browsing the > dirs much more easy, because there aren't 2000+ files in one dir > any more. > - I wrote a "doc compilation" howto: > http://docs.crisscott.com/php-gtk/tutorials/tutorials.doccing.checkout.html > > We can talk at the php lounge tuesday evening, ok? > > > > > which you made between the old style docs and the > > new style docs. I know you sent out an email about it a while back (like 6 > > months ago), but I can't seem to find it. > http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=php-gtk-doc&m=111316563116664&w=2 > was at gtk.php.net home page :) > > > automated building of the docs to happen like it did before (so we can have > > them hosted on gtk.php.net <http://gtk.php.net>), but without knowing > > everything you changed (file system structure, build settings, etc) it is > > rather difficult. > I use the following script: > kindergarten@dojo ~ $ cat /data/Programming/php-gtk2-doc/recompile_docs.sh > #!/bin/sh > # checkout or update php-gtk-doc and compile it > # for cweiske.dyndns.org > > cd "`dirname "$0"`" > echo "Updating php-gtk-doc from CVS" > if [ ! -d php-gtk-doc ]; then > #does not exist - check out > cvs -d :pserver:cvsread@cvs.php.net:/repository co -P php-gtk-doc > cd php-gtk-doc > #init > ./runfirst.sh > else > #does exist - update > cd php-gtk-doc > cvs -d :pserver:cvsread@cvs.php.net:/repository update -Pd > fi > > echo "Done updating from CVS, generating manual" > ./runfirst.sh > ./gen_manual.sh en html > > echo "Moving generated manual to apache document directory" > #we're in php-gtk-doc directory > #move to /data/Programming/apache/php-gtk2-doc > rm -r /data/Programming/apache/php-gtk2-doc/* > mv build/* /data/Programming/apache/php-gtk2-doc/ > > echo "AddDefaultCharset UTF-8" > > /data/Programming/apache/php-gtk2-doc/.htaccess > > > -- > Regards/MfG, > Christian Weiske > > >
-- --------------------------- Jeremy Johnstone http://www.jeremyjohnstone.com jsjohnst@php.net
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

On Nov 5, 2005, at 7:10 AM, Steph Fox wrote:
> Andrei, > > I still think the gtktreepath functions are extremely useful in > iteration - > especially to_string(), but also the ways gtktreepath offers of > manoeveuring > between next/prev/up/down. Can I please commit that 'boxed > treepath' patch? > > - Steph > > ----- Original Message ----- > From: "Andrei Zmievski" <andrei@php.net> > To: <php-gtk-cvs@lists.php.net> > Sent: Saturday, November 05, 2005 4:37 AM > Subject: [php-gtk-cvs] cvs: php-gtk /ext/gtk+ gtktreeview.overrides > > > >> andrei Fri Nov 4 23:37:45 2005 EDT >> >> Modified files: >> /php-gtk/ext/gtk+ gtktreeview.overrides >> Log: >> Make GtkTreeModel::iter_next() return the next iterator _without_ >> changing the input one. >> >> >> >> > http://cvs.php.net/diff.php/php-gtk/ext/gtk+/gtktreeview.overrides? > r1=1.22&r2=1.23&ty=u > >> Index: php-gtk/ext/gtk+/gtktreeview.overrides >> diff -u php-gtk/ext/gtk+/gtktreeview.overrides:1.22 >> > php-gtk/ext/gtk+/gtktreeview.overrides:1.23 > >> --- php-gtk/ext/gtk+/gtktreeview.overrides:1.22 Wed Nov 2 >> 15:31:32 2005 >> +++ php-gtk/ext/gtk+/gtktreeview.overrides Fri Nov 4 23:37:43 2005 >> @@ -584,7 +584,7 @@ >> override gtk_tree_model_iter_next >> PHP_METHOD >> { >> - GtkTreeIter *iter; >> + GtkTreeIter iter; >> zval *php_iter; >> >> NOT_STATIC_METHOD(); >> @@ -592,13 +592,13 @@ >> if (!php_gtk_parse_args(ZEND_NUM_ARGS(), "O", &php_iter, >> > gtktreeiter_ce)) > >> return; >> >> - iter = (GtkTreeIter *) PHPG_GBOXED(php_iter); >> + iter = *(GtkTreeIter *) PHPG_GBOXED(php_iter); >> >> - if (!gtk_tree_model_iter_next(GTK_TREE_MODEL(PHPG_GOBJECT >> (this_ptr)), >> > iter)) { > >> - RETURN_FALSE; >> + if (gtk_tree_model_iter_next(GTK_TREE_MODEL(PHPG_GOBJECT >> (this_ptr)), >> > &iter)) { > >> + phpg_gboxed_new(&return_value, GTK_TYPE_TREE_ITER, &iter, >> TRUE, >> > TRUE TSRMLS_CC); > >> + } else { >> + RETURN_NULL(); >> } >> - >> - phpg_gboxed_new(&return_value, GTK_TYPE_TREE_ITER, &iter, >> TRUE, TRUE >> > TSRMLS_CC); > >> } >> >> %% >> >> -- >> PHP-GTK CVS Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) >> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >> >

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] libglade connections
email.body:
Hey Sjoerd,
It's OK, we're not planning on making the XML unreadable :)
- Steph (having finally made it home from Frankfurt/Paris)
----- Original Message ----- From: "Sjoerd Linders" <sjoerd@funsoftware.nl> To: "'PHP-GTK dev'" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Tuesday, November 08, 2005 10:53 AM Subject: RE: [PHP-GTK-DEV] libglade connections
> >From: Steph Fox > >Glade simply makes -> into -> in the generated file, so we could even > use > >that as the 'identifier' tag directly. The only trouble with going > >non-standard in this way would be that wrappers written in other languages > >won't be able to use glade files written for use with PHP... (but then we > >already have that issue through having :: rather than _ for internal static > >calls, so how much do we care about it?) > > Please make sure that it always will meet the XML-standards, > don't mess with that everybody will depent on it, especially me! > > Keep up the good work! > > friendly regard, > Sjoerd Linders > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Handling Return Key Presses
[PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: [PHP-GTK-DOC] Some Queries...
email.body:
Anant,
> Another small problem with the program. I've already posted it on the > dev mailing list: > Please do clarify that. That's an internal php-gtk2 error which needs to be fixed in the sources ---------
There is no problem when the button is 'clicked', the text is properly echoed. However when you use the 'return' key:
Warning: PHP-GTK internal error: unsupported type (null) in F:\xampp\htdocs\GTKDoc\my-php-gtk-doc\examples\reference\gtk\gtkentry\constructor.phpw on line 42
Warning: Could not convert return value of signal callback 'get_input' to '(null)' in F:\xampp\htdocs\GTKDoc\my-php-gtk-doc\examples\reference\gtk\gtkentry\cons tructor.phpw on line 42
PS: Please deactivate HTML in your mails as well.
-- Regards/MfG, Christian Weiske

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] GtkButton and use_underline - wrong default?
email.body:
Uhhh, the "use_underline" property of GtkButton seems to be defaulting to true instead of false, although acording to the Gtk+ ref., it should be the other way around:
$button = new GtkButton('An_Example'); var_dump($button->get_use_underline());
This spits out "bool(true)".
-Jp
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] GtkButton and use_underline - wrong default?
email.body:
Hi Jp,
Yes, I made it that way because it's more convenient for people using mnemonics. To kill it you need to have 0 as the second param.
(Same with menu items.)
One good reason to test everything ;)
- Steph
----- Original Message ----- From: "Jp" <jp@jp-corner.uni.cc> To: <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Wednesday, November 02, 2005 5:22 PM Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] GtkButton and use_underline - wrong default?
> Uhhh, the "use_underline" property of GtkButton seems to be defaulting > to true instead of false, although acording to the Gtk+ ref., it should > be the other way around: > > $button = new GtkButton('An_Example'); > var_dump($button->get_use_underline()); > > This spits out "bool(true)". > > -Jp > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Getting a function definition?
email.body:
Hi all,
is there an easy way (that doesn't involve dwelving into lines and lines of code) to find the prototype of a function/method in PHP-GTK2? One of those "void set_label(string label = NULL);" things?...
This is mainly because there are a few functions in the manual that I'm not sure if they are correct, while others are missing the default arguments.
Thanks,
-Jp
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Open Letter to Christian
email.body:
Hey Christian,
I apologize for having to call this out in public, but I can't get a response to my emails to you. What I am needing is a list of changes (in as much detail as possible) which you made between the old style docs and the new style docs. I know you sent out an email about it a while back (like 6 months ago), but I can't seem to find it. I am really wanting to get the automated building of the docs to happen like it did before (so we can have them hosted on gtk.php.net <http://gtk.php.net>), but without knowing everything you changed (file system structure, build settings, etc) it is rather difficult. Please reply with that list (including even minor tweaks) so I can move forward with this.
-Jeremy
-- --------------------------- Jeremy Johnstone http://www.jeremyjohnstone.com jsjohnst@php.net

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] libglade connections
email.body:
Andrei,
I just tested some of the changes using a bog-standard no-clever-object-business test script. signal_autoconnect() works for everything except static calls (i.e. gtk::main_quit doesn't work any more), no leaks, congrats (but can we have our static support back please? - since Glade actually encourages it. At present it's seen as a straight connect() - it needs to go as connect_simple()).
signal_connect() crashes whatever you try to do to it, haven't investigated why yet.
Mind if I play?
- Steph
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

Statics still weird. I don't get the '-' reference...

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Trouble compiling on 2005-11-18
email.body:
Hi everyone
I'm stuck during php-gtk compilation on Suse Pro 9.3. I am re-following the instructions on 'http://gtk.php.net/wiki/PhpGtk2/InstallingOnUnix'. Everything went fine until making php-gtk after a recent cvs checkout. I am not a gcc guru, but I will do anything to help debug, etc. since I love the PHP-GTK project so much! Therefore, please let me know if there is any testing, etc (or any other humble/non-guru work) that I can do, or where I can lend a more general hand of help to you guys with the PHP-GTK2 project.
This is where I got stuck during make:
gcc -I/root/temp/php-5-1-cvs/php-gtk/main -I. -I/root/temp/php-5-1-cvs/php-gtk -DPHP_ATOM_INC -I/root/temp/php-5-1-cvs/php-gtk/include -I/root/temp/php-5-1-cvs/php-gtk/main -I/root/temp/php-5-1-cvs/php-gtk -I/opt/php_5_1/include/php -I/opt/php_5_1/include/php/main -I/opt/php_5_1/include/php/TSRM -I/opt/php_5_1/include/php/Zend -I/opt/php_5_1/include/php/ext -I/opt/gnome/include/glib-2.0 -I/opt/gnome/lib/glib-2.0/include -I/opt/gnome/include/gtk-2.0 -I/opt/gnome/lib/gtk-2.0/include -I/usr/X11R6/include -I/opt/gnome/include/atk-1.0 -I/opt/gnome/include/pango-1.0 -I/usr/include/freetype2 -I/usr/include/freetype2/config -DHAVE_CONFIG_H -g -O2 -c /root/temp/php-5-1-cvs/php-gtk/main/phpg_support.c -fPIC -DPIC -o main/.libs/phpg_support.o /root/temp/php-5-1-cvs/php-gtk/main/phpg_support.c: In function `phpg_init_object': /root/temp/php-5-1-cvs/php-gtk/main/phpg_support.c:246: error: structure has no member named `in_get' /root/temp/php-5-1-cvs/php-gtk/main/phpg_support.c:247: error: structure has no member named `in_set' make: *** [main/phpg_support.lo] Error 1
Is this a temporary problem?
Thank you for your time and effort, Werner
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Trouble compiling on 2005-11-18
email.body:
Werner wrote:
> Is this a temporary problem? > Ahhh. Rather, is this a version-specific problem?
When the offending lines are commented out, everything works fine, and while I was looking at the code, I wondered what version of GTK2 you are using? (I'm testing with gtk2-2.6.4-6).
Thank you for your time, Werner

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Trouble compiling on 2005-11-18
email.body:
You must be using the latest CVS version of PHP 5.1. There were some changes related to supporting recursive __get/__set handlers and I have not had a chance to update PHP-GTK correspondingly.
-Andrei

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Type to store anything in a GtkTreeStore/GtkListStore
email.body:
Hello all,
I'm wondering what type I could use to store any object/value of simple data type in a GtkTreeStore or GtkListStore. (PHP-Gtk2)
Currently I have the following code: > new GtkTreeStore(Gtk::TYPE_PHP_VALUE); which allows me to store any php object and array in the model. Downside is that I can't add GtkWidgets into it.
On the other side, if I do > new GtkTreeStore(Gtk::TYPE_OBJECT); I can add widgets, but no php objects or arrays.
For both, I can't add simple data types like strings, ints, floats and so on.
Is there a one-covers-all type I could use?
-- Regards/MfG, Christian Weiske
["signature.asc" (application/pgp-signature)]

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Type to store anything in a GtkTreeStore/GtkListStore
email.body:
Gtk::TYPE_PHP_VALUE is supposed to be able to store anything. What sort of problems do you run into with it?
- Andrei
On Nov 21, 2005, at 2:10 PM, Christian Weiske wrote:
> Hello all, > > > I'm wondering what type I could use to store any object/value of simple > data type in a GtkTreeStore or GtkListStore. (PHP-Gtk2) > > Currently I have the following code: >> new GtkTreeStore(Gtk::TYPE_PHP_VALUE); > which allows me to store any php object and array in the model. > Downside > is that I can't add GtkWidgets into it. > > On the other side, if I do >> new GtkTreeStore(Gtk::TYPE_OBJECT); > I can add widgets, but no php objects or arrays. > > For both, I can't add simple data types like strings, ints, floats and > so on. > > Is there a one-covers-all type I could use? > > -- > Regards/MfG, > Christian Weiske

$fac = &new GtkItemFactory( GtkMenuBar::get_type(), '<mainmenu>', $accelgroup);
is returning this error when I run it:
Fatal error: Call to undefined method GtkMenuBar::get_type() in D:\teste.php on line 13

email.body:
I did not send out the explanation of the stuff I did yesterday, I know. But to make gtk::main_quit() work you just prepend '-' before it, which means that it should use simple connection.
-Andrei

> Andrei, > > I just tested some of the changes using a bog-standard > no-clever-object-business test script. signal_autoconnect() works for > everything except static calls (i.e. gtk::main_quit doesn't work > any more), > no leaks, congrats (but can we have our static support back please? > - since > Glade actually encourages it. email.body:
Bah, thanks for consulting me too.
This is not as simple as it looks. Can you guarantee that any internal class method that .glade file may wish to connect to will need only simple connection? What if there are methods that actually need to have the signal widget?
-Andrei

What if there are methods that actually >> need to have the signal widget? >> >> -Andrei >> >> >> On Nov 5, 2005, at 10:22 AM, Steph Fox wrote: >> >> >>> Thanks to the irc gang (Rob, Wez, Derick), the need for a tag just >>> left the >>> building. >>> >>> All systems go :) >>> >>> ----- Original Message ----- >>> From: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> >>> To: "Andrei" <andrei@gravitonic.com> >>> Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> >>> Sent: Saturday, November 05, 2005 4:08 PM >>> Subject: Fw: [PHP-GTK-DEV] libglade connections >>> >>> >>> >>> >>>> ps signal_autoconnect_instance() is brilliant :) >>>> >>>> The only remaining problem's having to tag those statics, we >>>> shouldn't >>>> >>>> >>> need >>> >>> >>>> to do that. >>>> >>>> ----- Original Message ----- >>>> From: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> >>>> To: "Andrei" <andrei@gravitonic.com> >>>> Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> >>>> Sent: Saturday, November 05, 2005 3:59 PM >>>> Subject: Fw: [PHP-GTK-DEV] libglade connections >>>> >>>> >>>> >>>> >>>>> OK, crash gorn. >>>>> >>>>> Statics still weird. I don't get the '-' reference... >>>>> >>>>> ----- Original Message ----- >>>>> From: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> >>>>> To: "Andrei" <andrei@gravitonic.com> >>>>> Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> >>>>> Sent: Saturday, November 05, 2005 3:25 PM >>>>> Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] libglade connections >>>>> >>>>> >>>>> >>>>> >>>>>> Andrei, >>>>>> >>>>>> I just tested some of the changes using a bog-standard >>>>>> no-clever-object-business test script. signal_autoconnect() >>>>>> works for >>>>>> everything except static calls (i.e. gtk::main_quit doesn't work >>>>>> any >>>>>> >>>>>> >>>>> more), >>>>> >>>>> >>>>>> no leaks, congrats (but can we have our static support back >>>>>> please? - >>>>>> >>>>>> >>>>> since >>>>> >>>>> >>>>>> Glade actually encourages it. At present it's seen as a straight >>>>>> connect() - it needs to go as connect_simple()). >>>>>> >>>>>> signal_connect() crashes whatever you try to do to it, haven't >>>>>> >>>>>> >>>>> investigated >>>>> >>>>> >>>>>> why yet. >>>>>> >>>>>> Mind if I play? >>>>>> >>>>>> - Steph >>>>>> >>>>>> -- >>>>>> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) >>>>>> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >>>>>> >>>>>> >>>>>> >>>>> >>>>> -- >>>>> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) >>>>> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >>>>> >>>>> >>>>> >>>> >>>> -- >>>> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) >>>> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >>>> >>>> >>> >>> >> >> > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] libglade connections
email.body:
Hey Andrei,
OK, I tried to think of one example when a calling object might need to be carried as part of the signal to a _static_ function or method, and I honestly can't. Heck, Glade 2 doesn't even allow for it, and I can't think of anywhere GTK+ does either, and this is a wrapper around libglade _as it exists_, not as it may be in the future.
Where the calling object's passed to the callback with the signal, it's never a static call. How could it be? How could you have $window->Gtk::main()? You might have a callback like GtkContainer::do_stuff($container), but that's catered for...
If you (or anyone?) can come up with any serious examples that render those arguments invalid, please do so and I'll revert (albeit unhappily, because I think the existing solution's a good one). Remember, this doesn't affect static methods belonging to classes created in user space - it's purely about internal class methods.
- Steph
----- Original Message ----- From: "Andrei Zmievski" <andrei@gravitonic.com> To: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Sunday, November 06, 2005 9:15 PM Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] libglade connections
> "640k should be enough for everybody" > > -Andrei > > > On Nov 5, 2005, at 10:47 AM, Steph Fox wrote: > > > There should never be any... put it this way, there never have been. > > > > ----- Original Message ----- > > From: "Andrei Zmievski" <andrei@gravitonic.com> > > To: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> > > Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> > > Sent: Saturday, November 05, 2005 6:40 PM > > Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] libglade connections > > > > > > > >> Bah, thanks for consulting me too. > >> > >> This is not as simple as it looks. email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] libglade connections
email.body:
Hey,
I don't have time to research it right now. But I had an idea for another type of signal connection, if you actually wanted to connect to a method of a Glade object. Suppose you have a button called 'button1' which is inside a window called 'window1'. And you wanted to connect button1's "clicked" signal so that it invokes window1's destroy() method. In regular PHP-GTK you would do:
$button->connect_simple('clicked', array($window, 'destroy'));
In Glade I think we can do it by specifying the handler as "window1->destroy". I can easily write code to parse this and connect things properly. But here we do need to differentiate between simple and normal connections (or even replaced ones), so prefixing it with something may be useful.
-Andrei
On Nov 7, 2005, at 1:54 AM, Steph Fox wrote:
> Hey Andrei, > > OK, I tried to think of one example when a calling object might need > to be > carried as part of the signal to a _static_ function or method, and I > honestly can't. Heck, Glade 2 doesn't even allow for it, and I can't > think > of anywhere GTK+ does either, and this is a wrapper around libglade > _as it > exists_, not as it may be in the future. > > Where the calling object's passed to the callback with the signal, it's > never a static call. How could it be? How could you have > $window->Gtk::main()? You might have a callback like > GtkContainer::do_stuff($container), but that's catered for... > > If you (or anyone?) can come up with any serious examples that render > those > arguments invalid, please do so and I'll revert (albeit unhappily, > because I > think the existing solution's a good one). Remember, this doesn't > affect > static methods belonging to classes created in user space - it's purely > about internal class methods. > > - Steph > > > ----- Original Message ----- > From: "Andrei Zmievski" <andrei@gravitonic.com> > To: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> > Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> > Sent: Sunday, November 06, 2005 9:15 PM > Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] libglade connections > > >> "640k should be enough for everybody" >> >> -Andrei >> >> >> On Nov 5, 2005, at 10:47 AM, Steph Fox wrote: >> >>> There should never be any... put it this way, there never have been. >>> >>> ----- Original Message ----- >>> From: "Andrei Zmievski" <andrei@gravitonic.com> >>> To: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> >>> Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> >>> Sent: Saturday, November 05, 2005 6:40 PM >>> Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] libglade connections >>> >>> >>> >>>> Bah, thanks for consulting me too. >>>> >>>> This is not as simple as it looks. Can you guarantee that any >>>> internal class method that .glade file may wish to connect to will >>>> need only simple connection? What if there are methods that actually >>>> need to have the signal widget? >>>> >>>> -Andrei >>>> >>>> >>>> On Nov 5, 2005, at 10:22 AM, Steph Fox wrote: >>>> >>>> >>>>> Thanks to the irc gang (Rob, Wez, Derick), the need for a tag just >>>>> left the >>>>> building. >>>>> >>>>> All systems go :) >>>>> >>>>> ----- Original Message ----- >>>>> From: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> >>>>> To: "Andrei" <andrei@gravitonic.com> >>>>> Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> >>>>> Sent: Saturday, November 05, 2005 4:08 PM >>>>> Subject: Fw: [PHP-GTK-DEV] libglade connections >>>>> >>>>> >>>>> >>>>> >>>>>> ps signal_autoconnect_instance() is brilliant :) >>>>>> >>>>>> The only remaining problem's having to tag those statics, we >>>>>> shouldn't >>>>>> >>>>>> >>>>> need >>>>> >>>>> >>>>>> to do that. >>>>>> >>>>>> ----- Original Message ----- >>>>>> From: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> >>>>>> To: "Andrei" <andrei@gravitonic.com> >>>>>> Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> >>>>>> Sent: Saturday, November 05, 2005 3:59 PM >>>>>> Subject: Fw: [PHP-GTK-DEV] libglade connections >>>>>> >>>>>> >>>>>> >>>>>> >>>>>>> OK, crash gorn. >>>>>>> >>>>>>> Statics still weird. I don't get the '-' reference... >>>>>>> >>>>>>> ----- Original Message ----- >>>>>>> From: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> >>>>>>> To: "Andrei" <andrei@gravitonic.com> >>>>>>> Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> >>>>>>> Sent: Saturday, November 05, 2005 3:25 PM >>>>>>> Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] libglade connections >>>>>>> >>>>>>> >>>>>>> >>>>>>> >>>>>>>> Andrei, >>>>>>>> >>>>>>>> I just tested some of the changes using a bog-standard >>>>>>>> no-clever-object-business test script. signal_autoconnect() >>>>>>>> works for >>>>>>>> everything except static calls (i.e. gtk::main_quit doesn't work >>>>>>>> any >>>>>>>> >>>>>>>> >>>>>>> more), >>>>>>> >>>>>>> >>>>>>>> no leaks, congrats (but can we have our static support back >>>>>>>> please? - >>>>>>>> >>>>>>>> >>>>>>> since >>>>>>> >>>>>>> >>>>>>>> Glade actually encourages it. At present it's seen as a >>>>>>>> straight >>>>>>>> connect() - it needs to go as connect_simple()). >>>>>>>> >>>>>>>> signal_connect() crashes whatever you try to do to it, haven't >>>>>>>> >>>>>>>> >>>>>>> investigated >>>>>>> >>>>>>> >>>>>>>> why yet. >>>>>>>> >>>>>>>> Mind if I play? >>>>>>>> >>>>>>>> - Steph >>>>>>>> >>>>>>>> -- >>>>>>>> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) >>>>>>>> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >>>>>>>> >>>>>>>> >>>>>>>> >>>>>>> >>>>>>> -- >>>>>>> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) >>>>>>> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >>>>>>> >>>>>>> >>>>>>> >>>>>> >>>>>> -- >>>>>> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) >>>>>> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >>>>>> >>>>>> >>>>> >>>>> >>>> >>>> >>> >>> -- >>> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) >>> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >>> >>

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] libglade connections
email.body:
hmm, that'd cut out the middle-man alright...
We already have the ability to do that with static methods, but it would be kind of nice to be able to do it for non-static calls too. It'd save devs having to write a lot of tiny functions and pass objects to them via autoconnect arrays...
Glade simply makes -> into -> in the generated file, so we could even use that as the 'identifier' tag directly. The only trouble with going non-standard in this way would be that wrappers written in other languages won't be able to use glade files written for use with PHP... (but then we already have that issue through having :: rather than _ for internal static calls, so how much do we care about it?)
The only problem I can see isn't one of implementation, it's back to the 'design vs development' discussion we had a few weeks back, probably off-list, I don't remember. We're heading further from what Glade actually does here, which is to offer a range of potential static GTK+ handlers for the given widget, or a default signal handler name if none is chosen. The further we get from that, the less Glade is a design tool and the more it becomes a programming tool. But TBH I don't think signal handlers should really be in the sphere of design anyway... so my gut instinct is 'yeah, sounds like a great idea Andrei!'
All that said, I can't get signal_autoconnect() to work properly in the 'array of arrays' sense here, although it's fine in every other respect. Jeremy - if you're staring into space a lot at the conference, would you mind testing it properly? It's possible (nay, downright likely) I'm doing some Bad Thing on the glade/php side when I try.
- Steph
----- Original Message ----- From: "Andrei Zmievski" <andrei@gravitonic.com> To: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Monday, November 07, 2005 6:37 PM Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] libglade connections
> Hey, > > I don't have time to research it right now. But I had an idea for > another type of signal connection, if you actually wanted to connect to > a method of a Glade object. Suppose you have a button called 'button1' > which is inside a window called 'window1'. And you wanted to connect > button1's "clicked" signal so that it invokes window1's destroy() > method. In regular PHP-GTK you would do: > > $button->connect_simple('clicked', array($window, 'destroy')); > > In Glade I think we can do it by specifying the handler as > "window1->destroy". I can easily write code to parse this and connect > things properly. But here we do need to differentiate between simple > and normal connections (or even replaced ones), so prefixing it with > something may be useful. > > -Andrei > > On Nov 7, 2005, at 1:54 AM, Steph Fox wrote: > > > Hey Andrei, > > > > OK, I tried to think of one example when a calling object might need > > to be > > carried as part of the signal to a _static_ function or method, and I > > honestly can't. Heck, Glade 2 doesn't even allow for it, and I can't > > think > > of anywhere GTK+ does either, and this is a wrapper around libglade > > _as it > > exists_, not as it may be in the future. > > > > Where the calling object's passed to the callback with the signal, it's > > never a static call. How could it be? How could you have > > $window->Gtk::main()? You might have a callback like > > GtkContainer::do_stuff($container), but that's catered for... > > > > If you (or anyone?) can come up with any serious examples that render > > those > > arguments invalid, please do so and I'll revert (albeit unhappily, > > because I > > think the existing solution's a good one). Remember, this doesn't > > affect > > static methods belonging to classes created in user space - it's purely > > about internal class methods. > > > > - Steph > > > > > > ----- Original Message ----- > > From: "Andrei Zmievski" <andrei@gravitonic.com> > > To: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> > > Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> > > Sent: Sunday, November 06, 2005 9:15 PM > > Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] libglade connections > > > > > >> "640k should be enough for everybody" > >> > >> -Andrei > >> > >> > >> On Nov 5, 2005, at 10:47 AM, Steph Fox wrote: > >> > >>> There should never be any... put it this way, there never have been. > >>> > >>> ----- Original Message ----- > >>> From: "Andrei Zmievski" <andrei@gravitonic.com> > >>> To: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> > >>> Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> > >>> Sent: Saturday, November 05, 2005 6:40 PM > >>> Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] libglade connections > >>> > >>> > >>> > >>>> Bah, thanks for consulting me too. > >>>> > >>>> This is not as simple as it looks. Can you guarantee that any > >>>> internal class method that .glade file may wish to connect to will > >>>> need only simple connection? What if there are methods that actually > >>>> need to have the signal widget? > >>>> > >>>> -Andrei > >>>> > >>>> > >>>> On Nov 5, 2005, at 10:22 AM, Steph Fox wrote: > >>>> > >>>> > >>>>> Thanks to the irc gang (Rob, Wez, Derick), the need for a tag just > >>>>> left the > >>>>> building. > >>>>> > >>>>> All systems go :) > >>>>> > >>>>> ----- Original Message ----- > >>>>> From: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> > >>>>> To: "Andrei" <andrei@gravitonic.com> > >>>>> Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> > >>>>> Sent: Saturday, November 05, 2005 4:08 PM > >>>>> Subject: Fw: [PHP-GTK-DEV] libglade connections > >>>>> > >>>>> > >>>>> > >>>>> > >>>>>> ps signal_autoconnect_instance() is brilliant :) > >>>>>> > >>>>>> The only remaining problem's having to tag those statics, we > >>>>>> shouldn't > >>>>>> > >>>>>> > >>>>> need > >>>>> > >>>>> > >>>>>> to do that. > >>>>>> > >>>>>> ----- Original Message ----- > >>>>>> From: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> > >>>>>> To: "Andrei" <andrei@gravitonic.com> > >>>>>> Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> > >>>>>> Sent: Saturday, November 05, 2005 3:59 PM > >>>>>> Subject: Fw: [PHP-GTK-DEV] libglade connections > >>>>>> > >>>>>> > >>>>>> > >>>>>> > >>>>>>> OK, crash gorn. > >>>>>>> > >>>>>>> Statics still weird. I don't get the '-' reference... > >>>>>>> > >>>>>>> ----- Original Message ----- > >>>>>>> From: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> > >>>>>>> To: "Andrei" <andrei@gravitonic.com> > >>>>>>> Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> > >>>>>>> Sent: Saturday, November 05, 2005 3:25 PM > >>>>>>> Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] libglade connections > >>>>>>> > >>>>>>> > >>>>>>> > >>>>>>> > >>>>>>>> Andrei, > >>>>>>>> > >>>>>>>> I just tested some of the changes using a bog-standard > >>>>>>>> no-clever-object-business test script. signal_autoconnect() > >>>>>>>> works for > >>>>>>>> everything except static calls (i.e. gtk::main_quit doesn't work > >>>>>>>> any > >>>>>>>> > >>>>>>>> > >>>>>>> more), > >>>>>>> > >>>>>>> > >>>>>>>> no leaks, congrats (but can we have our static support back > >>>>>>>> please? - > >>>>>>>> > >>>>>>>> > >>>>>>> since > >>>>>>> > >>>>>>> > >>>>>>>> Glade actually encourages it. At present it's seen as a > >>>>>>>> straight > >>>>>>>> connect() - it needs to go as connect_simple()). > >>>>>>>> > >>>>>>>> signal_connect() crashes whatever you try to do to it, haven't > >>>>>>>> > >>>>>>>> > >>>>>>> investigated > >>>>>>> > >>>>>>> > >>>>>>>> why yet. > >>>>>>>> > >>>>>>>> Mind if I play? > >>>>>>>> > >>>>>>>> - Steph > >>>>>>>> > >>>>>>>> -- > >>>>>>>> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > >>>>>>>> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > >>>>>>>> > >>>>>>>> > >>>>>>>> > >>>>>>> > >>>>>>> -- > >>>>>>> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > >>>>>>> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > >>>>>>> > >>>>>>> > >>>>>>> > >>>>>> > >>>>>> -- > >>>>>> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > >>>>>> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > >>>>>> > >>>>>> > >>>>> > >>>>> > >>>> > >>>> > >>> > >>> -- > >>> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > >>> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > >>> > >> > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Open Letter to Christian
email.body:
Jeremy,
I can probably help some with that - I ended up rewriting most of the old docs build system, and have built the new locally. I still have karma for systems work, just no shell access.
The bigger question is what exactly you're planning to do about the manuals, given that there are two sets and only one of them can sanely be 'the manual' in the sense of being default search area etc etc etc...
- Steph
ps I'm planning to storm the gates of Frankfurt next week... still trying to figure out how ;)
----- Original Message ----- From: "Jeremy Johnstone" <phpdev@gmail.com> To: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net>; "Christian Weiske" <cweiske@cweiske.de> Sent: Wednesday, November 02, 2005 9:44 PM Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Open Letter to Christian
Hey Christian,
I apologize for having to call this out in public, but I can't get a response to my emails to you. What I am needing is a list of changes (in as much detail as possible) which you made between the old style docs and the new style docs. I know you sent out an email about it a while back (like 6 months ago), but I can't seem to find it. I am really wanting to get the automated building of the docs to happen like it did before (so we can have them hosted on gtk.php.net <http://gtk.php.net>), but without knowing everything you changed (file system structure, build settings, etc) it is rather difficult. Please reply with that list (including even minor tweaks) so I can move forward with this.
-Jeremy
-- --------------------------- Jeremy Johnstone http://www.jeremyjohnstone.com jsjohnst@php.net
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Open Letter to Christian
email.body:
Steph,
> ps I'm planning to storm the gates of Frankfurt next week... still trying to > figure out how ;) Hey, you're coming? Cool! I'll be there tuesday and wednesday, the talk days - S&S finally gave me the ticket after I promised them to write a second article...
Btw, they have a "php lounge" this time on tuesday after the lectures, so we can have free beer while chatting and hacking :)
I'm staying with a friend of mine. If you absolutely don't find somewhere to stay, I can ask him - just don't know if there is enough space in his little student's flat.
Who else, beside Jeremy, is coming?
-- Regards/MfG, Christian Weiske
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Open Letter to Christian
email.body:
Jeremy,
> I apologize for having to call this out in public, but I can't get a > response to my emails to you. Never got one :/ My spamfilter tells me there were none in the last 3 days.
> What I am needing is a list of changes (in as > much detail as possible) - Restructured the whole directory: - manual files aren't directly in the root any more, there is a manual/ dir with the base files and all language dirs beneath it - There are an example/ and an images/ directory with - examples and images - no utf-8 dir any more. All doc files have to be written in utf-8, so there's no need to convert them. - Stylesheets have changed internally, but nothing you'd see from outside. - the build/ dir still has language subdirs, and below them are the "type" subdirs (html, phpweb, ...) - phpweb won't work from the start; at least I haven't tried it yet - there are no config and no make files any more; I don't like them and I don't know how to make them. You volunteered to do them some months ago, but you missed it, right? However, there is a gen_manual.sh file which does all that. Just call it without any params, and it will show you some help. - There is a runfirst.sh script you'll need to run first - build files (at least html ones) are distributed over several directories after compilation has finished. That makes browsing the dirs much more easy, because there aren't 2000+ files in one dir any more. - I wrote a "doc compilation" howto: http://docs.crisscott.com/php-gtk/tutorials/tutorials.doccing.checkout.html
We can talk at the php lounge tuesday evening, ok?
> which you made between the old style docs and the > new style docs. I know you sent out an email about it a while back (like 6 > months ago), but I can't seem to find it. http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=php-gtk-doc&m=111316563116664&w=2 was at gtk.php.net home page :)
> automated building of the docs to happen like it did before (so we can have > them hosted on gtk.php.net <http://gtk.php.net>), but without knowing > everything you changed (file system structure, build settings, etc) it is > rather difficult. I use the following script: kindergarten@dojo ~ $ cat /data/Programming/php-gtk2-doc/recompile_docs.sh #!/bin/sh # checkout or update php-gtk-doc and compile it # for cweiske.dyndns.org
cd "`dirname "$0"`" echo "Updating php-gtk-doc from CVS" if [ ! -d php-gtk-doc ]; then #does not exist - check out cvs -d :pserver:cvsread@cvs.php.net:/repository co -P php-gtk-doc cd php-gtk-doc #init ./runfirst.sh else #does exist - update cd php-gtk-doc cvs -d :pserver:cvsread@cvs.php.net:/repository update -Pd fi
echo "Done updating from CVS, generating manual" ./runfirst.sh ./gen_manual.sh en html
echo "Moving generated manual to apache document directory" #we're in php-gtk-doc directory #move to /data/Programming/apache/php-gtk2-doc rm -r /data/Programming/apache/php-gtk2-doc/* mv build/* /data/Programming/apache/php-gtk2-doc/
echo "AddDefaultCharset UTF-8" > /data/Programming/apache/php-gtk2-doc/.htaccess
-- Regards/MfG, Christian Weiske
["signature.asc" (application/pgp-signature)]

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Getting a function definition?
email.body:
Not really, no.
You don't need to delve into 'lines and lines of code' though. Just search on whatever you're looking for. Try the respective overrides file first (i.e. gtk.overrides if you're looking at a GTK function), and if it's not there you'll know that whatever's in the gtk.defs file is correct.
('course you could skip the aggro of going through two files by just checking gen_gtk.c instead... but if you didn't build your own copy of php-gtk you won't have that option.)
----- Original Message ----- From: "Jp" <jp@jp-corner.uni.cc> To: <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Wednesday, November 02, 2005 10:54 PM Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Getting a function definition?
> Hi all, > > is there an easy way (that doesn't involve dwelving into lines and lines > of code) to find the prototype of a function/method in PHP-GTK2? One of > those "void set_label(string label = NULL);" things?... > > This is mainly because there are a few functions in the manual that I'm > not sure if they are correct, while others are missing the default > arguments. > > Thanks, > > -Jp > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php
